loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides for his farm so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Melania is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins.

Melania has been raising pig for 15 years and also earns additional income from direct selling beauty product.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins to keep her pigs healthy

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruby is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ruby has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her business.

Ruby has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for other maintenance for her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell beauty products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Veronica is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc. for her buy and sell beauty products business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc.to help with her children's education

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Grupo  “Dios es mi Fortaleza” este grupo constituido por 4 mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y emprendedoras, solicitan por décima vez crédito a ADIM, para el financiamientos de sus negocios.
Su coordinadora Johana, de 44 años, Casada y responsable de sacar adelante a su hijo  de 6 años. Se dedica a la preparación y  venta de comida en su hogar y también se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante en su comunidad.  El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de pantalones y camisas de damas y caballeros, y para arroz, frutas y gaseosas. Sus otras integrantes, María Dolores de 56 años, se dedica a la venta frutas; Lilliam de 26 años tiene un cafetín en un centro escolar y vende comida en su domicilio. Blanca de 58 años, vende comida fritanguera, gaseosas y helado. Ella desea engrandecer su negocio con más productos y crear una pulpería en su casa.
texts.en:
The Dios es mi Fortaleza Group is made up of four persevering, hardworking, enterprising women. They are now requesting their tenth loan from ADIM in order to finance their businesses.

Johana, 44 years old, is the coordinator. She is married, and responsible for the support of her six-year-old son. She earns a living preparing and selling food from her home, and she also sells clothes in the community as a street vendor.

She will use this loan to buy pants, and women's and men's shirts, and also rice, fruits, and soda pops.

The rest of the members have various businesses. Maria Dolores, 56 years old, sells fruits. Lilliam, 26 years old, has a small cafe in a school center and also sells food from her domicile. And Blanca, 58 years old, sells fried snacks, soda pops, and ice cream. She would like to expand her business adding more products and opening a small grocery store at home.

loans.use: to buy pants and women's and men's  shirts, as well as rice, fruits and soda pops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds and seedlings for planting for high produce for sale.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is single and has a direct selling MSE products business in the Philippines.

Araceli requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks from MSE to sell to her customers.

Araceli has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Araceli would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks from MSE to sell to her customers

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman with one child whom is in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Angelica is 55 years old.

Angelica has a hat weaving business in the Philippines. Angelica requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her hat weaving business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Angelica has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Angelica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her hat weaving business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Candelaria is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Candelaria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Candelaria requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Candelaria has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Candelaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 46 years old and has one child. Avelina is married and has one child in school.

Avelina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Avelina has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Hamide

texts.en:
Hamide wants to increase the sales of dairy products and to achieve this, she must add another dairy cow and your loan, will help her do just that.
Hamide is a mother of three ages 19, 22 and 25 and herself is in her early fifties.  Agriculture/livestock has been the activity that she’s been pursuing these past twenty four years. The clientele to which she sells raw milk includes households in the city of Korca and also nearby towns whereas for the agricultural products the clientele is whole buyers.

Hamide owns some land where she plants in large quantities wheat, fodder, beans, garlic, onions and potatoes.  She also has one dairy cow at the moment that produces about 12 liters of milk/day. From this, Hamide keeps half of the milk for the family and the rest half, she sells.

loans.use: to increase the sales of dairy products by adding another dairy cow.

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul is a 35-year-old woman who has been breeding cattle for the last 12  years. She sells milk and dairy products to the local people. She is married and has one daughter. 

Konul is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvr IDP Settlement. Her monthly income from milk and dairy product sales is 120 AZN. She would like to expand her business and purchase one dairy cow and cattle. Milk and other dairy products are the most popular products among Azerbaijani people and are in very high demand. 

Konul applied for 1500 AZN loan to cover market demand and improve the living conditions of her family. She promises to repay the loand on time.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and cattle.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a hardworking father of four children. His wife is a housekeeper. Bernardo is doing busy with his business which is vending. He sells blankets, mosquito net, bed sheets, and pillow case around different villages. Bernardo is also selling sacks and twine during harvesting season. 

With his desire to expand the business and earn higher income, Bernardo wants to borrow a loan of P30,000. He will use the loan to buy kitchen utensils, blankets, and mosquito net to sell. Bernardo believes that the loan will help him extend the products he offers to his regular customers.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, blankets, and mosquito net to sell.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen 43 years old is married to Chrisantus and supports a family of 6 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family health care. 

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a 48-year-old married woman with six children, three attend school.

Alona has raised pigs for 4 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She  earns additional income operating a general store and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a married woman who works hard to support her family by selling spare parts and lubricants.  Carol has been in this business for 1 year.

Carol requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Carol would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is  taking a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, water, sugar, coffee, salt, biscuits, Fanta, Sagiko and cards.She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, water, sugar, coffee, salt, biscuits, Fanta, Sagiko and cards

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine makes a good earning by  raising hogs in Lopez Jaena. She supports her husband in raising their family and sending her children to school. She wants to increase her profit and plans to  borrow money to purchase bags of feed, animal vitamins, and two  piglets. 

She has hopes that she will save money for her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed, animal vitamins, and purchase piglets.

loans.name: Sewar

texts.en:
Sewar is a 22-years-old single lady from Atteel, a village near Tulkarm city.   She lives with her family in a small house and her father works as a worker where he gets a low and unstable income. 

Sewar is a student at the university where she studies Finance.  She wants to complete her study and find a job in the future.
Sewar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. by taking this loan, Sewar will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.
Sewar appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university tuition fees for her studies in finance for this semester.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 21-years-old single lady from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city.   She lives with her family in a small house.  Her father works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. 

Sawsan is a student at the university.  She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future.
Sawsan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. by taking this loan.  Sawsan will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.
Sawsan appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is a 40-year-old married woman with one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dona has had a broom making business for 17 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials.

In the future, Dona would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of beans.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María de 56 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que actualmente vive junto a su compañero de vida y una nieta de 16 años de edad a la que cuida como si fuera su hija. María se dedica a la venta de frutas, semillas de marañón y empiñadas, productos en los que logro invertir gracias a sus ahorros de cuando prestaba sus servicios domésticos, la venta de estos productos la realiza de forma ambulante por las tardes. María anteriormente solicito un crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda que tenía filtraciones, por lo que se siente feliz y agradecida, ya que en el próximo invierno no tendrá problemas de esta índole, pero actualmente lo que le preocupa es no contar con un lugar adecuado para almacenar agua para el uso diario de su hogar, además desea construir el baño de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pila y el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, age 56, is a hard-working woman who currently lives with her life partner and a 16 year old granddaughter.  She takes care of her granddaughter as if she were her daughter.

María sells fruits, cashews, and empenadas.  She managed to invest in these products thanks to her savings from when she worked providing domestic services.  She is a street vendor, and she sells in the afternoons.

María previously requested a loan to repair the roof to her house that was leaking.  She is happy and grateful for that loan because she will not have these types of problems next winter.  However, what worries her now is not having an adequate place to store water for daily use at her house.  She also wishes to build a bathroom at her house.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a sink and a bathroom at her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a sink and a bathroom at her house.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is 37 year old, he is married and father of two kids. The family is IDP and lives in IDP settlement for a long time. Huseyn is a farmer and raises vegetables in his small yard. He has a 15 year experience and earns 170 AZN monthly selling vegetables at local bazaar. He gets additionally money working as a driver when he has free time.

Fresh vegetables are very useful for health beside that people can cook delicious national dishes using them (kuku, doghramaj, dovgha, basdirma and etc.). These dishes may be used either in everyday life or on holidays.

His family is very big and his monthly income isn’t enough for him to provide his children’s education. He applied for 1200AZN loan in order to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his garden to help support his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a structure and buy feeding troughs..

loans.name: Ancie

texts.en:
Ancie is a 40-year-old married woman with one child.

Ancie works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 4 years.  She requests 12,000  PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, drinks, and spices.

Ancie has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income raising pigs.

Ancie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, drinks, and spices.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juana is 50 years old and has four children who are in school.

Juana has a buy & sell eggs business in the Philippines. Juana requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

Juana has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Juana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drugs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Marites has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn believes that she was  fortunate to join the micro-finance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her business. 

Jovelyn has maintained her membership in good standings and has successfully repaid several loans. She requests a loan to purchase additional piglets, bags of feed, and build concrete pig cages. 

Jovelyn wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house and provide a safe and decent living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets,  feed,  and build concrete pig cages.

loans.name: Mamni

texts.en:
Mamni is a 24-year-old married lady and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). They live in New Alipurduar, West Bengal. One of the children reads in grade 1 and the other one is a toddler. She and her husband both have attended school till grade 7.

Mamni is involved in a sewing business to financially help the family. She makes ladies garments, such as frocks, salwar, petticoats, blouses and other garments, and sells these to the local garment shops. Her husband is a driver by profession. Her business is the main resource for the family. She runs the business from home to meet the family’s needs. She has always enjoyed her work and hopes that one day she will be able to open her own workshop. 

At present, Mamni wants to replace her sewing machine that she has damaged by using it so much through the years. So she has taken out a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase a new sewing machine. She would like to be able to purchase some sewing materials also for her work so that she can stitch more clothing. She hopes the loan will help her to increase her business profit and to work more effectively and efficiently. Her dream is to provide higher and good quality education so that they can be established in the future.

Mamni gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 48 years old and single. 

Divina is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Divina has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José Andrés tiene 39 años y se dedica a la producción de café Orgánico que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL. José Andrés está casado con Sandra con quien tienen 4 hijos que dependen totalmente de él, José Andrés Sueña con darles a sus hijos lo mejor que se pueda y quiere que todos tengan un estudio.
José Andrés se dedica a producir café desde hace 10 años, y se ha convertido en la base de su economía, “El café es lo mejor que podemos tener en la zona”, indica. El año pasado José Andrés perdió 1hectárea de su cafetal como efecto del ataque del hongo de la roya el cual quiere replantar para reanudar la producción lo más pronto posible ya que es la única fuente de ingresos.
En estos momentos José Andrés está solicitando un préstamo con el cual podrá cubrir los gastos de la replantación de la parcela que resulto afectada con la roya, con el dinero comprará: plantas, abono orgánico, insumos orgánicos y pagará trabajadores.
texts.en:
José Andrés, age 39, grows organic coffee that he sells through COCAFCAL [a coffee cooperative].  José Andrés is married to Sandra, and they have four children who are completely dependent upon him.  José Andrés dreams of giving his children the best that he can, and he wants all of them to have an education.

José Andrés has been growing coffee for ten years, and it has become the foundation of his finances.  “Coffee is the best that we can have in this area,” he says.  Last year José Andrés lost one hectare of his coffee farm due to an attack of the ‘roya’ fungus.  He wants to replant that land to begin the production again as soon as possible because it is his only source of income.

José Andrés is now requesting a loan in order to be able to cover the expenses of replanting the land that was affected by the roya.  He will use the loan to buy plants, organic fertilizer, organic supplies, and to pay the workers.

loans.use: to buy plants, organic fertilizer, organic supplies, and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Cleogen

texts.en:
Cleogen is married from Plaridel, Philippines. She is 39 years old and has 3 kids. Cleogen is managing her fishing activities with her husband. She owns a fishing boat where she has hired 5 fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 20,000.00 for the purchase of new nets, foams and other fishing accessories. As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. 

She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market, where she will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children finish their college education and have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase of new nets, foams and other fishing accessories

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 59 years old and married with nine children. With one child still in school, Fely works very hard to provide for them.

Fely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, drinks, etc.

Fely has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gelina

texts.en:
Gelina works hard to support her family. Gelina is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Gelina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, shrimp, crabs, etc., to sell.

Gelina has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, shrimp, crabs, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 43 years old, married and her two children are in college. To make a living, Rubilyn engage herself in retailing of grocery items in their village. Her husband is gaining income thru operating their vehicle for passenger’s transportation. 

Rubilyn dreams for her two children to finish their studies and become professionals someday. She knows how hard to find a white collar job without a degree. With this, she is asking for a loan of PP15,000 to buy drinks, condiments, bread, shampoo, and soaps to sell. She hopes that someday thru their hard work, Rubilyn’s children will succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to buy drinks, condiments, bread, shampoo, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Rewad

texts.en:
Rewad is a 26-year-old married lady from Tubas, a village near Tulkarm city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her husband is a worker who gets a low and unstable income. Rewad is a student in the university, where she studies elementary education. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future.

Rewad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Rewad will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Rewad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris has been considerably preparing for the post rice harvest operations of her palay in Larena. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan. Maricris hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post rice harvest operations to then be ready for the next season

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 30 years old, married with two children.

Anne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries o sell like drinks, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, detergent and other personal care products.

Anne has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pig.

Anne aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell like drinks, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, detergent and other personal care products

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 60 years old and married with seven children. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, candies, biscuits, canned goods, etc. .

Luz has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Luz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, candies, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Viengthong Group

texts.en:
Heung’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Heung and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Heung and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Heung’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry to increase her flock and also her profits

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Being a responsible father, Alfonso aims to uplift their status of living and give his family a better life. He is 46 years old and has three children. Two of them are still studying, and he wants them to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. 

With this regard, he aims to improve his business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, he would like take a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of motorcycle parts and accessories to resell in their community. He is hoping that he will receive his requested amount to be able for him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle parts and accessories

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil is 30 year old,married and he has a son. Aqil is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region.  His wife is a housekeeper.   He earns money raising and selling seasonal fruits at the local bazaar (apples, cherries, pears etc.) He has been working in agriculture for 5 years and his monthly income is 200AZN. He gets additional earnings working in a café. 

Fruit growing is much expanded in Azerbaijan because people have high demand in fruits. They like to eat them fresh or to use in order to prepare fruit juice, jam and fruit cakes. 
Aqiil ’s income doesn’t cover family’s demands. He applied for 1200AZN loan in order to supply new good fertilizers and repair his garden. This is his 1st loan .Please support him

loans.use: to supply new good fertilizers for his fruit trees and repair his garden

loans.name: Daryl

texts.en: Daryl heads up for the next cropping season. He wants to prepare well especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. He wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer of which he applied a loan from the Cooperative. Daryl hopes to save enough for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce next season

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 62 years old from Oroquieta. He is married and engaged in managing a car radiator repair shop to provide for his family. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional bronze rod, flux, copper and other accessories and materials for his radiator repair shop business. Allan has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his radiator repair shop business.

loans.use: in purchasing additional bronze rod, flux, copper and other materials for his car radiator repair business

loans.name: Loriana

texts.en:
Loriana is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Loriana is 59 years old now.

Loriana has a fishing business in the Philippines. Loriana requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Loriana has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Loriana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 65 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Catalina is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Catalina has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 55 years old and has four children. Marcelina is married, and one of her children is in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business of farming seaweed in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic and other materials for her business.

Marcelina has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica, 59, is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, peanuts, toothpaste and sanitary pads. 

Rica has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gentiana

texts.en:
Gentiana, who is 36 years old, wanted to be photographed with her husband, Vani; they are villagers and parents of two kids, 17 and 14 years old who live in rural southeastern Albania. 

The loan that they are requesting from you will be used to buy fertilizers for their seasonal plantations and orchards. For all these past eighteen years, the activity that has brought a little income to their family has been agriculture. In particular, they own about 5,000 square meters of agricultural land and have rented about 20,000 more from others where they plant beans in 18,000 of them and wheat in the other 7,000. 

Gentiana sells all the dried beans to wholesale buyers and also she grinds the wheat in a close by mill. Some of it she keeps it to make their bread and pastries for the year. 

Kindly note, that the region where Gentiana lives is known for the largest production and the most delicious beans, potatoes and grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for their seasonal plantations and orchards

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 22-year-old married lady from a village near Nablus city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her husband works as a worker, and he gets a low and unstable income. Lina is a student in the university, where she studies nursing. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future.

Lina took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Lina will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Lina appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie, 23, is the mother of a five-year-old girl. They live in Badian, Cebu. Analie relies on her sari-sari (variety store) business for her income. 

She started this means of a livelihood one year ago. In her store, she sells canned goods, noodles, chips, candies, jelly fruit, matches, diapers and condiments. In addition, she farms rice. This business enables her to earn an income of 3,000 Philippine pesos. 

Analie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, biscuits, more canned goods, seasonings, condiments and toiletries. She hopes to make her business successful so that her child can go to school.

In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, biscuits, more canned goods, seasonings, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy herbicides for her farm for high production.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from the municipality of Badian in the province of Cebu. She is 37 years old, married with six years old. Her oldest is18 and her youngest is only a month old. Marilou has been engaged in making dresses. She has a tailoring business for five years now. She also sell trendy clothes at an affordable price. These clothes are locally known as RTW.  

Aside from clothing, Marilou also makes Salabat (ginger ale). She is asking for a loan of 12000 PHP to buy more dresses to sell for a profit. She will also buy ginger ale ingredients such as fresh ginger and sugar. Her income will go primarily towards the education of her children and food for the family. In the future,. She plans to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy trendy clothing for sale.  Also ginger and sugar for producing ginger ale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farm tools so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is 58 years old. He is married and blessed with four children who are over 18 years old.

He has had a rental houses business for five years.

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will be using to purchase materials for building. He hopes this will be profitable to help him pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to change the lives of his children positively and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building and use the income to help him pay school fees

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Rebecca has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Basilisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Basilisa is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to  buy more fish, crabs, shrimp, shells, seaweed, etc to sell to her food stall.

Basilisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, crabs, shrimp, shells, seaweed, etc to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 51, is married with five children. Three of her children are presently in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She has borrowed from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation six times in the past to sustain her business. She has requested a new loan, for 14,000 Philippine pesos, from NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 61 years old and married with eight children. Luciana works very hard to provide for them.

Luciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Luciana has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 34 years old, and her three children are in school.

Rosemarie has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Khamkeo Group

texts.en:
Onta’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Onta and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Onta and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Onta’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Pagar la educación de sus hijos es el único pensamiento que ronda diariamente la mente de la señora Marlene, pensar que con su venta de frutas ambulantemente podrá mantener su hogar, pagar los servicios públicos y lo más importante que su hijo pueda acceder a una institución universitaria, pues no quiere que pase por las dificultades que un día paso ella, recibir un no en varias empresas solo por no tener la educación o la preparación para acceder a un cargo, no lo acepta y no permitirá que su hijo pase por dichas situaciones.
Por ello Marlene trabaja, madruga, trasnocha todo por sus 3 muchachos.
Quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar la cantidades de inventario y de frutas a la venta, comprara mangos, sandias, peras, bananos, manzanas, fresas, guayabas.
texts.en: Paying for the education of her children is the only thought that daily crosses the mind of Marlene, hoping that her itinerant fruit sales are able to support her household, pay the public utilities and most importantly that her son can get into a university. She does not want him to experience the difficulties that she sees in a day, receiving a negative from companies for not having an education or training to access work. She won't accept or allow that her son has to endure these situations. So Marlene works, early in the morning and late at night, all for her 3 children. She wants to request a loan to increase the quantity of her inventory of fruit for sale buying mango, watermelon, pears, bananas, apples, strawberries and guava.

loans.use: to buy inventory: mango, watermelon, pears, bananas, strawberries and guava.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 42 years old. She is from the town of Malabuyoc, Cebu. Leonora is married and she has two children ages 14 and 19. For a year now, she has operated a bakery business. She sell bread and cookies. 

She is asking for a loan to make renovations in her store and home. She will use the loan to buy hard wood, nails and pay for repair. Once she can make improvements, it will more attract more buyers to add to her revenue. In the future, she hope to have another branch for her bakery business and make more expansions. Her income will be for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy hard wood, nails and pay for repair to her bakery store and home

loans.name: Vista De Angel Ii Group

texts.es:
4 mujeres emprendedoras y  microempresarias conforman el Grupo “Vista de Ángel II”. Demostrando ser un grupo solidario y responsable solicitan por segunda vez crédito con ADIM. 
La coordinadora es Nydia de 28 años, casada y responsable de dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa en su hogar y de forma ambulante, en su comunidad. Con el préstamo comprara productos de mayor demanda, como blusas, jeans para dama, jeans para caballeros, y ropa íntima. Con los ingresos ayudara a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. 
Yahoska, 21 años, su negocio es de venta de ropa en su domicilio y de forma ambulante. María del Carmen, 40 años, vende ropa, calzado y perfumes. Scarleth, 26 años, vende bisutería y cosméticos. Todas ellas desean engrandecer su negocio y generar mayores ganancias para salir adelante y contribuir con la economía del país.
texts.en:
Four enterprising micro-business women make up the “Vista de Ángel II” communal bank. They have proven themselves to be a responsible and united group and they are requesting their second loan from ADIM. The coordinator is Nydia who is 28 years old. She is married and responsible for two children. She works selling clothing from her house and itinerantly in her community. She will buy the products most in demand with the loan such as blouses, jeans for women and men and lingerie. With the income she will help her husband with the household expenses.

Yahoska is 21 years old and her business is selling clothing from her house and itinerantly. María del Carmen is 40 years old and sells clothing, footwear and perfume. Scarleth is 26 years old and sells jewellery. They all want to expand their businesses and generate greater income to get ahead and contribute to the country's economy.

loans.use: to buy products in great demand like blouses, jeans for women and men and lingerie.

loans.name: Flaviano

texts.en:
Almost ten years now that Flaviano has been engaged in seaweed farming. He grows and sells seaweed.  He is 57 year old with four grown dependents. He lives in Talibon, Bohol. He needs additional capital to finance his livelihood.

Flaviano is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials needed. With these, he will be able to continue produce more seaweed to sell. This would help Flaviano augment his earnings and able to do some expansion. He could now be able to handle his finances and start to pay his obligations.

He is hoping to be progressive in handling his sources of income to be successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and other materials needed for his seaweed farm

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 43 years old and has seven children. Irene is married, and five of her children are still in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business and raises a pig in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Irene has been in this business for four years now. She also earns additional income from fish vending and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 46 years old, married to Eucabeth, and he supports a family of six family members. 

John has been a farmer for the last 25 years and the business earns him an income of KES 11,000 per month. 

John has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers and farm tools so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs. 

John plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

John's hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm tools so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Dongmod Group

texts.en: Keoaudone is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Keoaudone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Keoaudone and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Keoaudone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Keoaudone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. The children in the picture are the children of borrowers in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jenra

texts.en:
Jenra is 57 years old, married with seven children.

Jenra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell like drinks,  juice, bread, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

Jenra has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Jenra aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell like drinks,  juice, bread, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and married with five children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, noodles, beers, candies, etc. 

In the future, Gloria  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nakhor Group

texts.en:
Lay understands the difference that a water filter can make for her family and her group’s families. She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter that Lay has purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent on charcoal or by decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, if it is available.    

Lay is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and is guaranteed for two years. This way, she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.  

Pictured with the borrowers are some of their children.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 62 years old and married with six children. Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal product care, beverages, canned  goods and other groceries.

Regina has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Regina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal product care, beverages, canned  goods and other groceries

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy works hard to support her family. Judy is widowed and has a raising pig business in the Philippines.

Judy requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Judy has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Nongbua Group

texts.en: Art’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Art and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Art and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Art’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ne'mah

texts.en:
Ne'mah is a 37-year-old married woman from small village near Hebron City. She lives with her husband and five kids in a small house. Ne'mah’s husband works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low and unstable income.

 Ne'mah has a sewing business where she makes different types of clothing that she sells in the local market.
Ne'mah is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business. Her loan will help her increase her productivity and her income. Ne'mah appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business to increase productivity

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living with her family. She is married and has one child. She is busy with buying and selling textiles in the domestic market. She buys from the central market and sells in the domestic market. She has permanent clients and well known among sellers. 

Now her working capital increased and she likes her activity. She is planning to buy a new assortment to her store cotton fabric textile. She asked a loan to buy cotton fabric textile. She is hoping to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more cotton fabric textiles for sale in the market

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 38, is married with two children. With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

She has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sabina is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sabina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sabina requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Sabina has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Sabina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora works hard to support her family. Rhodora is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rhodora requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rhodora has been in this business for 8 years now.

Rhodora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sonia is 50 years old and has four children who are in school.

Sonia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fishing nets & other materials for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sonia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets & other materials for her business

Boun and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Boun and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Boun’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

Kommana understands the difference water filters can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Kommana knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Kommana purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.   

Kommana is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years. Therefore, she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so that she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 22 years old and married with two children.

Alice is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Alice requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Alice has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alice would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Jannet es una mujer de 29 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 2 y 4 años y 1 hija mujer de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de cemento.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, optimista, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘Sacaba’ llamada la capital del chicharrón, dónde se reúnen cocineras y clientes para degustar el platillo típico del valle. De clima templado durante todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 7-23 grados centígrados.
Jannet es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; la mayor estudia en la escuela y los menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no existe el alcantarillado. El agua del lugar proviene del rio o de pozo, recientemente llegó la conexión de agua potable la cual es accesible para algunos pobladores. Su negocio es la venta de cemento, antiguamente las casas se construían de adobe y el cemento era excesivamente caro para los pobladores, actualmente existen fábricas de ladrillos cercanas por lo que la demanda de cemento a crecido, “me di cuenta que empezó a haber demanda de cemento e inicié mi negocio llevando las bolsas hasta la construcción…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la demanda crece, la desventaja es la falta de agua potable para su familia que son menores de edad. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que su familia deje de beber agua sucia de pozo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jannet solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que su familia deje de beber agua sucia de pozo.
texts.en:
Janett is a 29-year-old woman. She is single and has two sons, aged 2 and 4, and a daughter who is 6 years old. Her business is selling cement. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, dependable, optimistic, generous, responsible and very hard-working. She operates her business in an area called ‘Sacaba,’ which is known as the "capital of chicharrón [fried pork]." Here, cooks and customers come together to enjoy the traditional cuisine of the valley. It has a temperate climate throughout the year, with daytime temperatures varying between 7 and 23 degrees Centigrade.

Janett has brown skin, dark eyes and long black hair which she wears tied behind her. She is short in stature and has a medium build. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in the area, and she also speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the business she carries out. She shares her life with her children; the older one is in school, and the younger ones are not yet of school age. 

They live in a room that is owned by the family, built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and an earthen floor. The home has an electrical connection and well water supplied with a pump. There is no sewer connection. The water in the area comes from the river or from wells. Recently, water connections have become available to some villagers. 

Her business is selling cement. Earlier, homes were built from adobe, and cement was too expensive for the villagers. Now there are some brick factories nearby, so that the demand for cement has grown. "I noticed that there was beginning to be demand for cement, and I started my business delivering the bags to the construction sites," she comments. The advantage of her business is that demand is growing, but her disadvantage is the lack of a water connection for her family with small children. Her dream is to have piped-in water in her home, so she can have running water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry area, and so that her family can stop drinking dirty well water. 

This is her first loan sequence with the institution within the two years that she has been doing this work. For these reasons, Janett is requesting a loan to pay for a drinking water connection for her kitchen, bathroom and laundry area, so that her family can stop drinking dirty well water.

loans.use: to pay for a drinking water connection for her kitchen, bathroom and laundry area, so that her family can stop drinking dirty well water.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 24 years old and has a baby girl who is only eight months old. She and her partner hails from Alegria, Cebu. Together, they have small multiple businesses. She is engaged in a sari-sari store  business where she sell basic household for the needs of the people in her community. She sell items like canned goods, diaper, soy sauce, matches, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and toiletries. She also owned a motorcycle that is operated by her husband for transportation business to transport passengers to other village and towns. 

They also farm vegetables and rice. She is asking a loan of PHP5000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer for this.  It is important so she can expect an abundant harvest. In the future, it is her plan to build her own house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for an abundant harvest

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 38 years old and has two children. Juvy is widowed and has two children cuttently in school.

Juvy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juvy has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Yolly is 31 years old and both of her children are in school.

Yolly has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Yolly requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Yolly has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Yolly would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 63 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Nonkhoun Group

texts.en: Phouva understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Phouva knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phouva purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Phouva is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es: Diana de 19 años,  reside en el municipio de Chocontá en el departamento de Cundinamarca en donde se encuentra ubicado su estación de montallantas y venta de repuestos.  Su mamá en compañía de su padrastro han trabajado durante toda su vida en esta actividad y tienen sucursales en distintos puntos en Chocontá y Gachancipá, ellos le vendieron la sucursal que actualmente administra. En su local ofrece servicios de reparación y venta de neumáticos y accesorios.  Su negocio está sobre la vía principal y  es de fácil acceso para aquellos que se les presenta una calamidad con sus llantas; una vez son reparadas los clientes deben cancelan el servicio. Todos los días en un horario bastante amplio de 6 a.m. a 10 p.m. los propietarios de vehículos como camiones, buses, automóviles y motocicletas pueden realizar sus reparaciones. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para contar con capital necesario para comprar repuestos. Diana es madre de una niña de dos años a quien desea ofrecerle bienestar y una buena educación,  Su meta es vender llantas de distintas marcas.
texts.en:
Diana is 19 years old and lives in the municipality of Chocontá in the department of Cundinamarca. She has a tire repair and spare parts shop. Her mother along with her step-father worked all their lives in this business and have branches in different places in Chocontá y Gachancipá, They sold her the branch that she currently manages.

She offers tire sales, tire repairs and accessories in her shop. Her business is located on the main road and has easy access for those who have a problem with one of their tires. Once their tire is repaired they have to pay for the service. During the rather long timetable from 6 am until 10 pm the owners of vehicles like trucks, buses, cars and motorcycles can get their repairs done.

Currently she is requesting a loan from Kiva, her first loan she had had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to have the necessary money to buy spare parts. Diana is the mother of a two year old daughter for whom she wants to provide well-being and a good education. Her goal is to buy tires of different brands.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Lourdes has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for three years and also earns an income from tailoring.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Nesie

texts.en:
Nesie, who is aged 37, is married to a farmer/welder and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a hog-raising business in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 9,000 every four months. 

Due to a lack of capital on her business Nesie would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to purchase a supply of hog feed for her hogs. 

Nesie is hoping that her livestock business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of hog feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Kongpathoumvan Group

texts.en: Thoummee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Thoummee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Thoummee and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Thoummee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thoummee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.  The children in the picture are the children of borrowers in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, is aged 47, married and is blessed with three children. She owns and operates a food retail business in her village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 9,000 a month. She sells bananas, potatoes, sweet potatoes, tomatoes,and variety of vegetables.  

Due to insufficient capital on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 14,000 to purchase variety of fruits and vegetables to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 43 year old married woman with three children ages 15-18 year old respectively.  She engages in gardening. She grows sweet potato leaves. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. Her husband earns a living by being a dealer of herbal products. 

She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers,  sprayer and pig feed. These tools would really boost Bernardita's livelihood. With these, her farming livelihood will improve and also she will be raising healthy hogs in the coming months. She could now continue finance the schooling of her children and able to handle her finances.

In the future, she  dreams to expand her both business to make it productive and also to support the needs of her growing children for brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers,  sprayer and pig feed

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina is 67 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five adult children.  

For her means of living, Ursulina has been engaged in a dressmaking, pillow and curtain making business for 8 years already. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cloth, threads and accessories for her pillow, curtains and dressmaking business. Ursulina has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years. In the future, Ursulina hopes to establish her own dress shop.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional cloth, threads and accessories

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 57-year-old, married woman and mother of six kids. She lives in Salt. She is a conservative woman and asked her son Ibrahim to take her place in the photo. 

Heyam is applying for the loan to help Ibrahim finish his bachelor's degree in project management. He is 21 years old and in his third year. 

Ibrahim tried to find a good job, but he did not because he could not find suitable work beside his education. 

Heyam is having a financial problem: Her husband works with a low income that supports eight family members; therefore, she is applying for an educational loan to help her son Ibrahim cover the rest of his semester fees and complete his education.

loans.use: to cover the rest of her son Ibrahim's semester fees to complete his education.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
A $ 600 loan is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. Jacinta opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like Oils,coffee,sugar,salt,noodles,salt,shampoo and slippers.Jacinta is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Jacinta is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy oils, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, shampoo and slippers

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Pinky works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and plastic-wares businesses. Pinky is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, school uniform, shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Pinky has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, school uniforms, shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Marites has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Guardabarranco Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Guardabarranco”, este grupo solidario, conformado por 3 mujeres, que tienen sus metas fijas, salir adelante en sus negocios y en el hogar. Este es su 17 vez que solicitan crédito, demostrando ser capaz y responsables.
La coordinadora, es Sandra, de 43 años, casada, y con 3 hijos de los cuales nos comparte que ya ellos formaron sus hogares. Se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva de manera ambulante en su comunidad. El dinero lo ocupara en la compra de pantalones de vestir y jeans, camisetas y blusas para su clientela. Con las ganancias acumuladas lo invertirá en el negocio de reparación de bicicleta que tiene con su esposo. Lo cual le permite mayores ingresos.
Las otras acompañantes, 43 años, Ileana, comercializa ropa y zapatos, el préstamo lo invertirá en el área de calzado y comprara zapatos deportivos, chinelas de baño y sandalias. Sonia de 40 años, destaza cerdos y prepara nacatamales para venderlos en su hogar.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Guardabarranco is made up of 3 women that have set goals to get ahead in their businesses and in their homes.This is their 17th time requesting a loan, demonstrating they are capable and responsible.

The coordinator is Sandra. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children with whom she shares since they form a part of her home. She earns a living selling new clothes as a street vendor in her community. She will use the loan to buy dress pants, jeans, shirts and blouses for her customers. With the accumulated earnings she will invest in the bicycle repair business that she has with her husband, which provides greater earnings.

The other members are Ileana, 43 years old, who sells clothes and shoes and will use the loan to invest in footwear and will buy athletic shoes, bathroom slippers, and sandals. Sonia is 40 years old, she butchers pigs and makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) to sell them from her home.

loans.use: to buy dress pants, jeans, shirts and blouses for her customers.

loans.name: Nueva Luz De Putucusi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ DE PUTUCUSI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita ella es casada y tiene 71 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva cafe,cacao y frutas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These group members belong to the communal bank group "Nueva luz de Putucusi." This bank is located in the Quellouno district, in the province of  La Convención, in the deparment of Cusco.

This member is Margarita. She is 71 years old and married with 7 children. Margarita works in her farming business; she has a plot of land on which she cultivates coffee, cocoa, and fruits. She works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. and has many years of experience in this business. Things have gone very well for her. Margarita's dream is to expand the land she cultivates. She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The other group members make a living selling animals, selling clothing, running a grocery store, and selling food. 

Margarita is grateful to everyone who is a part of her dream through this loan. She pledges  to make all of her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients, seasonings, soft drinks and school supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Her name is Marites. She is 26 years old from Alegria, Cebu. She is married with three children ages 1, 3 and 4. 

For six years now, she has been into farming rice and  operating a transportation using her motorcycle. This business is called Habal-habal in the native dialect of Cebu. Marites also raise hogs for additional income. She would like to expand her business and make it more profitable. 

She is asking a loan of PHP4000 to buy feed for her hogs. Marites plasn to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to help her get more milk to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 34 years old and married with three children.

Mylen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, detergent, shampoo and other personal care products.
