Mylen has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Mylen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, detergent, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eleven children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs, tricycle passenger and cafeteria businesses. Sonia is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 60 years old and has seven children. Susan is a married woman.

Susan is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Susan has been in this business for 45 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucia is 52 years old now.

Lucia has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetable to sell for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 42 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Arlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Arlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bath soap, sanitary pads, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, salt, eggs, etc. to sell.

Arlinda has been in this business for 6 years

In the future, Arlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bath soap, sanitary pads, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, salt, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a tender and angelic 34-year-old woman. With charisma and smiles, she knows how to farm and sell her farm produce. She is a smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. In the past twelve years, she has bred more than five dairy cows, developed her farm, and planted and sold a variety of crop. She says the secret to her success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help. 

Caroline was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. Caroline also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. 

Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Caroline is visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Caroline believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will facilitate Caroline’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer which will lead to good yields and a better life

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 55 years old and has five children. Carmelita is married and has two children who are still in school.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Carmelita has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Thong Group

texts.en:
Chan understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Chan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Chan purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Chan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Cristina Del Socorro

texts.es: Cristina, de 51 años, casada, originaria de la zona rural de Masaya, como toda mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superación, se dedica a la preparación y venta de refrescos y comidas en su hogar. Este negocio lo principió desde hace 5 años con sus ahorros personales, y del cual el día de hoy sigue a flote, con la ayuda de su nuera que la ayuda en la preparación de sus productos. El préstamo requerido lo invertirá en materia prima, como arroz, carne, plátano, frijol, aceite y gaseosas. Con las ganancias generadas podrá saldar su cuenta y también realizará mejoras en su hogar.
texts.en: Cristina, 51, and her husband live in a rural part of Masaya.  She is a hard-working woman with a strong drive to get ahead in the world.  She operates a business, making and selling food and drinks.  She started the business, 5 years ago, with her own savings and keeps it going with help from her sister-in-law.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy rice, meat, plantains, beans, cooking oil and soft drinks.  The investment will help her to support herself and make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport for more income gain.

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr: Fanta qui se trouve sur la photo assise devant sur le tabouret et est couvert d’un foulard bleu, jaune, rouge, noir en tenant le drapeau, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Banambani au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Fanta, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 9 enfants, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi le fait que l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Fanta à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Fanta cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le gombo  sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Fanta entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison des semences de qualité et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Fanta effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Fanta cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Fanta planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Fanta espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille
texts.en:
Fanta, who is sitting up front, on the stool, wearing a blue, yellow, red, and black headscarf and holding a banner in the photo, is a member of a group of 11 farmers registered in myAgro, living and working in the village of Banambani in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Aged 60, Fanta is the mother of nine children, one of whom is presently in school. 

Agriculture is the anchor of family tradition, the primary source of income and of food self-sufficiency in the household, and it allows Fanta to ensure self-sufficiency for her own family, which is the reason she has worked in agriculture for 30 years now.  

Fanta grows peanuts, sorghum and okra on her plot of land, but like any farmer she has to face difficulties such as the lack of rain. Fanta is beginning her second year with myAgro, and she re-registered because of the high-quality seeds and fertilizer. This year Fanta is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of fertilizer for growing peanuts so as to increase her yield on her plot of 0.25 hectare. Fanta has been cultivating peanuts for 10 years now, for their commercial value, since peanuts are a foodstuff she sells at the market, and also for their productive and commercial value. With the increase in her yield and her income, Fanta plans to raise livestock. Finally, Fanta would also like to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to acquire a fertilizer package for growing peanuts in order to increase the productivity of her plot

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 42 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Riza has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Don Bosco-Quebrada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DON BOSCO-QUEBRADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yanatile, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia continua con  su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo platanos, mandarinas, papayas y naranjas, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank group "Don Bosco-Quebrada." This bank is located in the Yanatile district, in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.

This group member is Lucia. She runs a business selling fruits. She is a responsible and diligent person. She sells plantains, mandarin oranges, papayas, and oranges. She has years of experience in this business and things have gone very well for her thanks to the dedication she shows each day. Lucia hopes to continue working to support her family.  

Lucia is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies. 

The other group members work selling coffee, selling fruits, running a grocery store, and selling food items. Lucia is grateful to everyone who is a part of her dream through this loan. She pledges to make all of her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a 50-year-old married man and a resident of Badian, Cebu. He has nine children; most are adults, but the remaining four are still ages 6, 10, 15, and 18.

He has been in the business of fishing for two decades. He wanted to further invest and expand his business for better revenue. He is asking for a loan worth PHP 5,000 to buy a new set of fishing nets. Virgilio is optimistic that this will allow him to catch more fish.

Most importantly, he wanted to send his children to school for their welfare and for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily so as to meet their demands and family needs

loans.name: Dramane's Group

texts.fr: Dramane qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, arrêtant au dernier rang a main levé a boubou blanche, est membre d’un groupe de 21 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Siramana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Dramane, âgé de 75 ans, est le père de 16 enfants âgés de 10-40 ans, dont 10 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Dramane à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 68 ans. Dramane cultive l'arachide, le mais, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et de semences de qualité. Dramane entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Dramane effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Dramane cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Dramane planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et d'acheter du matériel agricole comme. Enfin Dramane espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille
texts.en:
Dramane, who is standing in the centre of the last rank in the photo, raising his hand and wearing a white robe, is member of a group of 21 farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Siramana, to the southeast of Bamako, in Mali.

75-year-old Dramane is the father of sixteen children from 10 to 40 years of age, of whom ten attend (or have attended) school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home, which prompted Dramane to practice this activity over the past 68 years.

Dramane cultivates groundnuts, maize and rice on his plot of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment, and high-quality seeds. Dramane is entering his second year with myAgro and renewed his affiliation because of the payment system and training in agricultural techniques, and the prospects of increasing crop yields through services offered by myAgro.

This year Dramane is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro fertilizer to cultivate maize, so he can increase crop yields on his one hectare parcel (2.44 acres). For the past 15 years Dramane has been cultivating maize for its food crop value, crop yields and market profitability.

With increased yields and income Dramane plans to raise livestock and buy agricultural equipment. Finally Dramane also hopes to cover the children's school fees as well as build a home for the family.

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultivate maize

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en:
Snooky is 33 years old and married with two children.

She runs a pig-raising business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Snooky has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lorenza Marisel

texts.es:
Lorenza es una mujer de treinta y cuatro años de edad, muy honesta y trabajadora, migrar de su ciudad natal a otra,  junto su familia,  la llevo a buscar una forma de producir un ingreso extra que complementara el salario de su esposo que trabaja en una fábrica. Ella puso en su casa de habitación una venta de tortillas y granos básicos. Su hermano le brinda un apoyo incondicional enviándole sacos de frijoles, arroz y maíz que produce en su finca. 
Ella desea aumentar su producción de tortillas al día, dada la demanda de los clientes, es por eso que ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito mediante un préstamo que le permita comprar leña, sacos de maíz, bolsas para empacar, entre otros. Su meta es mejorar cada día como comerciante, para ser el orgullo de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a 34-year-old woman, and she is very honest and hard-working. Moving from her hometown to another city with her family brought her to look for a way to earn extra income to complement her husband's salary from working in a factory. She set up a place to sell tortillas and basic grains in her home. 

Her brother offers her full support by sending her sacks of beans, rice, and corn that he produces on his farm. She wants to increase her daily tortilla production given the demand from her customers. For this reason she has come to Kiva and MiCredito for a loan that will allow her to buy firewood, sacks of corn, packaging bags and other items. Her goal is to improve every day as an entrepreneur so she can be the pride of her three children.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sacks of corn, packaging bags and other items.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is a single man living in Tafileh. He is studying to get his bachelor’s degree in sport rehabilitation, and he is now in his second year.

His father’s income is the only income in his family, which consists of seven members. It is not enough to cover all the needs for his big family; therefore, they are facing some problems that led Sameh to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees.

Sameh's future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: to cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Balvina Alejandra

texts.es: Balvina, de 32 años, casada y con 2 hijos. Es una persona, humilde, sociable, alegre y trabajadora. Como comerciante, solicita crédito por primera vez a ADIM, para crecer  e impulsar un negocio, de venta  de verduras y frutas del cual ya es dueña desde hace 14 años, con la ayuda de su padre. Con el dinero comprara papa, cebolla, piña, repollo y  zanahorias.  Con las ganancias generadas seguirá ayudando en la economía del hogar, y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Balvina is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is a humble, sociable, happy, and hard-working person. As an entrepreneur, she is requesting a loan for the first time from ADIM in order to grow and propel her business selling fruits and vegetables. She has been running this business for 14 years with the help of her father.

With the loan, she will buy potatoes, onions, pineapple, cabbage, and carrots. With the earnings she generates she will continue helping with her home finances, and thus offer her children a promising future.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, pineapple, cabbage, and carrots.

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en: Roxan is a resident of Badian, a municipality in Cebu. She is 29 years old. She has two children ages three and four. Five years ago, she started raising hogs and operating a small grocery store locally known as Sari-sari (variety). This type of store is common in rural villages. She sell shampoo, bath soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs and candies. She is asking a loan of PHP15000 to buy feed, canned goods, detergent, noodles, shampoo, soy sauce and sugar. She hope to see her children becoming professional and for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, canned goods, detergent, noodles, shampoo, soy sauce and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Alvincita

texts.en:
Alvincita is 60 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Alvincita has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and married with two children still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

Raquel has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Rediena

texts.en:
Rediena is 36 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, etc.

Rediena has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, etc

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 37 years old.

She has a welding shop business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Liezel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is 58 years old and has seven children. Clarissa is married and has two children who are still in school.

Clarissa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Clarissa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Clarissa has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Clarissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Nancy is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma works hard to support her family. Lerma  has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Lerma has been in this business for 25 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.  Dolores is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc for her general store business.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Koço

texts.en:
This is Koco, a 42-year-old married father of two kids, 15 and 2. They all live in the city of Korca, in the southeast of Albania. He works for a pay of $400/month, and his wife is an elementary school teacher whose monthly salary is about $420/month.

They recently decided to do something of their own, since the jobs they hold are not secure due to the corruption fact in Albania. Most of the jobs are ruled by people who have some involvement in the government or are political fanatics and as such. These jobs are secure as long their political party is in force, which adds up to a four-year term.

The activity that Koco wanted to start with your financial help would be car and horse carriage rental with the latest, to be used mostly for wedding events. They recently bought three vehicles with the money they borrowed from their families and acquaintances, yet the loan from Kiva lenders will help them finish up with the registrations and necessary customs documents.

loans.use: to do the paperwork, including registration and customs documents, for his car rental and horse carriage services for wedding events.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a tailoring business that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy such items as sewing thread, fabric, and a sewing machine.She opened her tailoring a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy  sewing thread, fabric, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Fe is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Fe has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Elena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Debi's Group

texts.fr: Debi qui se trouve sur la photo à gauche et tient le drapeau myAgro entre ses main devant sur la table, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Demeni au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Debi, âgée de 49 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Debi à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Debi cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, d'engrais de qualité et d'herbicides. Debi entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité. Cette année Debi effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Debi cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Debi planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Debi espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Debi, who is in front on the left in the photo holding the myAgro banner,  is a member of a group of eight farmers registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of Demeni in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Aged 49, Debi is the mother of four children, of whom two are presently in school. Agriculture permits her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family, but the love of agriculture moved Debi to work in this field for 30 years now. 

Debi grows peanuts and rice on her plot but as a farmer she has to face difficulties such as lack of rain, of high-quality fertilizer, and of herbicides. Debi is beginning her second year with myAgro and she re-registered because of the system of payment and the high-quality seeds. This year Debi is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of fertilizer for growing peanuts so as to increase the yield on her plot of 0.25 hectare. 

Debi has been cultivating peanuts for 10 years now for their value as a foodstuff, explaining that peanuts are directly edible for the family and are used as a base for sauces in cooking. They also have a commercial value, since peanuts are a foodstuff she sells at the market. With the increase in her yield and her income, Debi plans to raise livestock and be able to do small-scale commerce. Finally, Debi also hopes to cover the school fees of her children as well as  ensuring food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: to get a fertilizer package for growing peanuts

loans.name: Nemer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 20-year-old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as a taxi driver where he gets a low and unstable income. 

Nimer is a student in the university where he studies accounting. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future to help his family with part of their expenses.

Nimer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Nimer will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Nimer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia lives in Badian, Cebu. She is 50 years old. She is married with one son who is 17 years old. 

Anastacia is engaged in raising hogs and cattle to earn a living. Her husband is a rice farmer and only earns a little money to help make both ends meet. 

She is asking for a loan to buy sacks of feed and more piglets to raise. Anastacia dreams of seeing her livelihood expand in the future. Her income will be for school fees and the healthy diet of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, is aged 49, married and they're blessed with three children. She owns and operates a food retail in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP  250 daily. She sells a variety of dried fish and vegetables. 

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase vegetables, and dried fish to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds and farm inputs for more production .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new fridge for use to meet the customers' demand and to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks for her general store to meet customer demand and to help educate her children

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nenita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her semester fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and married with three children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 54-year-old, married woman she lives with her family in Zarqaa, she is conservative woman and asked her daughter Suzan to appears in the photo instead her.
 
Muna is applying for the loan to help her daughter Suzan to finish her Bachelor degree in airport management. Suzan is 19 years old, ambitious lady wants to be someone important in the future.

Muna`s husband is retired and his pension is not enough to cover the household expanse and educational fees for his kids, therefore Muna is applying for a loan to help Suzan cover the rest of her semester fees and support her to complete her education.

loans.use: To help her daughter Suzan cover the rest of her semester fees in airport management and support her to complete her education.

loans.name: Rowayda

texts.en:
Rowayda is a 44-year-old divorced woman from Bethlehem city. She lives with her family in a small house.

She works as a school teacher where she gets a low and unstable income. Rowayda is also a student at the university where she studies Arabic literature. She wants to complete her studies and take a master's degree to improve herself.

Rowayda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Rowayda will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Rowayda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the current semester installments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and seedlings for planting to get higher produce to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of assorted cereals for sale for more income gain .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, maize flour, milk, sugar and washing detergents to sell

loans.name: Mary Eilen

texts.en:
Mary Eilen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Mary Eilen dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Carmelina works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa-roofing (thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Carmelina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her nipa-roofing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa-roofing business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Marlyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to  buy more stocks of vegetables to sell for her business for her buy and sell vegetable business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Vicky dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Jerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con Yolanda con quien tiene 4 hijos menores los cuales dependen totalmente de él tiene uno en secundaria y los demás en primaria, Gerardo sueña con poder darles un estudio a todos sus hijos para que tengan la oportunidades que él no ah tenido, los ingresos de Gerardo dependen totalmente de su producción de café orgánico que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, actualmente Gerardo, está renovando sus cafetales que fueron afectados por el hongo de la roya en el 2012-2013.
Gerardo ah producido café desde que recuerda, primero con su papa luego en sus propias parcelas, “la producción de café es lo que nos ah dado para comer toda la vida nos dice Gerardo”, la zona tiene las mejores condiciones para la producción de cafés especiales (con sabores y aromas únicos) característica que Gerardo aprovecha con el apoyo técnico de COCAFCAL para poder tener mercado seguro y a mejores precios para su café.
Gerardo solicita un préstamo para renovar 0.75 hectareas de cafetal y mantener 0.75 hectareas que tiene plantada (la que se ve en la fotografía) pero aun no produce(El café inicia la producción a los dos años de edad), con el préstamo podrá comprar vivero para sembrar, insumos orgánicos, abonos orgánicos y pago de trabajadores.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 39 years old. He is married to Yolanda, with whom he has four children who are dependent on him. One of his children in is high school while the others are in elementary school. Gerardo's dream is to be able to provide his children with and education so that they have opportunities that he never had. Gerardo's income depends totally on his organic coffee production, which he sells through COCAFCAL, an organization he belongs to. Gerardo is getting his land ready to replant after they were damaged by the mushroom blight from 2012-2013. 

Gerardo has produced coffee for as long as he can remember. First, he did so with his father and later he starting growing his own crops. "The production of coffee is what has fed us throughout our lives," says Gerardo. This region has the best conditions to produce special coffees (with unique flavors and aromas), a characteristic that Gerardo takes advantage of with the technical support of COCAFCAL in order to be able to enjoy a secure market and the best prices for his coffee. 

Gerardo is requesting a loan in order to renovate 0.75 hectares of land and maintain the 0.75 hectares that he has already planted (which is shown in the photograph). Gerardo's plants are not yet producing fruit (coffee begins production at two years old). With this loan, he will be able to buy a nursery to sow plants, and organic supplies and fertilizers, and to pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy organic coffee plants, organic fertilizers, and other organic ingredients necessary to plant coffee on his land.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
This young girls name is Saida. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in the district B. Gafurov. In this area people are very hard working. Saida is also one of those people that try to work hard to provide her family with good living conditions. She has no higher education, but she is capable of working

Saida sews national and European women's dresses. Now she wants to expand her business and buy an embroidery sewing machine. Her main problem is that she does not have enough money. For this reason she applied for a loan. Saida believes in your kindness.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy an embroidery sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal bars, boards, poles and metal sheets in order to build the hallway and put window bars on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drugs

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 28 years old. He is single and lives in Badian, Cebu. Ariel is a hard-working business-minded person. 

For two years now, he has been selling Ukay-ukay (slightly used and branded) sneakers in his locale and other villages. Some of these shoes are of good quality and affordable. This makes his business work. He is asking for a loan of PHP12000 to buy more shoes to sell. He hope to make this business more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more second hand branded sneakers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools, fertilizer and seeds for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to grow more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 38 years old and married with four children. 

Elvira is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elvira has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melody works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Melody is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Melody has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Rani. Rani lives in Cianjur, an area located about three hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only child. She owns a small stall where she sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community (like electricity and water bills). Rani is a cheerful and hardworking woman and her customers see her as a trusted mobile provider.

Rani learned about Ruma from her friend who  was already an agent, and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn to expand her business. With support from Ruma’s staff, Rani has seen some improvements in her business. As the business grows, Rani is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Rani improve her business and accordingly, her community who need access to such services.

Rani is the one who is smiling in the photo. She is very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Yaqueline Isamariel

texts.es: Yaqueline de 29 años de edad vive en casa de su madre junto a sus tres hijos de 12, 11 y 7 años de edad a los que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos en un comedor de la zona, por lo que se siente feliz de poder apoyar a sus hijos con las ganancias de su trabajo, ya que desea que estudien para que opten a una mejor calidad de vida. Yaqueline desea mejorar la vivienda en la que habita, ya que esta es de láminas viejas y ella teme por la seguridad de sus hijos, anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual ha pagado a tiempo, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas viejas de la vivienda y de esta manera brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yaqueline is 29 years old and lives in her mother's house along with her three children ages 12, 11, and 7 years old, who she is raising as a single parent. Yaqueline is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living offering housekeeping services in a local restaurant. She is very happy to be able to support her children with what she earns from this job. She hopes that they finish school so that they will be able to have a better quality of life. 

Yaqueline wants to improve her home because the metal sheets are old and she fears for the safety of her children. Previously, she requested a loan that she repaid on time and now she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI in order to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire in order to change the old metal sheets on her home and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire in order to change the old metal sheets on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals as well as feed for them.

loans.name: Olinto Valle Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Olinto Valle”, lo conforman 3 mujeres, trabajadoras, emprendedoras y dedicadas a la superación personal y familiar.  Por 11va. vez  esta con ADIM, y solicitan crédito para seguir progresando en sus negocios. 
Juana, coordinadora del grupo, de 54 años, casada y con hijos. Tiene su taller de costura en su casa. Dedicada desde hace 25 años gracias al apoyo de su suegra quien le heredo las máquinas de coser. Con el crédito invertirá en  la compra de telas y mantas, para realizar sus trajes, así ofrecer variedad a su clientela. 
Las demás integrantes, Reyna de 36 años, vende ropa y zapatos, con el préstamo ingresara un nuevo producto a su negocio, la bisutería. Umbelina de 43 años, aparte de su profesión de doctora, ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias y perfumes de primera. Así obtiene más ganancias e invierte en el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
The 3 members of the Olinto Valle community bank, all women, are enterprising, hard-working, and committed to making better lives for their families.  This is their 11th round of funding from ADIM and they will use their loans to carry on their respective businesses.  
Juana, 54, is the group's coordinator.  She started her tailoring business 25 years ago with help from her mother-in-law who gave her the sewing machines she used.  She is applying for a loan now that she will use to buy supplies for carrying on the business.
The other members of the group are Reyna, 36, who operates a clothing and footwear sales business and will use her share of the loan to buy and sell jewelry and Umbelina, who will use her share of the loan to support her retail business.  The investment will help the members to increase their earnings and support their families.

loans.use: to buy material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen engages in buying and selling of lumber, charcoal and  fire wood. She is a 33-year-old married woman with three children,  ages 10,9 and 2 year old respectively.  She has been in this kind of livelihood for more than 10 years . Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Aileen has requested a loan to buy more stocks of fire wood,charcoal and additional capital too for her lumber  business. These are essential tools that would improve Aileen's earnings. She will be able to send her children to school and provide them with proper diets and better living condition.

Aileen is very grateful for the funds she availed and in return, she is doing her best to be productive and also she could support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fire wood, charcoal and additional capital for her lumber  business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle to gain more income

loans.name: Bridgid

texts.en:
Bridgid is 29 years old, married to Wilfred, and she supports a family of four family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last three years, and the business earns her an income of KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet her family needs and those of clients as she practices mixed farming.
 
She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. 

Bridgid's hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet her family needs and those of clients as she practices mixed farming.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 29 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Emelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent, beers, rice, etc. to sell.

Emelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent, beers, rice, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, beers, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetable. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like linen, zipper, tailoring chalk, etc for her tailoring shop business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like linen, zippers, tailoring chalk, etc

loans.name: Leonat

texts.en:
Leonat is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek to make some improvements to the bar café that he rented and started running last year.  Leonat is a member of the Macedonian community of Albania, in his early forties and married.  He lives with his wife and elderly retired parents in the city of Elbasan. 
 
The income for the family of four adds up to $380/month including the retirement pension of his mother of about $80/month and the net income from the bar café of roughly $296/month.

They are literally poor and the money is not even enough to cover their food expenses. Your financial help will literally go to a good cause and it will be very much appreciated by Leonat and his family members.

loans.use: to renovate the bar cafe he rented last year, which supports his impoverished family

loans.name: Hajrie

texts.en:
Hajrije is a villager and a mother of three. She is 51 years old and her children are 26, 24 and 20, and they all live in rural southeastern Albania.

She is seeking your financial help to pay for two of her daughters’ university fees. One of them is studying law and the other one foreign language.  She could not be pictured with the daughters because they were in school and far from her since they study in Tirana, the capital city of Albania. So, she chose to be photographed with her cow and the calf in their stable.
 
The activity that Hajrije has been pursuing these past twenty years is agriculture, planting and selling mostly potatoes, beans and also producing Lucerne (alfalfa) and fodder for her animals. From the cow she has, she sells some raw milk to other villagers. The income of the family of five includes some monthly income of her husband, $195/month, and her oldest daughter of $250/month.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her two daughters who are studying law and foreign language

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man who started five years ago working as an electrician to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation in his region. Throughout the years, he has succeeded in gaining loyal customers.

Today, Mohammad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a necessary, updated toolkit which will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better and quicker service.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business still more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a much needed, updated toolkit  to provide his customers with better and quicker service

loans.name: Camino Del Desierto Group

texts.es:
“Camino del Desierto” es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan por sexta ocasión el financiamiento de ADIM, quien lo coordina es la señora Ligia, 36 años, soltera, y madre de dos hijos de 5 y 18 años.  Buscando una oportunidad de superación e ingresos para ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a su hijos. Se dedica a la comercialización de productos cosméticos y venta de acero. Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de perfumería, anillos, collares, juegos de chapas, pulseras y brazaletes. Su meta es obtener ganancias que le permitan trabajar con dinero propio.  
Los otros miembros, Lizeth, esta joven de 26 años, invertirá en su negocio de comidas, y comprara productos como leña, arroz, frijol y aceite. Y doña Blanca, mujer ejemplo para muchos se dedica a la preparación y  ventas  de refresco y platanitos. Comprara azúcar, arroz, plátanos.
texts.en:
The three members of the Camino del Desierto community bank, all enterprising women, are starting their sixth round of funding from ADIM.  
Ligia, 36, is the group's coordinator.  She is a single mother with two children, 18- and 5-years old, respectively.  She started her retail business because she needed a means of supporting herself and her children.  She buys and sells jewelry and cosmetics and will use this loan to stock her business with perfumes, rings, necklaces, bracelets, etc.  Her goal is to make the business profitable enough to support it with her own earnings.  
Lizbeth, 26 operates a food sales business and will use her share of the loan to buy firewood, cooking oil and the other supplies she needs to carry on her business.  Dona Blanca, a model businesswoman for many here, will use her share of the loan to buy the supplies she needs to carry on her food sales business.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 57 years old, married to Oyugi, and she supports a family of five. She has been a farmer for the last 18 years and the business earns her an income of 12,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers and farm tools for a better harvest to sell in the market and meet clients needs. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farm tools for a better harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tree seedlings for planting in the area

loans.name: Erilda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business. Erlinda has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Ruth, 31 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Nyamaiya, a remote village in Nyamira, Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with 5 adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nyamira area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a smallholder farmer accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions, and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to pay for poultry which expand her farm and offer better profits

loans.name: Patapampa Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATAPAMPA AL PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ignacia ella es conviviente y tiene 51 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the PATAPAMPA AL PROGRESO community bank in Echarate, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.
Sra. Ignacia, 51, is married and has 5 children.  She has a farm where she grows plantains, coffee, oranges and mandarins.  She normally works from 6:00am to 6:00pm.  She has operated the business for many years and says that it is a success.  For the future, she wants to buy more land and expand the business.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy seeds and fertilizer.  
The other members of the group operate a variety of businesses: animal sales, clothing sales, corner groceries, and food sales.  
Sra. Ignacia is grateful for this means of supporting her business and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Los Jovenes Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Los jóvenes”, conformado por 2 varones y 1 mujer, con muchos deseos de superación y emprendimiento. Solicitan por quinta ocasión crédito, para desarrollar sus pequeños negocios, de los cuales ellos han surgido y crecido económicamente. 
Denis, es el coordinador del grupo, a sus 25 años es dueño de un taller de carpintería, del cual se lo heredo su padre y se ha mantenido por 4 años en esta actividad. Con el crédito comprara madera de Guanacaste, clavos, pega y lijas. Todos estos materiales fundamentales en su negocio para ofrecer productos de excelente calidad. Así aumentara su clientela y pedidos.
Los otros socios, Fabiola, de 23 años, vende ropa y calzado,  distribuye su mercancía de forma ambulante en la comunidad. Huberne 29 años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada de manera ambulante, e invertirá en pacas de ropas de niños y adultos, como también comprara pantalones nuevos.
texts.en:
The “Los jóvenes” (the young ones) group is made up of 2 men and a woman who are entrepreneurial and have a great desire to make progress. They are asking for a loan for the fifth time, to develop their small businesses through which they have moved forward and grown economically.

Denis, the group's coordinator, is 25 years old and has a carpentry workshop which he inherited from his father. He has supported himself for 4 years with this business. He will use the loan to buy Guanacaste wood, nails, glue and sandpaper. All of these materials are essential to his business so he can offer products of an excellent quality. By doing this he will increase his clientele and his orders.

Fabiola, one of the other members, is 23 and sells clothing and footwear. She sells her merchandise as a street vendor in her community. Huberne is 29 and sells new and used clothing as a street vendor. He will invest in bundles of clothing for adults and children as well as buying new trousers.

loans.use: to buy Guanacaste wood, nails, glue and sandpaper.

loans.name: Bevencia

texts.en:
Bevencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell. Bevencia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Bevencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr: Adama qui se trouve sur la photo assis au premier rang avec la corde de semis en main, est membre d’un groupe de 20 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tiakadougou-dialakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Adama, âgé de 47 ans, est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 2-16 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Adama à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 32 ans. Adama cultive le mais et le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et de semences de qualité. Adama entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de l'accès au marché. Cette année Adama effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 12 ans qu’Adama cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Adama planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Adama espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Adama, who is sitting in the first rank in the photo with the seeding rope in his hands, is member of a group of 20 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Tiakadougou-dialakoro, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

47-year-old Adama is the father of seven children from two to 16 years of age, of whom four currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home, which prompted Adama to practice this activity over the past 32 years.

Adama cultivates maize and rice on his plot of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment, and high-quality seeds. Adama is entering his first year with myAgro and became affiliated because of the payment system, the training in agricultural techniques, and access to the marketplace.

This year Adama is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize, so he can increase crop yields on his 0.25 hectare parcel (0.62 acres). For the past 12 years Adama has been cultivating maize for its food crop value and also for its market value, as maize is a food product he sells at the market.

With increased yields and income Adama plans to become a merchant and buy agricultural equipment. Finally Adama also hopes to cover the children's school fees as well as ensure his family's nutritional self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize and increase his parcel's agricultural productivity

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joseph, 53 years old; he is married and has a family of six children. He is a dairy farmer. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to be trained on financial management. 

Joseph is taking out a loan to buy animal feed and add one more calf to his herd. This will increase milk production and hence improve his living standards with things such as better healthcare.

Joseph is very grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and a calf to increase milk production.

loans.name: Los Andenes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ricardina ella es casada y tiene 78 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieo permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank "Los Andenes." This bank is located in the district of Yucay, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in the Department of Cusco.

The featured borrower is Ricardina. She is married and 78 years old, with six children. Her business is a grocery store. She sells everyday necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. She has five years of experience with this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers. 

The borrower whose picture is attached to the group photo had his picture taken later, since he asked permission to be absent for work reasons. 

The other borrowers dedicate themselves to their businesses of animal sales, clothing sales, a grocery store and food sales. 

The borrower is grateful to those who participate in this dream through the loan program, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers for her store.

loans.name: Los Tres Lirios Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Los tres Lirios”, compuesto por 3 varones, laboriosos y emprendedores. 
Coordinado por Edgar, de 49 años, viudo y con 3 hijos. Este hombre ejemplo de lucha y superación, ha sacado adelante a su familia con su negocio de venta de pan, de manera ambulante en las calles de comunidad desde hace 4 años, lo inicio con los ingresos recibidos de su trabajo anterior. 
Demostrando ser responsable solicita por sexta vez, un préstamo para la construcción de un horno en su hogar, así producirá directamente el producto, y sus ganancias serán mayores.
Álvaro, ofrece el servicio de transporte por caponeras, desea el crédito para la compra de 2 vehículos más y la compra de repuestos; Alfonso se dedica a la venta de CD y ropas, y comprara cd, pantalones y camisas para ofrecer variedad en el negocio.
texts.en:
The group “Los Tres Lirios” is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial men. It is coordinated by Edgar, who is a 49-year-old widower with three children. Edgar exemplifies hard work and excellence. He has helped his family get ahead with his bakery business, selling items door-to-door throughout the streets of his community for the last four years. He started this business with income he earned through his previous work. 

Demonstrating his responsibility, Edgar is requesting his sixth loan in order to build an oven in his home so that he will directly produce his product and increase his profits. 

Álvaro provides transportation services. He hopes to use this loan to buy two more vehicles and spare parts. Alfonso makes a living selling CD's and clothing. He will buy CD's and clothes such as pants and tops to offer more of a variety in his business.

loans.use: to build an oven in their home.

loans.name: Norma Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Norma Yanet; la socia tiene 53 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta empresa la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de una de sus computadoras.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank “Virgen de Fatima II.” The bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Calca in the Department of Cusco.

Her name is Norma Yanet, and she is 53 years old and single. She divides her time between her daily activities and her Internet business. She has worked in this business for quite a while, and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into it. She is a responsible and hard-working person, and in this way she is helping her family get ahead. 

She is requesting the loan to carry out maintenance on one of her computers. 

The borrower is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on one of her computers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; la socia continua trabajando para una entidad estatal, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta empresa la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la  crianza de animales menores, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Virgen de Fatima II” communal bank, which is located in the district of Calca, belonging to the province of Calca and department of Cusco. She is Elizabeth; she is still working for a state entity and has been working for this company for a long time. It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She is also still making a living by raising small animals; this is how she gets her family ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs, among other things. She feel pleased with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, among other things

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas ,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas, platanos y mandarinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Maribel continues working at her business selling fruit. The member is a hard-working and determined woman who, through this small business, wants to get her family ahead. The member asks for a loan to purchase apples, oranges, plantains, and mandarin oranges.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase apples, oranges, plantains, and mandarin oranges.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia tambien sigue con sus negocios de venta de comida,agricultura y ganaderia, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Cirila continues working in her business raising animals. She also continues with her businesses selling food, in agriculture and in animal husbandry.
