The member raises guinea pigs and chickens. Through this business, the member wants to establish her grocery store since it is her dream to have her own business. The member also want to have a larger space to be able to sell her animals. The member asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and also feed for the animals.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, chickens, and also feed for the animals.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas , por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas y platanos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Paulina continues working in her business selling fruit. Through this business, the member wants to get ahead. She is an enterprising woman. The member's dream is to expand her fruit sales business. The member asks for the loan to purchase apples, oranges and bananas.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase apples, oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Qolquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita, la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua criando a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar animalitos y alimentos.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales menores, tienda de abarrotes, transporte, agricultura.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgen Asunta communal bank. This bank is located in Qolquepata district, which is part of Paucartambo province and Cusco department.

The member is Margarita, who continues with her business raising small animals. She is a responsible and determined person. The member continues raising these small animals to later sell them to her customers who ask for them; this is the way that the member gets her family ahead.

The member asks for the loan to purchase animals and feed.

The other members work raising small animals, in a grocery store, with transportation and agriculture.

The members are grateful for the granted loan and promise to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La socia Marivel se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marivel continues working at her business selling food. The member is an enterprising woman who, through this business, wants her children to finish their education. The member's dream is to have a large restaurant. The member asks for the loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her diner, such as sugar, fruits, milk, flour, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es Juli Karina, la socia sigue  con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue  vendiendo chompas, casacas, a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, brindando el servicio de taxi.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Nueva Vida communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Juli Karina. She continues with her business selling clothing. The member has had this business for a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her business every day. She continues selling sweaters and jackets to her customers who ask for them, such as friends, family members, and others.  The member wants to continue being able to work so that in this way she continues supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase jackets and more.

The other members work in a business selling clothing, a business selling shoes, a grocery store business, and a taxi service.

The member is thankful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase jackets and more.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina tieneun negocio de pasamaneria,la socia vende champus,cepillos y jabones la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pasamaneria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar champus,cepillos y jabones.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Bernardina has a crafts business and she sells shampoo, brushes and soap. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m., and has already had this business for 8 years. She is getting her children ahead and her dream is to expand the crafts business. She is asking for the loan to buy shampoo, brushes and soap. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, brushes and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds to use on her farm

loans.name: Te Agradesco Señor Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Te Agradesco Señor”, conformado por 3 mujeres, que el día a día se esfuerzan para sacar adelantes sus negocios y así ayudar a progreso de sus familias.
Con el crédito solicitado, Leoncita, quien es coordinadora del grupo, casada y con dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, quienes son sus motivos de superación, comenzó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo. Su negocio es de venta de pollo y ropa usada. Con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de menudencias, titiles, salchicha, mortadelas, y una paca para ropa de niño.   
Los demás miembros son María, de 64 años, quien se dedica a la venta de hoja, en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Y Ana María, de 50 años, quien compra cosechas, e invertirá en compras de cosechas propias de la temporada como el aguacate. Así generara más ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Te Agradesco Señor” group is made up of 3 women who day by day work hard to get their businesses ahead, and in this way help their families progress.  

For the loan requested, Leoncita, who is the coordinator of the group, married, and with two children, ages 7 and 2, who are her motivation for self improvement, began her business with the help of her husband. Her business is selling chicken and used clothing. With the loan, she will invest in giblets, gizzards, sausages, mortadella, and a bundle of children's clothing. 

The other members are María, 64 years old, who works selling leaves in the Masaya municipal market and Ana María, 50, who purchases harvests and will invest in the purchase of entire harvests in this season such as avocados. In this way she will generate more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase giblets, gizzards, sausages, mortadella, and a bundle of children's clothing.

loans.name: Hekmat

texts.en:
Hekmat is a 25-year-old married man from the city of Nablus. He lives with his wife and one son in a small house. He works as an employee in a local firm. Hekmat is also a student in the university where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his study and find a better job in the future to help his family with part of their expenses.

Hekmat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Hekmat will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Hekmat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Eutemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eutemia; la socia tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa pública en el área de informática, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta empresa la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar como azúcar, leche,arroz entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen de Fatima II communal bank. The bank is located in Calca district, which is in Calca province and Cusco department. 

The member is Eutemia. She is 48 years old and single. The member alternates her daily tasks with working at a public business in the computer technology area. The member has been working for this business for a good while, which is going will for her thanks to the determination that she puts into it each day. The member is a responsible and determined woman, and this is the way that the member gets her family ahead. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase groceries for her home such as sugar, milk, rice, and more. 

The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her home such as sugar, milk, rice and more.

loans.name: Gjela

texts.en:
Gjela and Pjeter are villagers from northern Albania who are being photographed in front of a shack built in their yard used for animals and storing agricultural products and also tools and other items used in the village. They are both in their late forties and have no children. Livestock has been the activity that they have pursued to earn a little income. Currently they have ten goats and twelve baby goats and also two sows; they sell baby goats and piglets to a local farmer's market. Pjeter works sometimes and earns a little cash, and her mother-in-law who lives with them contributes with her retirement pension of nearly $100/month. 

Gjela and Pjeter will use your loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to increase the family income by adding a dairy cow to the little herd of goats and sows

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 68 years old, married, and a father of four children. He appears in this photo. Francis is a poultry farmer who has improved his business through enterprise management training he has undergone with Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. He now keeps good records for his business and manages his finances well.

Francis is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more chicks and construct a better chicken house. He hopes to improve his productivity and his income. Francis plans to use the anticipated income to cater for his family’s needs. He is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks and put up a poultry house

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 31-years-old married man from Dier El Balah city.  He lives with his wife and two kids.  Mustafa works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. He wants to improve his family living conditions but his income is barely cover all the family needs.

Mustafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water, which will decrease his electricity expenses.
Mustafa appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Alfa y Omega”, es coordinado por doña María, que a sus 50 años, es ejemplo de muchos, de emprendimiento y lucha por salir adelante ella y su familia. Soltera y con 5 hijos que ya formaron su hogar. Se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas, nacatamales y comida. Este negocio lo inicio con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Expresa que su hija le ayuda a la entrega de comidas. Y necesita del crédito para la compra de leña, maíz y cal. 
Lo integran también, Ángela de 59 años y dedicada a la venta de chatarra. Y Lilliam quien distribuye ropa y cosméticos en las calles de su comunidad. Con el crédito confían en que sus negocios y ganancias crecerán.
texts.en:
The “Alfa y Omega” group is coordinated by María, who at 50 years old, is the example of a lot, of undertaking and fighting to get herself and her family ahead. Single and with 5 children who have made their own homes, she works making and selling tortillas, Nicaraguan tamales, and food. She began this business with the payout from her previous job. She says that her daughter helps her deliver the meals, and that she needs the loan to purchase firewood, corn, and lime powder. 

Ángela, 59 years old who works selling scrap metal and Lilliam, who sells clothing and cosmetics in the streets of her community, are also members. With the loan, they trust that their businesses and earnings will grow.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for farm implements

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.en:
Maimouna, who is sitting at the end of the second row in the photo, wearing a blue scarf, is a member of a group of 18 farmers who are registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of Filokolo in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Maimouna, aged 40, is the mother of five children ages 15 to 30, of whom none are presently enrolled in school. The anchor of family tradition in agriculture, principal source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, and the fact that agriculture permits her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family, have moved Maimouna to practice this activity for 20 years now. 

Maimouna grows peanuts and maize on her plot, but as a farmer she has to face difficulties such as the lack of farm supplies and high-quality seeds and fertilizer. Maimouna is starting her first year with myAgro and registered because of the perspective of increasing her yield through the services proposed by myAgro. 

This year, Maimouna is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts so as to increase her yield on her plot of 0.0625 hectares. Maimouna has been growing peanuts for 20 years now for their value as a foodstuff, explaining that peanuts are directly edible by the family and are used as a basic sauce in cooking, and also for their commercial value since she sells peanuts at the market. 

With the increase in her yield and her income, Maimouna is planning to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Finally, Maimouna also hopes to raise goats and later cows.

loans.use: to buy herself an OPV seeds and fertilizer package for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Mate

texts.en:
Mate is the fifth born in a family of 10.  He is married and his wife helps him run the business. He has four children and three of his children go to school.  Mate is 31 year old, he went up to grade nine and dropped out of school due to financial constraints. He then worked in a arbershop and learned a lot about hair dressing and later opened his own barbershop. 

Mate is very proud of his business, he employs eight people and has added soft drinks to his business so that as customers have their hair done they can buy some drinks. Mate recently added mobile money transfers to his line of business. 

Customers come to his shop to send and receive money. Mate has requested for his first loan to enable him serve his money transfer customers effectively. Mate is hopeful that once he receives his loan, he will be able to serve more customers and earn more profit. The profits will help him provide for his family and pay his workers better wages.

loans.use: To have the cash needed for him to conduct his mobile electronic money transfer business effectively

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Hello world, meet Rose. Rose is a 35-year-old farmer who lives in Nyabite village, where she practices dairy farming. Rose and her husband are celebrating their 13th anniversary this year! The couple is blessed with four children. Her main source of income is milk. She co-owns one and a half acres of land that they use to keep two dairy cows. Recently, one of her cows delivered a calf. Rose is afraid that the upcoming rainy season will be harsh on her calf, who does not have a shelter. She is appealing to Kiva lenders to lend her a loan to construct a shelter for her animals. Your investment will help Rose build a pen that will provide a comfortable and conducive environment for the proper development of her calf and that of future calves.

loans.use: to construct a pen for her calf

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en:
Maxwell is 46 years old. He is married and has four children who he is supporting through primary and high school. His wife helps him run the business and is found at the shop with him everyday. Maxwell completed secondary school and immediately started running his own business selling soft drinks and groceries. He has run his business for almost 26 years. 

He has since started his offering the service of electronic money transfers in his shop. He is very excited to be providing the service that allows people to move their monies safely. He says by adding money transfers to his business, he has more people coming into his shop and they end up buying groceries from him. 

Maxwell is requesting a loan in order to have funds needed for him to serve his mobile money transfer customers. He explains that capital has been his biggest challenge.Through Kiva, Maxwell is hopeful that he will be able to expand his business from one outlet to five or more and bring financial services to more communities. He described himself as a driven and hardworking man who dreams of achieving success in business in order to further support his family and his children’s education.

loans.use: provide the funds needed for him to serve customers who need to access electronic transfer financial services

loans.name: Ruth Miriam

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRABAJADORAS DE HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ruth Miriamse dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank "Trabajadoras de Habaspata" [Workers of Habaspata]. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, belonging to the La Convención province and Cusco department. 

Ruth Miriam makes a living by her grocery store business, where she sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm. She has worked in this business for 5 years and it is going very well, her dream is to expand her grocery store business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She is happy for the loan and promises to complete her quota payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farm tools for better harvest for sale in the market and meet clients needs.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is very pleased to have fully repaid his first two Kiva loans. The loans helped him to start and grow his business. He was able to open two new outlets and serve more customers. The previous loans also helped to make his transactions much faster. Mark says the loans he got from Kiva helped him to increase his profit margins. He has saved enough money from his profits to purchase a laptop.

Mark is taking out a third loan so that he can he can add more capital float across his three shops to help him meet the demands of customers who need to access the electronic financial services. He is convinced that once he adds the working capital float, the outlets will be successful, because there is a high demand for people to send and receive money safely. 

Expanding the business will help to improve Mark's standard of living.Mark would like to let the Kiva lenders know that his daughter is now in high school doing her grade 10. Thanks to the support from Kiva lenders, he is able to pay for her school fees. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to increase the funds so he may provide better services to people who need to access electronic financial services

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 45 years old. She runs her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Lusaka, Zambia. Brenda is excited to be connected to Kiva lenders because it will give her the opportunity to grow her business. Her dream is to make her mobile money transfer business a great success. 

Brenda is requesting a loan to access working capital to grow her Zoona business. With the loan, she will purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, and she will use part of the money as working capital float to serve more customers who need to access financial services. Brenda is hopeful that increasing the number of people she is able to serve in a day will help her earn more profits. She intends to use the profits to help take care of her family. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona branded kiosk and have the funds needed to serve her customers

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 38-years-old married man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his wife and two kids. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. He wants to improve his family living conditions but his income is barely cover all the family needs.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. this will decrease his electricity expenses.
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 35 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He is a small scale farmer and has been growing cash crops for sell for the last 23 years. 

He will use the loan to improve his farming by buying fertilizer, seeds and crop insecticides for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and increase his income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to improve his farming and be successful.

loans.use: To improve his farming by buying fertilizer, seeds and insecticides. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and increase his income.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 33-years-old married man from Dier El Balah city.  He lives with his wife and four kids. Rami works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. he wants to improve his family living conditions but his income is barely cover all the family needs.

Rami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will decrease his electricity expenses.
Rami appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has five children. She provides for her family through mixed farming. Eighteen years ago, Lilian started farming on three acres. The activities on the farm have grown ever since. Lilian's farm now has two dairy cows, two heads of poultry, 2000 trees, maize plants, and hay. 

Lilian is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to increase the number of poultry on her farm. With more heads of poultry, she will have more products and byproducts to offer at the market. The increase in income will help her meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To pay for poultry to increase her flock and thus be able to offer more products for sale

loans.name: Marah

texts.en:
Marah is a twenty one year old single lady living in Jarash. She is studying to take her bachelor degree in chemistry.

Marah is trying her best to finish her degree and help her seven family members. But recently she is falling short in paying her fees. She decided to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees. Marah is very ambitious girl; she wants to work in the same field, and increase her incomes.

loans.use: To help her cover her semester fees in chemistry

loans.name: Rasem

texts.en:
Rasem is married, responsible father of five children lives in Jarash. He has been running his business for 15 years.  He has a small carpentry business and he likes what he is doing.  Despite to his age, he is working to nine hours a day.  In fact Rasem has been working as carpenter since he was 18 years old. 

He is facing a financial problem that prevent him from improving his business.  Therefore he applied for a loan to help him improve his shop and buy some tools and new machines to increase the quality of his products, and increase his incomes.

loans.use: To help him improve his shop with some tools and new machines to increase the quality of his products

loans.name: Darius

texts.en:
Darius successfully repaid his two loans.  He is 29 years old and continues to do well in his business. 

He runs a business of mobile money transfer which provides financial access to people who need it. Darius lives in Mazabuka and is the breadwinner in his family. He does his best to send money back home every month. 
 
Darius has requested for a third loan in order to fund his two outlets. He has more customers coming to his booths and as such he needs more money to satisfy the demand. This will enable him to serve more customers. Darius’ business is highly dependent on how much working capital float he has, in order to process customer transactions. 
 
Darius is excited to continue offering mobile money services to his community. He says the support from Kiva has helped him start to grow his business and improve his quality of life and that of his extended family. Darius would like to thank Kiva lenders for helping make his dream of running his own business a reality

loans.use: to grow his Zoona money transfer business by increasing his working capital to serve more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his semester fees

loans.name: Gwendoline

texts.en:
Gwendoline is 24 years old. She is a mother and business owner. She runs a business that enables people to send and receive money throughout the country. She lives in Lusaka, Zambia. This is Gwendoline’s third Kiva loan, she has successfully repaid back her two previous loans. She is very excited to take out another loan to help her grow her business. 

Gwendoline’s business has grown and become more successful. She has set up seven mobile money outlets and employs ten people to help with her business. It makes her very happy to have a positive impact in her community by providing a service as well as jobs. 

Gwendoline’s third loan will help her to continue to scale her business. She will be able to operate her outlets more efficiently with the additional capital to service customers.She will also purchase a trading kiosk so that can open her eighth shop. She explains how the growth in her business has translated into more people in the community visiting her shops for money transfers. This increased demand is good but requires her to have more capital to service the need.

loans.use: to grow her mobile money transfer business by opening a new outlet and increasing her capital

loans.name: Diriangen Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Diriangen” conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, a travesando su ciclo 15 con ADIM, demostrando ser personas honorables, responsables y trabajadoras. Coordinado por María Auxiliadora, casada y con un hijo de 5 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas cítricas, desde hace 5 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Con el crédito comprara piñas,  naranjas, bananos, sandias, melón. Con el fin de engrandecer su negocio y ofrecerle a su hijo una estabilidad económica, y verlo crecer profesionalmente.  
Los demás integrantes, son María de 42 años quien se dedica al destace de cerdos, e invertirá en la compra de 3 cerdos para sacarle más productos y ofrecerle a su clientela. Y Silvia de 39 años quien desde mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de cerámicas en el Mercado Municipal de Masaya, y con el préstamo comprara juegos de girasoles, jarrones, delfines.
texts.en:
The group "Diriangen" is formed by 3 entrepreneurial women, who though their 15th borrowing cycle with ADIM, proved to be honorable, responsible and hardworking people. The group is coordinated by Maria Auxiliadora, who is married and has a 5-year-old son. She makes a living by selling citrus fruits, and has done this work for the past 5 years with the help of her husband. With the loan, she will buy pineapples, oranges, bananas, watermelon and melon, with the end goal to grow her business and offer economic stability to her son, and see him grow professionally. 

The other members of the group are Maria, who is 42 years old and makes a living by butchering pigs, and will invest in the purchase of 3 pics to increase products and offer them to her customers. And Silvia is 39 years old and for many years has made a living by selling ceramics in the Municipal Market of Masaya, and with the loan will buy sets of sunflowers, vases and dolphins.

loans.use: to buy pineapple, oranges, bananas, watermelon and melon.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and three kids. 

Ahmad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions but his income is barely covering all the family's needs.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water; this will decrease the electricity expenses.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 62-year-old widowed mother of five children. A year ago she decided to open her own tailoring shop in order to cover her family's needs and expenses, for she is their breadwinner. Khadija is a very talented woman who has 40 years of experience in this domain. She learned tailoring from her mother in her childhood. 

Khadija is working hard and desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an aluminum sign for her shop and to buy fashionable textiles to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Khadija hopes to develop her business more in the future to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an aluminum sign for her shop and to buy fashionable textiles

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis,  tiene la edad  de 50 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y geminación y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Luis is 50 years old, in a relationship, and lives with his partner and their children, who are his top priority.  With his loan he plans to buy good-quality bean seed that will germinate well and fertilizers and other products to treat his crop, as well as to pay for labor to apply these products and care for the plants once they are growing, all so he can be sure to do a good job.  He plans to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in his area for this crop, as well as putting his several years of experience growing staple grains to use.  He will also be able to buy the best products and the best quality so his crop develops well and is as healthy as a good crop should be, and he will get an important yield in the short term.  He wants to use the earnings he hopes to make from his crop toward his family's wellbeing and education and to achieve some family goals and keep investing more in his crops.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any state bank loans before, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans

loans.name: Analora

texts.en:
She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her name is Analora, 26 years of age, having three young dependents. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells various commodities like canned goods, noodles, condiments, seasonings, beverages and other goods. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for nine years now.

She is asking for a loan to purchase supplies like feed and soft drinks. This will  enhance the contents of her store. Her income will improve and she could now provide her family with good food. 

Analora is hoping that she will be successful in handling her livelihood for the improvement of the family's living conditions and also to be able to finance the schooling of all her children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like feed and soft drinks

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo,  tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Bernardo is 44 years old and lives with his wife and their children, who are his top priority.  With his loan he plans to buy bean seed and fertilizers and other products to treat his crop, as well as to pay for labor to prepare the soil and apply the products and treatments to his plants once they develop, all to ensure that he does a good job.  He plans to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in the region for this crop, and he also plans to put his several years of experience growing staple grains to use.  He will also be able to buy the best products and the best quality so his plants will develop well and be as healthy as a good crop should be, and this will give him an important short-term yield.  He wants to use the income he hopes to get from his harvest for his family's wellbeing and education and to achieve some family goals and to keep investing more in his crops.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan before, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm in the hope this will enable him to harvest more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Mutame

texts.en:
Mutame is 22 years old. He comes from a family of  two brothers and two sisters. His mother runs a small business and his father is a farmer. Mutame is requesting for a Kiva loan so that he can pay for his trading booth and have the funds needed for him to serve his customers.

Mutame completed high school in 2012 and has not gone to college due to lack of funds. He decided to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business so that he can raise money to go to college. Mutame is hopeful that once he receives his Kiva loan, he will be able to earn more profits and start saving for his college tuition fees.

Mutame describes his business as a way for people in his community to send and receive money. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To pay for a trading booth, with the funds he needs to serve his customers, so he may save for college

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Daniel, 32 years old and married with three children. He joined Hand in Hand in 2013 and underwent the training in enterprise development.

Daniel is a farmer. His main activity is banana farming. He sells the bananas from his one-acre piece of land in a nearby town. He used his first loan from Hand in Hand to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and now he is planning to rent more land for his farming activities. He believes that his profits will increase and he will be able to provide for his family needs.

Daniel is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and he promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to pay for renting extra land for farming that will increase farm output.

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
Raafat is a single man living in Irbid. He is studying to get his bachelor's degree in applied arts and he is now in his fourth year. The income that comes from his father’s job is income to his family of seven members. 

Raafat's future plan is to work in arts; he is a very ambitious guy who wants to improve the standard of living, and wants to develop his experience in this field. Actually, he is working hard to achieve his dreams, but recently he is facing some problems that lead Raafat to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees.

loans.use: To help him cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Vidalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Vidalia, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, teniendo muy en claros sus objetivos y metas. Ella tiene 58 años, soltera y con dos hijos, de los cuales ya formaron su familia. Por herencia y ejemplo de su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de especies, el préstamo que solicito es para la compra de canela, cebada, semillas, clavos de olor, pimienta y más. Todo esto diversifica su negocio, y las ganancias obtenidas las invertirá en su otro negocio, ya que también se dedica a la preparación y venta de hamburguesas.
texts.en: Vidalia is a tenacious and hardworking woman who has very clear goals and objectives.  She is 58 years old, single, and has 2 children who already have their own families.  Through an inheritance and the example set by her mother, Vidalia has a business selling spices.  She is requesting a loan to buy cinnamon, barley, seeds, cloves, pepper, and other items.  All of this will diversify her business, and with the earnings she obtains she will invest in her other business preparing and selling hamburgers.

loans.use: to buy products for her business

loans.name: Shahrigul

texts.en:
This nice woman name is Shahrigul. She is 50 years old and lives with her family in the district of Bohtar. Before Shahrigul sold products in a store, but unfortunately it was not a good business for her. Therefore Shahrigul wants to open a new business. 

She wants to take a loan and engage in the purchase and sale of fruit, because now is the season of fruits and she can make a good profit from it. Shahrigul`s son helps her.  Her main problem is that she does not have money. Shahrigul looks forward for your help and promises that in the future will repay her loan in time.

loans.use: To buy fruits and start her new business

loans.name: Mirembe Kawuwa Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a rural woman and a member of Mirembe Kawuwa Group. She is married and has 5 children with four still attending school. She has struggled through thick and thin to make sure each of them attains education given her meagre income from agriculture. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX500,000 to boost her agriculture business by applying fertilizers and buying better seeds, which she is sure will boost her yields and profits, so that she can continue supporting her children's education. 

She hopes that once the burden of school fees reduces she will be able to build a better house for her family. She and the group members appreciate Kiva support and partnership and look forward to a continued partnership.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and better seeds to boost production

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
Asem is a 21-year-old, single man who lives in Irbid with his family.  Asem is studying for his bachelor degree in statistics and is in his second year. 

His father is not able to cover Asem`s university fees because he is retired from the army.  Therefore he is applying for a loan to help him to cover his semester fees. His future plan is to finish higher degrees.

loans.use: to cover his second year semester fees in statistics

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man who opened a grocery shop seven years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation in his region.
 
Today, Ahmad is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business. He will use the loan to buy more products and items (ice cream, candies, etc.) to satisfy his customers' needs and to attract new ones.
 
Ahmad hopes to expand his business in the future, to increase his income, and to stay capable of improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products and items (ice cream, candies, etc.)

loans.name: Pandeli

texts.en:
Pandeli is requesting a loan so that he could use it to repair his animal stable and also do some agricultural work. 

Pandeli is a villager in his 60s and a married father of four; his family lives in southeastern Albania. He started his agricultural activity about 20 years ago and the livestock one about three years ago. 

He plants and sells beans, corn, red beets and also lucerne for the animals.  In addition, he has two cows from which he sells 20 liters of raw milk a day for 8-9 months a year, until the delivery of their calves.  

Pandeli and his wife lives only on the money they earn from their activities and also a little pension of $288/month which is for both of them.

loans.use: to repair the damaged animal stable and also do some agricultural work

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN CHANCA.
La socia continua dedicándose a la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, gaseosas, cervezas y otras cosas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Hilda solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros. 
La socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Hilda belongs to the Virgen Chanca communal bank. She is still making a living by selling products of basic need like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, bread, soft drinks, beer and other things. She has had this business for quite a while and it going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. She is a responsible and hardworking person, since this is how she gets her family ahead. Hilda is asking for the loan to buy rice and sugar, among other items. She thanks the investors for the loan and is happy with the support provided.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 29-year-old married woman from small village near Jenin City. She lives with her husband in a small house. She is a mother to two sons and two daughters. Amal’s husband works as a construction worker, where he earns a low income. 

Amal decided to open a sewing business where she can sew different types of clothing that she will sell in the local market.
Amal is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new sewing machine. Her loan will help her increase her productivity and her income. Amal appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Nhom 2 - Luu Phuong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tien, pictured first from the left, is 58 years old. She works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about VND 600,000 ($28). 

She lives with her husband and two children who are attending school. Due to the harsh working environment, Mrs.Tien and her husband get sick frequently. Currently, the toilet in their home has been damaged severely. With this loan, Tien will use the funds to build a septic tank to improve living conditions and the health of family members and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Rexhep

texts.en:
Rexhep and his wife who is not in the photograph both worked in the metallurgical complex in their city of Elbasan. This steel complex is the only one in the country and was built by the Chinese in 1974. Due to the environmental pollution many residents of this city have been suffering from different illnesses and one of them is Rexhep.  With his wife, they receive some disability income of approximately $400/month and this is not enough at all, according to current economical information.
 
Recently he opened up a grocery store in his yard and with your loan he wants to stock up on inventory items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items in his neighborhood grocery store that he built in his yard

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es: Edgar Eduardo,  tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de una variedad de pueda tener una buena cosecha y de buena calidad y de fertilizantes y otros productos que mejoren la calidad y fertilidad del suelo y de otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Edgar Eduardo is 43 years old, is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his top priority. With his loan, he intends to make the purchase of a variety of bean seeds so that he is able to have a good, high quality harvest, of fertilizers and other products that improve the quality and fertility of the soil, and of other products to be used for planting. Additionally, it will be used to pay for manual labor to prepare the land and to apply the products and attend to the crops once they have developed, and in this way to ensure that the work is done well. 

He aims to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in this zone for the cultivation, and also to be able to put in practice his many years of experience in the management of basic grains. In addition, to be able to buy the best, high quality products so that his plantation has good development and health as well as an adequate harvest, and have a significant short-term production.

With the income from the expected harvest, he wants to use it for the well-being and education of his family, achieve some family goals, and continue investing more in the crops. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had any other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a determined emerging entrepreneur aged 33 years old. She runs her own business of mobile money transfers in Livingstone, Zambia. Faith's business provides financial services to people who need it most. 

She is requesting for her first Kiva loan to help her purchase a Zoona branded trading kiosk and provide the funds needed for her to operate her business.Faith is the fourth born in a family of four, having lost her mother at 6 and father at 9 years old, Faith says it has not been easy for her to get an education.

She is currently pursuing a bachelors degree in physiotherapy. Faith is hopeful that once her business becomes profitable, life will become much easier for her and she can improve her standard of living. Faith's biggest dream is to complete her education and grow her business so that she can provide employment to her relatives and her fellow youths.

loans.use: buy a trading kiosk for customers who need to access financial services so she may continue her physiotherapy degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is 40-year-old, married woman and lives in Dairalla.
Ayda is working as a farmer and because of the high standards of living she decided to start her business beside her work to help her husband.

She is selling blankets and she is running the business by herself. The life of her project started 2 years ago, then she decided to expand her work to add a new field which is clothes and that was good decision for her incomes.

Lately the the problem that she is facing is low liquidity, therefore Ayda is applying for the loan to buy clothes and blankets to sell to be able help her husband more and more.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to sell to be able help her husband more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help pay for his education and achieve his dreams

loans.name: Robby

texts.en:
Robby is a father of two and he runs his own business providing financial services to people in his community. His wife helps him run the business. 

Robby loves his business because it provides an essential service to the community and it earns him an income that helps sustain his family. This is the fifth loan that Robby is accessing from Kiva. He has successfully repaid three of his loans and continues to do well on his third loan repayments. 

The biggest challenges he faces are low working capital, and transport for visiting outlets. He currently runs a total number of seven Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. This means that he has to insure that all seven outlets have enough money to serve customers.  
Robby’s face lights up when he talks about the  benefits his business has had on the community. He says the  business has helped create employment in the community and the people do not need to travel long distances to receive and send money for their needs.

His dream for his business is to keep growing it so that he can open more outlets and employ more people. The proceeds from this venture will help take better care of his family and his children, who will have the opportunity of going to better schools and getting them a college/ university education without the worry of fees. 

Robby has requested for this loan so that he can expand his business by opening two more locations. He needs the Kiva loan so that he can purchase two big trading kiosks.

loans.use: To purchase two big Zoona-branded kiosks to open up two new locations in George Compound and Serenje

loans.name: Tsahiro

texts.en:
Tsahiro  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pampaida Dutse Village. Tsahiro joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Tsahiro will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Tsahiro now has the opportunity to increase his yield and income, and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Nhom 8 - Luu Phuong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cu, 51, is a farmer who earns about VND 350,000 ($17) monthly. With an extremely low income and a sick husband to support, her family is listed as a poor family in the community. The family does not have a hygienic latrine. 

A portion of Group 8 - Luu Phuong 01's loan will help Cu as well as other group members to build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap. This will not only help to improve the living conditions and health of the community, but also contribute to environmental protection. 

In the picture Mrs. Cu is the first person from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhom 4 - Luu Phuong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha, pictured first on the right, is 42 years old. She works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of about VND 600,000 ($28). Her husband does not have a stable job and her children are still in school. 

Her household does not currently have a hygienic toilet.  Ha is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has many risks, including potential adverse effects on the health of her family members and her community, as well as environmental contamination. 

With this loan she will build a septic tank toilet which will improve the hygiene and health for the family members and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 35-year-old divorced mother of two children. She used to work in clothing shops until she decided a year ago to use her experience in this domain and start selling on her own. Thus Nisrine is now selling clothes from her house to cover her family's needs and expenses.

Nisrine is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who believes that she can take care of her family independently after her divorce. 

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by buying a new collection of summer clothes which will help her satisfy her customers' needs.

Nisrine hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Ii Group

texts.es:
Wilgermine es una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 8, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de medicina natural.
Ella es buena madre, sincera, comprensiva, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘mutualista’ un lugar muy apetecido por aquellos que quieren tener su tienda o negocio de cualquier tipo, tiene al Mercado Mutualista que es un mercado muy visitado por compradores de toda la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Wilgermine es de tez trigueña, ojos rasgados obscuros, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada, viste blusa floreada y falda celeste). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como empleado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Debido a sus deseos de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de lácteos, venta de comida tradicional, venta de adornos florales, venta de pollo, venta de empanadas, venta de bisutería y llantería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud, como para energizar y rejuvenecer el cuerpo, potencializar el sistema inmunológico, generar resistencia en contra de las enfermedades, mejorar la circulación sanguínea, y otros, “inicie mi negocio al enfermarse un familiar gravemente, encontré las medicinas más efectivas y las oferte a otros enfermos…” comenta. Paralelamente a este negocio ella trabaja como contadora particular, realizando todo tipo de balances a pedido del cliente. La ventaja de su negocio es que el mercado es amplio y el producto efectivo, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para abastecer el negocio con mercadería. Su sueño es abrir una tienda distribuidora, ella desea realizar la compra de productos médicos naturales para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wilgermine solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas naturales para la salud para abrir una tienda distribuidora.
texts.en:
Wilgermine is a 43-year-old woman who is married, has three children who are 8, 10, and 12 years old, and her business is selling natural medicine products.  

She is a good mother, sincere, understanding, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking.  Her business is in the "benefit society" area, a very sought-after place for people who want to have any kind of store or business; it has the Benefit Society Market, which is heavily trafficked by buyers from all over the city.  The climate is subtropical with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade.  

Wilgermine has olive skin, dark, almond-shaped eyes, long, black hair tied back; she is short and has a thin build; her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish in general and because of her work (she is seated, wearing a floral top and a blue skirt).  She shares her life with her husband, who works as a salaried employee, and her children, who are in school; they live in house the family owns that is made of brick and cement, with a sheet metal roof and tiled floor and that has electricity, potable water, and plumbing.  Because of her drive to better herself she started a bank with people who have businesses, such as selling dairy products, selling traditional food, selling floral arrangements, selling chicken, selling empanadas, selling costume jewelry and selling tires to request loans and improve their businesses.  Her business is selling natural health products, such as to energize and rejuvenate the body, stimulate the immune system, develop resistance to illness, improve blood circulation, etc.  "I started my business after a relative fell gravely ill; I found the most effective medicines and offered them to other sick people," she tells us.  In tandem with this business she works as a private accountant, doing all kinds of balancing requested by her clients.  The advantage of her business is that the market is big and product is effective; the disadvantage is the lack of money to stock her business with merchandise.  Her dream is to open a distribution center; she wants to buy natural medicine products to stock her business.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the two years she has had her business. 

For these reasons, Wilgermine is requesting  loan to buy natural medicines for health to open a distribution center.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines for health to open a distribution center

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is 42 years old and married with two children. They are both still in school; Basma works very hard to provide for them. 

She runs a business, which is selling clothes in her home. She has been in this business for many years ago and sells a variety of clothes. 

Basma requested a loan to buy more clothes to sell in her home. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can open an independent business, afford to send her children to college, and to help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her home and increase her incomes

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Edison will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his farming by buying seeds, fertilizer and crop insecticides, which he hopes will enable him to get more farm produce to sell to support his family.

loans.name: Nhom 9 - Luu Phuong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cuc, 53, works with her husband in agricultural production. They earn a monthly income of VND 600,000 ($28). She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1992. Cuc is a member of Nhom 9 - Luu Phuong Group. 

With this VND 8,000,000 ($381) loan, she will have a hygienic latrine installed in her home. This addition will improve the quality of life for her family and will help her family and the community avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets. 

In the picture, she is the first person from the left.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Ntalasha

texts.en:
Ntalasha is a married man and a father of two (Chewe, 4 years old, and Nathan, a year and a month old). He lives with his family in Lusaka, Zambia. Ntalasha provides financial services to people in his community. He has been a Kiva beneficiary since November 2012 and has a good credit history.

Ntalasha’s core business is mobile money transfers. He helps people send and receive money to different parts of the country. He loves running his own business because he can manage his own time, and it has given him the ability to lead and train others.

The main challenges he faces are that he has less capital to expand his business and the Internet service he gets is poor, and that affects his customers. It is for this reason that Ntalasha has requested a subsequent loan. He will use the loan to serve more customers by increasing the funds that he currently has at his outlets. This will allow him to serve more customers and earn more profits. He intends to use the profits to finish building his family home and purchase some Internet modems for his outlets.

His hopes for the future are to venture into the manufacturing industry, especially building and construction material. He is convinced that this loan will have a great impact on his life and business because it will enable him to provide better for his family and also have the necessary money to expand to other businesses.

Ntalasha believes he can do all this because his passion has been business since high school, and his experience in the last five years has given him the competencies and experience to run his own business effectively.

loans.use: to serve more customers by increasing the funds that he currently has at his outlets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to increase his yield of produce to sell.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pampaida Makaranta village. Safiya joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Safiya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

With ambitious goals of harvesting 80 bags of maize this year, Safiya now has the opportunity to increase her yield and income and use her extra earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for better service to her clients.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells maize flour, cooking fat, sugar, soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years.

His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap, and other items.

He hopes that in the future, he will be well off. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Zainabo

texts.en:
Zainabo is a mother of two children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is in the business of buying and selling cocoa and gets additional income from cocoa growing.

She started the business to get income. She works hard and has plans to expand the cocoa business, but has difficulties of high competition, price changes, and long distances to markets. She hopes to buy land and own a large cocoa plantation in the future.

Zainabo requests a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied daily to clients and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman. She has one child. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks.

Her business goal is to open other business branches within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: Zeqir

texts.en:
Zeqir wants to repair his animal stable with the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders. 
He is in his 60s and a married father of five who’s been doing agriculture for about twenty four years and livestock for the past year. They live in a little village where rural activities are pursued by almost every member of the household. On the land he owns, he plants and sells beans, onions, wheat, corn to wholesale buyers and also uses fodder for his animals.  From the two dairy cows he has, he’s been selling about 20 liters a day to some nearby dairy farms.  Their family’s income is based on what they make out of their activity and also a little disability income of his wife ($90/month).

loans.use: to repair the damaged stable of his animals

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is John. He is 65 years old and has two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. This provided him with an opportunity to undergo trainings on enterprise development and financial management.

He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more stock of food stuffs for the shop. This will help meet customers' demand and thus make more income to cater for family needs.

John is happy for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of food stuffs for the retail shop that will boost income.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr: Aminata qui se trouve sur la photo debout au dessus des autres et détient la pochette dans sa main droite, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tinkele au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Aminata, âgée de 35 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 5 à 24 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Aminata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Aminata cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériel agricoles. Aminata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Aminata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans qu’Aminata cultive l’arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Aminata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre la surface cultivée . Enfin Aminata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Aminata can be seen in the photo standing above the others and holding the envelope in her right hand. She is a member of a group of four farmers who live and work in the village of Tinkele in the southeast of Bamako and who are registered with myAgro. Aminata is 35 and has seven children between the ages of five and 24 of whom six attend school at the present time. Farming is firmly integrated into the family traditions, it is the principal source of income and enables the family to be self-sufficient for their food and also for their income. These are the reasons why Aminata has been in this profession for 20 years now. Aminata grows peanuts on her plot of land, but as a farmer she must cope with difficulties such as drought and lack of agricultural materials. This is Aminata's first year with myAgro. She registered with them because of the payment system and the quality of their fertiliser. She was also convinced by the arguments of the myAgro's agents about their method. This year Aminata will buy a packet of myAgro fertiliser for the cultivation of peanuts in order to improve the yield on her plot of 0.125 hectares. Aminata has been growing peanuts for 20 years, as it has a high food producing value, she explains that she can use peanuts directly to feed her family, and also to make a sauce that is a basic in their diet. Aminata hopes that with the increase in her production and her income, she will be able to start livestock farming and to expand the size of the land that she farms. Finally, Aminata also hopes to be able to cover the school fees for her children, and ensure the family's self sufficiency for food.

loans.use: to buy a packet of fertiliser for growing peanuts and to have access to the myAgro training and farming methods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals to sell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 39 years old.  She supports a family of four. 

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 15 years, earning an income of KES 13,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her hope for the future is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has three children. 

He operates a farm where he grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as drought. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Sona Irene

texts.es: A sus 35 años de edad Sona es madre soltera, sus 4 hijos tienen 5, 9, 17 y 20 años de edad, de sus hijos 3 aun están estudiando. Sona desde que era muy joven se dedica a la agricultura y es asi que va sacando a sus hijos adelante. Sona paga arriendo por la casa en la que vive y también por los terrenos en los que siembra arveja, frejol y demás productos que se dan en su lugar de residencia por el clima que existe. Sona solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono, fungicidas, mano de obra, transporte y demás gastos que se hace en los cultivos. La aspiración de Sona es la de seguir adelante en sus siembras para  obtener buenas cosechas y sacar adelante a sus hijos. También le encantaría a futuro llegar a tener casa propia.
texts.en:
35 years old, Sona is a single mother whose four children are 5,9,17 and 20 years old, three of which are still studying. Sona has made a living from agriculture since she was very young and this is how she supports her children. She pays rent for the house in which she lives and also for the land where  she sows peas and beans and other products that grow where she lives due to the climate which exists there. 

Sona is asking for a loan to invest the money in the purchase of fertlizer, fungicides, labour costs, transport and other costs associated with the crops. Her aspiration is to continue to improve her sowing to obtain good harvests and help her children to get ahead. In the future she would also love to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 35 años de edad que vive junto a esposo y sus tres hijos dos niñas de 18 y 12 años de edad y un varón de 11 años de edad. María se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de pupusas, actividad que realiza los fines de semana, además aprovechando la clientela de la pupusería vende productos de belleza por catálogo, lo que le permite apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. María desea mejorar el techo de la cocina y las paredes, ya que actualmente se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo y la cocina de su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman of 35 years of age who lives with her husband and their three children, two girls who are 18 and 12 years old and a boy who is 11 years old. María earns a living from her business selling stuffed tortillas, which she does on weekends, as well as taking advantage of her tortilla customers to sell beauty products via catalogue. This allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. 

María wishes to improve the roof of her kitchen and the walls which are already in a deteriorated state, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, galvanised sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof and the kitchen of her house as soon as possible, and in this way improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, galvanised sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof and the kitchen of her house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
