The person in the photo is James, 32 years old, married and the father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa( HIH EA) and has undergone the enterprise development training.

He is a farmer who does maize and bean farming. These activities helped him pay off his loan granted by HIH EA without strain from the profits. He is borrowing a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds that will help boost crop yield and thus lead to more sales. This will improve his income, which he will use to provide family needs such as food and clothing.

He is grateful to Kiva and its borrowers and promises to pay well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help increase farm output and thus get more income.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en: Amiran is a 62-year-old pensioner from Kutaisi district. He is unemployed and lives on a 150 GEL monthly pension. Amiran decided to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1,800 USD. With the loan, he will purchase damaged cars at a cheap price, will repair them and will resell them at a higher price. He will be involved in his own business and will be able to generate income. The Start Up program will give Amiran a chance to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase damaged cars at a cheap price and repair them for resale

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface, a married man with three children, describes himself as faithful. He has been operating a retail business where he sells spare parts for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals. Price fluctuations are his biggest challenge.. 

Boniface will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of motorcycles spare parts. His goal is to open more business outlets within five years, and he hopes that in the future, he will have more stable family living conditions. Boniface will use the anticipated profits to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: buy more stocks of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Eduar Said

texts.es:
Eduar con un gran espíritu trabajador y aventurero, se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace unos años con una meta fija que es la de poder salir adelante y poder construir junto a su familia un buen futuro.

Es padre responsable de 9 hijos menores de edad a los cuales siempre ha procurado ofrecerles la mejor educación que le sea posible.

Trabaja todos los días en su negocio durante jornadas de 7 horas en busca de un buen producto de pescado para vender.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de estos pescados al por mayor a los pescadores de la región.

Ayuda a un humilde trabajador de las costas colombianas con un préstamo!
texts.en: Eduar with a great spirit for work and adventure has worked selling fish for the last few years. He has a fixed goal of getting ahead and being able to construct a good future with his family. He is a father responsible for 9 children, all minors, whom he has always offered the best education possible. He works every day at his business with a 7 hour day looking for good fish product to sell. He is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fish wholesale from the local fishermen. Help a humble worker from the coasts of Colombia with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish wholesale from the local fishermen.

loans.name: Yessica Joana

texts.es:
Yessica es una Hermosa joven de tan solo 20 años de edad trabajadora, luchadora, a su corta edad ya está casada, vive en un humilde hogar junto con su pareja y su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y superar las adversidades junto con la persona que ama.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, está empezando con su negocio, tiene mucho pro realizar, por comprar, necesita estanterías, vitrinas, en pocas palabras volver su negocio más formal, tener un punto de venta fijo para ocuparse ella también del hogar, mientras su esposo sale a trabajar.
Yessica solicita un préstamo para la compra de vitrinas, estanterías, para ubicar la tienda en la sala de su casa, también comprara granos, lácteos, abarrotes, mecato, productos de panadería, entre otros.
Tu préstamo ayudara a una joven a tener un negocio y trabajar por el sostenimiento y prosperidad de su familia
texts.en:
Yessica is a young woman who is only 20 years old. She is hardworking and determined. She is already married at young age. She lives in a humble home with her partner. Her dream is to improve her home's condition and to overcome adversity with the person she loves. 
She sells food staples. She is starting her business. She has a lot to do like purchasing items. She needs shelves and display cases in order to make her business more formal and to have a permanent place. She also stays in the home while her husband works. 
Yessica is requesting a loan to purchase display case and shelves to set up the store in her home's living room. She will also purchase grains, dairy products, grocery items, pastries, baked goods and other items. 
Your loan will help a young person have a business and work for the maintenance and prosperity of her family.

loans.use: start her general store business and buy shelves, display cases and grocery items.

loans.name: Yiny Lilian

texts.es:
Yini es una mujer de 37 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mercancía, vende principalmente ropa para mujer, su deseo y obsesión siempre ha sido poder construir su hogar en material (concreto, vive en una humilde casa de madera, pero la responsabilidad y compromiso de esta mujer con su trabajo hace que ella y sus dos hijos puedan disfrutar diariamente de 3 comidas, desayuno, almuerzo y cena.
Yini en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo ya que planea duplicar su mercancía, tendrá que trabajar más horas y buscar clientes, pero si lo logra, podrá ir remodelando su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yini is a 37 year old woman who works selling a variety of merchandise. She sells mainly women's clothing. Her desire and obsession has always been to built a house of solid material (concrete, she lives in a modest wooden house). But the responsibility and commitment of this woman to her work allows her and her 2 children to enjoy three meals a day breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Yini at this time is requesting a loan with which she plans to double her merchandise. She will have to work more hours and look for clients but if she can do it, then she can remodel her house and improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of woman's clothing.

loans.name: David Rivaldo

texts.es:
David es un joven hombre de 20 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas. 
El es inteligente, responsable, comprometido, constante, alegre, atento y muy trabajador. Sus estudios lo realiza en una universidad privada ubicada en la zona central, área que aglomera a la mayoría de entidades públicas y gubernamentales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
David es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes y su madre tiene una tienda de barrio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta resolviendo problemas matemáticos, le gusta entender los diagramas de flujo, su carácter es de servicio, “estudio y trabajo, mis actividades no se cruzan y trato de dar lo mejor de mí en ambos casos…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, él trabajo vendiendo teléfono celulares en su puesto fijo de venta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar las cuotas de todo el año para terminar rápidamente. Su sueño es ser profesional para conseguir un buen empleo y desea pagar las cuotas de su carrera por adelantado para recibir un descuento. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su universidad, terminar su carrera profesional rápidamente y trabajar en su rubro.
texts.en:
David is a young man who is 20 years old, single, without kids, and is studying systems engineering. He is intelligent, responsible, dedicated, consistent, cheerful, attentive, and a very hard worker. He is studying in a private university located in the central zone, this area is a conglomeration of the majority of the public and governmental entities. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees Centigrade.

David has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair styled fashionably, is of short stature, and thin build. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he no longer speaks because he studies and lives in the city.

He lives with his parents who work as merchants. His mother has a neighborhood store and they live in their own house, made of bricks and cement with a corrugated iron roof and wood floor that has electricity, potable water and a sewage system.

He is studying systems engineering and is in the 2nd year of 5 years to complete the program. He enjoys resolving mathematical problems, he likes understanding flow charts, and he has a helpful character, "I study and I work, my activities don't intersect and I try to give the best of myself in both cases..." he said.

Parallel to his studies, he works selling cellular telephones in his fixed post. The advantage of his occupation is that the hours don't intersect with each other, the disadvantage is the lack of money to pay fees for the whole year to finish quickly. 

His dream is to be a professional, to find a good job, and he would like to pay the fees for his program in advance to receive a discount. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years he has dedicated to professional studies. 


For this reason David is asking for a loan to pay the university fees, to finish his professional program quickly and to work in his field of study.

loans.use: to pay university fees, to finish his professional career quickly and to work in his field of study.

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr: Bintou qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, portant un foulard blanc, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bagnakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Bintou, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 9 enfants, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi le fait que l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance alimentaire pour sa famille, ont incité Bintou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Bintou cultive l'arachide, le mais, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et de semences de qualité. Bintou entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison des semences et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Bintou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 36 ans que Bintou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Bintou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Bintou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille
texts.en: Bintou can be seen in the photo on the left in the second row, wearing a white scarf. She is a member of a group of 10 farmers who are registered with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Bagnakoro in the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Bintou is 45 and has nine children of whom five attend school at the present time. Farming is firmly entrenched in the family traditions, it is the principal source of income and enables the household to be self-sufficient for their food and also enables her to feed her family. This is why Bintou has been in this profession for 40 years now. Bintou grows peanuts, corn, and rice on her plot of land, but as a farmer she must cope with difficulties such as drought and the lack of agricultural materials and she must obtain good quality seeds. This is Bintou's second year with myAgro. She registered with them again because of the quality of their seeds and fertiliser. This year Bintou will buy a packet of myAgro fertiliser to grow peanuts in order to improve the yield on her plot of 0.125 hectares. Bintou has been growing peanuts for 36 years, as it has commercial value, it is a product that she sells at the market. With the increase in her production and her income, Bintou plans to start livestock farming and to buy some farming materials. Finally, Bintou also hopes to be able to cover the school fees for her children, and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy a packet of fertiliser for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Sinforosa

texts.es:
Sinforosa es una mujer de 52 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos varones de 20, 18 y 14 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 16 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘el abra’ caracterizado por encontrarse el penal de reclusión, para llegar a esta población, desde la ciudad, es necesario 5 horas (dependiendo de la temporada); el servicio es realizado por propietarios individuales de buses, los mismos que realizan los viajes todos los días.
Sinforosa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos; lo 2 mayores trabajan con el padre y los menores estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no existe el alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de tripitas, una comida muy tradicional y al paso que consiste en; tripa de res hervidas y fritas en aceite acompañadas de papa y ají, “trabajo sola y cuido a mi familia, nos llegó el agua potable al lugar la cual nunca tuvimos, y deseamos contar con ese servicio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la venta es al paso y continua, la desventaja es la falta de agua potable que ocasiona la falta de buena salud. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que su familia goce de buena salud. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sinforosa solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que su familia goce de buena salud.
texts.en:
Sinforosa is 52 years old and works in food sales. She is married with 3 sons of ages 20, 18, and 14, and 2 daughters who are 16 and 8. She is a good mother and is independent, entrepreneurial, tenacious, optimistic, responsible, and hard working. She conducts her business a town called 'el abra' (the cove), which is known for being the site of the criminal prison. It takes 5 hours to get there from the city (depending on the season), and transportation is provided by individual bus owners who make the trip daily.

Sinforosa has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears braided. She is of short stature and has a slender physique. She dresses traditionally (sombrero, 'manta' shawl, 'pollera' skirt). She speaks Quechua, her native language, in the home, and Spanish in the general public and for conducting business. 

She is accompanied in life by her husband, who works in construction, and her children. The two oldest children work with their father, and the younger ones are in school. They live in a home owned by the family, which is made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof and dirt floor. They have electricity and well water extracted by a pump, but no sewage system. 

Sinforosa's business is in selling "tripitas", a traditional dish consisting of beef tripe that has been boiled and fried in oil, served with potatoes and peppers. 

"I work alone and care for my family," she says. "The drinking water now reaches our house, which it never did before, and we'd like to make use of it." The advantage of her business is that it is constant, but the disadvantage is that the lack of potable water causes a lack of good health. Her dream is to be able to depend on having potable water in her home, so she wishes to connect the water up to her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry, so that her family may enjoy good health.

This is her first set of loans in the 4 years that she has been working. Sinforosa is requesting this loan to connect the potable water to her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry, so that her family may enjoy good health.

loans.use: to connect potable water to her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry, so that her family may enjoy good health.

loans.name: Baskariah

texts.en:
Baskariah is 47 years old and supports a family of four. 

She has been practising small-scale farming for the past 13 years, earning an income of 15,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Residing in the city of Sevan in the region of Gegharkunik, Sona, with a veterinary background, works as a specialist of medicine for farm cattle.  Her husband is disabled and she, with the help of her daughter, takes care of two cows and five piglets. Sona manages to sell a little milk, macun (a national dairy product) and some meat. 

Sona needs more income to take care of her family and so is requesting this loan to buy a bull, two piglets and fodder for all her farm cattle. She thanks in advance the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a bull, two piglets and fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: This is Gulnora. She is 39 years old. She lives with her two sons in the district of Gonchi. Her husband is in Russia. He works there as a migrant worker. Her elder son is 15 and the youngest is 10 years old. Gulnora is one of the best cooks in her district. She works in a restaurant and cooks delicious food. The purpose of getting a loan is that Gulnora wants to buy a TV set for her children, since they do not have a TV in the house and her children asked her to buy them a TV. Unfortunately Gulnora does not have enough money, but she believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she will be able to fulfill her son`s dream.

loans.use: To purchase a TV set for her children

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Ella es Nelly es una mujer de 51 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos de aseo personal, como lo son cremas de manos, desodorantes, productos capilares, maquillaje, barnice, lociones, está actividad la inicio empíricamente con la ilusión de generar recursos que le permitieran ayudar a su pareja con el sostenimiento del hogar el cual lo terminan de conformar sus dos hijos que ya son adolescentes y dependen económicamente de sus padres.
Una vez Nelly pudo tener un equilibrio de ventas, clientes establecidos y mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia, quiere buscar más y ha tenido un sueño reprimido por un tiempo y ya que es empresaria quiere sacarlo a flote el cual es tener un casa vivienda pues está cansada de pagar arrendamiento.
Con sus ventas actuales no puede pagar una, ni pensar en meterse en una deuda para pagarla, por ello necesita que su negocio venda mucho más, para ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para vender una nueva línea de productos que será electrodomésticos.
Este préstamo le permitirá abrir nuevos mercados para duplicar o triplicar sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 51-year-old woman who works selling personal hygiene products, such as hand cream, deodorant, hair products, makeup, nail polish, and lotion. She began this work with the dream of generating income that would enable her to help her husband sustain the household and support their two adolescent children, who are still economically dependent on their parents.

Once Nelly can maintain balanced sales with established clients and can better her family's quality of life, she wants to seek out her unfulfilled dream, which is to have her own house since she's tired of paying rent, and since she is already a business owner. With her current sales she cannot afford one, nor go into debt paying for it, so she needs to greatly build up her business.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, in order to double or triple her monthly income.

loans.use: to sell a new line of domestic products, which will be electronic.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural products to sell

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella monto un café internet desde hace varios años y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Ella tiene 30 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar 3 computadores y una fotocopiadora, de este modo tendrá mayor oferta de servicios para sus clientes.

Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo
texts.en:
Maria is a woman with good ideas and a creative mind, and she is always looking for ways to increase her family's income. Several years ago she put together an internet cafe, and she also sells paper products from the same business. She is 30 years old and is energetically ready to face the challenges that life hands her.

She is requesting a loan to buy 3 computers and a photocopier, so that she can offer better services to her customers. With this money, she will be able to invest in her business and attract more customers, which will positively impact her profits. Her greatest dream is to have a large internet cafe with good income that generates more employment.

loans.use: to buy 3 computers and a photocopier, so she can offer better services to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and service his motorcycle to keep it fit for business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting on his farm. He hopes that this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his farming activity so as to have a better harvest to sell in the market and meet family and client needs.

loans.name: Thika Jikwamue Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is Simon, who is married with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2010. He has undergone trainings on business management and this has really helped him improve his business.

He operates a motor bike business to earn a living. Simon is borrowing from Kiva to boost his business by buying an extra motor bike to help improve income. He plans to use the anticipated income to cater for family needs.

Simon is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy an extra motor bike that will help boost income to meet family needs with ease.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of meat to sell and he hopes this will enable him to increase his income and be able to support his family.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria, con 49 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Caucasia; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor como abarrotes, granos, mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

Maria manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder Comprarse una vivienda propia para vivir allá con su familia

Ella confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 49-years old, has made her living for many years selling groceries from a store in Caucasia.  That is how she supplements her income, which she uses to get her children ahead. 

Maria's tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to work tirelessly.  She is constantly looking for a way to get ahead, which is what motivated her to request a loan.  She will use the loan to purchase whole stock such as groceries, grains, pastries, sodas, sweets, bakery products and other items.  That investment will allow her to continue working and have a greater variety of things to sell to her customers, which will improve her sales and her income. 

Maria says that her greatest desire is to be able to buy herself a house to live in with her family. 

Maria trusts in getting support from Interactuar Corporation and the Kiva lenders to achieve her objective.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale stock such as groceries, grains, pastries, sodas, sweets, bakery products and other items.

loans.name: Ya`arob

texts.en: Ya`arob is a 21-year-old single man living in Tafileh. He’s studying sports rehabilitation for his bachelor degree and is in his first year to become a sports teacher. His role model in life is his father, who works in public security. He needs the loan to pay for his semester fees, to complete the road to his dreams.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 51 years old, married to Caroline and they have two daughters Sinikiwe and Mwila. Sinikiwe is 20 and is in her third year pursuing her medical degree. Mwila is 17 and in her final year of high school. Kenneth was trained as a hotelier and has over 26 years of management experience. He left formal employment in 2012 to pursue private business in hospitality consultancy. He and his wife also run an internet and business center in Masala, Ndola.

Kenneth recently added mobile money transfers to his line of business. People in Masala go to his internet cafe to access financial services. He explains that it brings him joy to provide high level technological services to the community at affordable rates. His vision is to bring as many services as possible under one roof. Kenneth has requested a Kiva loan so that he can pay for signage and paints to make his shop more visible. The loan will also provide the funds needed to service his customers, who need to access financial services. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide the funds needed to serve customers who need to send and receive money from his shop and to pay for signage

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is 45 years old and is married with two children. He and his family are internally displaced persons (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli. They now live in the Fuzuli region. Nizami is a cameraman who makes videos of weddings, birthdays, parties, and other celebrations. He has been in this business for many years and has repaid his prior Kiva loans on time. Nizami’s car is broken.

Nizami is requesting a 1,350 AZN loan to repair his car. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their help. In the future, Nizami wants to hire an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: to repair his car for his business

loans.name: Modibo's Group

texts.fr: Modibo qui se trouve sur la photo, le seul homme dans le groupe avec la pochette en main, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bagnakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Modibo, âgé de 42 ans, est le père de 12 enfants dont 10 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Modibo à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 32 ans. Modibo cultive l'arachide, le mais, le coton sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de terre cultivables. Modibo entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Modibo effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 32 ans que Modibo cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Modibo planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Modibo espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille
texts.en:
Modibo, who is holding a myAgro pack in the photo, is the only male in this group of seven farmers who have signed up with myAgro. The group members live and work in the village of Bagnakoro, to the Southeast of Bamako in Mali. Modibo is 42 years old and has 12 children, 10 of whom are attending school. Modibo has been engaged in farm work for 32 years now. Farming has been the traditional occupation of his family and the main source of income and food for the household. Modibo grows peanuts, corn and cotton on his field. His challenge is having insufficient land to cultivate. 

This is Modibo's second year with myAgro. He has renewed his membership because of an installment plan allowing him to obtain quality seeds and fertilizers. This year Modibo is making payments on a pack of myAgro fertilizers needed to increase the yield of corn on his field of 1 ha [2.5 acres]. Modibo has been growing corn for 32 years due to its commercial value and market demand. With the increase of his crop yield and his revenues, Modibo plans to start raising livestock. In addition, Modibo hopes to be able to cover the school fees for his children as well as build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a pack of fertilizers for growing corn.

loans.name: Magnolia Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Magnolia es una madre amorosa y comprometida, en la foto junto a ella en una pared está plasmada la imagen del ser que más ama en este planeta la cual es su hija que ya tiene 10 años de edad, está estudiando y disfruta de una buena alimentación gracias a esa madre luchadora y emprendedora que tiene.

Magnolia pro su lado hace un gran esfuerzo trabajando 10 horas en su confección a terceros y lo hace por brindarle educación a su hija y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Magnolia siempre ha desempeñado su actividad para confeccionar a terceros pero ahora se encuentra pidiendo un apoyo para la compra de telas, hilos y plantillas, quiere empezar su línea de ropa, con miras a mejorar su entrada de dinero.
texts.en:
This is Magnolia.  She is a loving and committed mother.  In the above photo, there is another photo on the wall next to Magnolia.  Captured there is the image of the person she loves most in the world- her 10-year old daughter.  Magnolia's daughter goes to school and is well-fed thanks to the hard-working, enterprising mother that she has. 

Magnolia, for her part, puts forth great effort, working ten hours a day in her third-party dressmaking.  She does so to provide her daughter with an education and to improve the condition of their home. 

Magnolia has always worked as a third party dressmaker, but now she is asking for some help to purchase fabric, thread and templates because she wants to start her own clothing line.  She is doing so with en eye to increasing the money she can bring in.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food ingredients to resell to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 36-year-old married mother of three children. At first, she used to embroider towels and textiles just for fun and entertainment, but three years ago she decided to start embroidering towels and textiles and selling them in order to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their beloved kids.
 
Nisrine wants to develop her business, so she is getting a loan today from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy more towels and textiles, which will help her increase her production and satisfy her customers' special requests.

Nisrine is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who hopes to expand her business more to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more towels and textiles, which will help her increase her production

loans.name: Hysen

texts.en:
Hysen and his family live in a very poorly built home to which they want to make some repairs. He chose to be photographed with his cows instead because he did not feel comfortable showing the condition of his house.

Hysen is a married father of two who lives in a rural village with a large population where spinach pie, locally called “lakror,” is a traditional meal. He works in agriculture for a living and has three cows and about fifty sheep.  He sells raw milk to a dairy farm located not far from his village and also sells baby animals to locals. To feed his animals, he plants plenty of fodder, lucerne (alfalfa), wheat, and corn. Hysen does not sell any agricultural products because he doesn’t plant much anyhow.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his family's poorly built home, which Hysen did not want to show in the photograph because he felt uncomfortable

loans.name: Cycilia

texts.en: Cycilia, who is 41 years old, is married to Orioki and supports a family of 4 members. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 18 years, earning an income of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to improve her farming by applying modern farming technology so she can earn more income and raise her family's living standards. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To improve her farming by applying modern farming technology so she can earn more income and raise her family's living standards.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is 46 years old, supports a family of 4 members. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 20 years, earning an income of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Mary has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Yahaya Gambo

texts.en:
Yahaya Gambo is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village. He joined Kiva's field partner Babban Gona to grow his farm and develop his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan of 37,218 NGN, Yahaya Gambo will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, including fertilizers, herbicides and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to thirty bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of fourteen. This will help him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya Gambo now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy high-quality fertilizers, herbicides and improved seed

loans.name: Rostam

texts.en:
Rostam is 45 years old and lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and has a daughter and a son, both of whom are already students. Rostam’s wife is unemployed, but she is good at farming with her beloved husband. Rostam is a construction worker who does different types of hired work around his city, but he spends the greatest part of his day at his farm, where he has cows, calves, sheep, and lambs. With his wife, Rostam organizes the sale of his farm products, such as milk, macun (national dairy product), curd, cheese, and meat (beef and mutton), at the city’s wholesale market. There are also several butchers from his city who usually buy meat for their stalls from his farm only.

With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD), Rostam wants to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Nawung Sari Group

texts.en:
The Nawung Sari Group is led by the 45 year-old young farmer Anto, who is standing second from the right and pointing his thumb up in the photo. The other farmers in the group are Aji, Ima and Aran. They are standing in front of a cow house. Anto has a family with two children. All of them live in a small village in Bantul, Jogjakarta, Indonesia.

Anto has been running a small-scale vegetable farming and have a few cows to be fattened to resale. His business is going well. He also works as a hamlet-chief for his village and he was concerned to see many poor farmers there. However, he was troubled to see a high price of non-renewable cooking gas and also the cow dung was wasted without further processing, which is polluted the water in his village.

After socialized by Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and Bina Energy Mandiri Persada, CV (a local business enterprise – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Anto saw that biogas is a good solution of his problem. He saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plants. Thereafter, Anto invited three of his friends above to form a farmer group. He is keen to purchase a bio digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other farmer group members to make it possible.

He have an optimism that if he can build bio digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also want to share the remaining bio-slurry to his  neighbors. He hopes that in the future, he can invite the whole farmers in his village to use biogas and create his village as an energy and food self-sufficient village.

loans.use: To build bio-digesters facility and utilize the biogas residues as organic fertilizers

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who is 42 years old, is married to Eunice and supports 5 members in the family. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 15 years, earning 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting so he can increase production and meet both family and client needs. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Magombe

texts.en:
Magombe is a married woman. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

Magombe describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy animal feed. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy animal feed

loans.name: Denys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Denys, a sus 45 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de 3 hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenzó a comercializar accesorios para vestir y ropa lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas sola en su almacén.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará surtido de mercancía como moños, chulos para el cabello, prendas de vestir, entre otros.

Denys manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de mercancía y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Dorys!
texts.en:
Denys, at 45 years old, is a charismatic, active and helpful woman.

Being a mother of three children was the main motivator for her to fight tirelessly every day, looking for ways to earn a living and support her children.

For about five years ago now, she began marketing clothing and clothing accessories which allowed her to become known in the industry and achieve a good path.

She works every day for five hours alone in her store.

This encourages her to request the support of a loan to strengthen her inventories. With this she will buy merchandise assortment such as bows, hair accessories, clothing, among others.

Denys says that her age does not prevent her to keep doing what she's passionate about,  that is why she is able to set new goals. One of them is that of becoming a distributor of merchandise and generate employment opportunities so to improve her quality of life and the welfare of her family.

Dare to lend to Dorys' s business!

loans.use: to purchase merchandise assortment such as bows, hair accessories , clothing, among others.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida, 47, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing  goods from the market, where he has maintained many contacts for years. She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 55000 PKR  to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demand of her customers efficiently, which will help boost her earnings so that she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demand of her customers

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina es una persona humilde, ella ama de casa de profesión, vive junto a su pareja y sus tres hijos de 18, 3 y 8 años de edad, en el momento se encuentra pasando por dificultades en el tema económico y una madre protectora como Lina no iba a permitir esto.
Desesperada buscando soluciones se le ocurrió vender dulces, en las calles, en las escuelas, en su hogar, presto un pequeño capital e inicio con la venta, una vez pagado el capital quiere reinvertir en su negocio pero con mayor dinero pues con la pequeña entrada que generaba su familia iba mejorando.

El gran sueño de Lina es tener una vivienda propia, dejar de pagar arrendo, tener una tienda algo estable con lo que pueda ayudar a su familia incondicionalmente.

Lina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de utensilios para fabricar los dulces, necesita ollas, cucharones, mezcladores y materia prima para la fabricación de dulces.
texts.en:
Lina is a humble person, a homemaker by profession. She lives together with her partner and her three children, aged 18, 3 and 8. At the moment she is experiencing economic difficulties, and a protective mother such as Lina is not going to allow this to continue. 

Desperately seeking solutions, she thought of selling sweets on the streets, in schools and in her home. She borrowed a small amount of capital and started selling. Once this capital is paid, she wants to reinvest in her business, but with more money, since with the small contribution she has generated, her family has been doing better. 

Lina's great dream is to have a house of her own and stop paying rent, and to have an ongoing store with which she can help her family unconditionally. 

Lina wants to apply for a loan to buy utensils to make her sweets. She needs pots, ladles, mixers and raw materials to prepare sweets.

loans.use: to buy pots, utensils and ingredients to prepare sweets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance and fuel.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
María Sonia es una mujer veterana, trabajadora, carismática, humilde muy servicial, ella se separó de su esposo, se encontró en momentos muy difíciles en donde su familia la apoyo, en cada puerta que tocaba buscando trabajo encontró un no por su edad y falta de experiencia, hasta que un amigo un día le sugirieron que vendiera alimentos, una actividad que no requiere grandes esfuerzos físicos y que puede desempeñar cerca de su casa.

María Sonia vende pasteles, empanadas, papas rellenas, arepas de carne entre otros productos fritos y ya ajusta un poco más de 14 años de experiencia, batallando por su sostenimiento y el de su hijo que ahora es mayor de edad y que en su niñez y adolescencia encontró en María un gran apoyo y un ejemplo a seguir.

María quiere seguir progresando ya es tiempo de tener un local, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un mayor surtido, comprar sillas, mesas, una fritadora industrial de mayor tamaña e insumos para la preparación de alimentos.
texts.en:
María Sonia is a veteran and a hard-working, charismatic, and humble woman. She separated from her husband, and has found herself in very difficult moments in which her family helped her. For every door that she knocked on looking for work, she was met with rejection because of her age and lack of experience, until one day a friend suggested to her that she sell food, an activity that does not require great physical efforts and which she can perform near her home. 

María Sonia sells cakes, empanadas, stuffed potatoes, arepas [corn pancakes] with meat, and other fried products. She already has a little more than 14 years of experience, fighting to support herself and her son, who is now an adult and who in his childhood and adolescence, found in María a great support and an example to follow. 

María wants to continue progressing, and it is now time to have her own shop. For this reason, she wants to request a loan to buy greater assortment of supplies, buy chairs, tables, a large-sized industrial fryer and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.use: to buy greater assortment of supplies, buy chairs, tables, a large-sized industrial fryer and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
Sheriff is 23 years old. He is an emerging entrepreneur from Blantyre, Malawi. Sheriff completed training with Zoona and is requesting a loan to start running his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business in Blantyre. His business will serve people in his community who need access to financial services. 

Sheriff is happy for the opportunity to be connected to Kiva lenders through Zoona. He explains that accessing a loan in Malawi is not easy, as doing so requires collateral. He hopes that being connected to Kiva's lenders will help his dream of becoming an entrepreneur become a reality. 

Sheriff has requested a loan to access the working capital he needs to get his Zoona business off the ground and start serving his community. With this loan, he will pay for his setup costs, which include buying a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, some uniforms, an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cashbox, and a chair. The money will also be used as a float for him to serve his customers.

Sheriff hopes that, through his Zoona mobile money-transfer business, he will be able to make a difference in his community by providing easy access to financial services. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to provide for his basic needs. He thanks Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: To get his Zoona business off the ground and start serving his community by purchasing a branded kiosk, a mobile phone, and other equipment needed to serve his customers

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. That is why she has applied for a loan of 55,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits and cleansers for treating many customers at a time to earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently. She is very experienced in her business and is confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as the result of a loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits and cleansers for treating many customers at a time.

loans.name: Jorge Alverto

texts.es:
Jorge es un agricultor de 52 años dedicado a su trabajo y su familia, Jorge tiene 5 hijos (de los cuales 3 en la fotografía), está casado con Teresa  quien se encarga de los niños mientras él se encarga del trabajo en el campo, Jorge se dedica a la producción de café orgánico que vende en COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, aunque también tiene algunas pocas reses, Jorge sueña con poder darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor que lo que el ah tenido, “y la única manera que lo logren es estudiando”: dice Jorge además Jorge trabaja para formar un patrimonio familiar, el cual quiere que sea el inicio de sus hijos.
En este momento Jorge produce café bajo las normas Fair Trade y Orgánico, pero el hongo de la roya afecto algunas partes del cafetal y las quiere renovar ya que él quiere aprovechar al máximo su pequeña propiedad teniendo siempre los cuidados ambientales necesarios.
Actualmente Jorge está pidiendo un crédito para plantar de 0.75ha el crédito le permitirá comprar: Plantas, abonos orgánicos, insumos orgánicos y pago de trabajadores para llevar a cabo la actividad, y así la producción se reanudara pronto.
texts.en:
Jorge is a farmer of 52 years dedicated to his work and his family.  Jorge has 5 children (of which 3 are in the picture), and is married to Teresa who takes care of the children while he handles the fieldwork.

Jorge dedicates himself to the production of organic coffee sold in COCAFCAL of which he is a partner.  He also owns a few cattle.  

Jorge dreams of being able to give his children a better future than he had, "and the only way they can achieve this is through studying " he says .

In addition, Jorge is also working to create a family estate, which he wants to be the start for his children.

Jorge currently produces coffee under the Fair Trade and Organic standards, but rust fungus affected some parts of the plantation and he wants to renew them because he wants to make the most of his small property always taking into account the environmental care necessary.

Currently Jorge is asking for a loan to plant his 0.75 hectare [plot].   This loan will allow the purchase of: Plants, organic fertilizers, organic inputs and pay for workers to carry out this activity, and thus be able to resume production soon.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for replanting of organic coffee plantation such as coffee plants, organic fertilizers, organic inputs.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot, with his nice family, lives and farms in the village Lchashen of Gegharkunik region. Ashot has a daughter (she is unemployed) and a son (he is a builder). With his son, Ashot cultivates potatoes on his land and also takes care of his farm animals (cows, calves, bulls, and chickens). Ashot takes orders for potatoes long before harvesting this vegetable, and when he gathers all the harvest re-sellers buy it right from his farm. His farm produces milk, macun (national dairy product), curd, and meat, which Ashot’s wife and daughter sell at the city’s wholesale market. Since potato cultivation is the most profitable occupation for this family, Ashot is seriously engaged in it. Its development will mean more income in the near future. With this loan amount, Ashot will buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel, and also fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel, and also fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 30 years old. By starting his own business, he will be able to enroll his daughter in school and move to a better house. He is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can have the working capital required for him to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lilongwe, Malawi. His business will provide people in his community access to financial services. 

Anthony is very excited to start running his own business. The loan will help him to set up his business. He will be able to purchase a Zoona-branded kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair, and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Anthony has money to serve his customers. The kiosk will be used to serve customers in Lilongwe, as a large number of people still do not have bank accounts. Zoona has done market research and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Anthony will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town and a large number of families will be using his service. 

This opportunity to run his own business means a lot to Anthony. He will have some income to cater to his family’s basic needs, and enroll his daughter in school. He is hopeful that he will become financially stable through this business.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona-branded kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair, and a cashbox.

loans.name: Suria

texts.en: Suria is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband (also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family she began the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 26 years old. He is the second born in a family of six. He comes from Lilongwe, Malawi. He is asking for a loan in order to start running his own business.

Richard has completed training with Zoona to set up his own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means that Richard will be offering the service of mobile money to his community and earning a profit for each transaction that he makes. He is grateful for the opportunity to start running his own business. He explains that he completed high school and has just been staying at home with not much to do. With this loan, Richard will be able to serve his customers by providing the float needed for him to make transactions. The loan will also enable him to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone and cashbox. All these are necessary items for him to successfully get his business off the ground. Richard would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for their support. He is hopeful that once he starts running his own business, he can begin to contribute to the household and take care of his own basic needs like clothes and food.

loans.use: provide a working capital float needed for him to serve customers, and also to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone and a cashbox.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and their daughter in Lilongwe, Malawi. He works very hard to support his family. 

Alfred recently completed training with Zoona to start running his own business as a mobile money transfer agent. This means Alfred will provide the service of sending and receiving money for people in his community. This service is very important, as a large number of people in Malawi do not have bank accounts. This makes moving money a challenge, as they have to use unsafe means like bus services. Alfred will make a profit from each transaction that he makes. 

Alfred is requesting a loan to purchase a trading kiosk to start running his business. He will also purchase an internet-enabled phone that will help him facilitate transactions. His loan will also enable Alfred to serve his customers through functioning as working float. Float is the money that he will use to pay out to customers who are receiving money. It is essential for Alfred to run his business successfully. 

Alfred thanks Kiva lenders for the opportunity to start running his own business and improving his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone, and provide funds to serve customers

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 35 years old. She is a widow with two children. She needs a loan to start running her own business. She has successfully completed her training with Zoona and is ready to start running her own business. Leah will be a Zoona agent. This means that she will provide financial services to people in her hometown of Lilongwe and earn a commission for every transaction. 

Leah is very excited by the prospect of starting her own Zoona business and growing it so that she can support herself.  She hopes starting her own business will improve her family's standard of living. She dreams of buying her own car one day. Leah is requesting a loan in order to procure a branded kiosk, an internet-enabled phone, and a chair to sit on while she serves her customers. She will also use the money to serve her customers who need to access financial services. 

Leah thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a branded kiosk, an internet-enabled phone, and a chair to sit on while she serves her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 41 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fabricas donde trabajaba como operaria de maquinas de confección.

Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar son sus hijos quienes en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.

Ella se dedica a su negocio todos los días durante 7 horas.
Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de una auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de unas guías para instalar a sus maquinas y así realizar trabajos de confección distintos.

Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Rosa, 41 years old, has a lot of experience in the area of tailoring, thanks to her many jobs in different factories where she worked as an operator of sewing machines. Today, she is an independent woman and earns her own income through tailoring for third parties and her own small clothing line. 

She is a very enterprising woman and her greatest motivation to work is her children, who sometimes help out in her business. She is dedicated to her business every day for 7 hours. She has many projects, all of which she hopes to complete as much as possible. For this, she needs financial assistance which will allow her to inject capital into her business though the purchase of guides to install in her sewing machines and thus perform different tailoring jobs.

With this loan, she will be able to maintain her current business and continue to offer employment to people in the industry.

loans.use: to buy guides to install in her sewing machines and thus perform different tailoring jobs.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Ellen. Her biggest dream is to go back to college and study business so that she can apply what she learns to her business. Ellen has been running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. She provides financial services to people in her community and earns a commission for each transaction that she makes. 

Ellen completed her high school education and had started college but had to drop out. She explains that life has not been easy for her. She lost both her parents at a very young age and has been struggling to take care of herself and her brother. She uses the money she earns from her business to send her younger brother to school.

She is requesting a loan so that she can pay for the kiosk that she is currently using to serve her customers. This loan will also help her pay for a mobile phone, chair, cashbox, branding materials, and money that she uses to serve her customers. Zoona advanced her the working capital to start running her business. Ellen is grateful for the opportunity to run her own business and become financially independent. Her biggest dream is to see her brother complete his high school education and support herself through college.

loans.use: to pay for a mobile phone, chair, cashbox, branding materials, and money that she uses to serve her customers.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 28 years old. He comes from a family of six children. He is engaged to be married in December. He has run his own business since finishing secondary school. His business deals in selling secondhand clothes to people in his community of Limbi, Blantyre. Christopher is excited to add mobile money transfers to his line of business and to work with Zoona because it will give him the opportunity to learn more about being an entrepreneur and will bolster his business skills. He dreams of making his businesses a great success.

Christopher is requesting a loan to access working capital to get his Zoona business off the ground and have the means of achieving his dreams. He will purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, some branded fee posters, a web-enabled mobile phone, a chair and a cash box.

With this loan, Christopher will be able to serve customers who need to access financial services in Limbi. Zoona has done market research in Limbi and has determined that its location is ideal for this type of business. Christopher will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town, and a number of unbanked people in the community will be using his service.

loans.use: purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, branded fee posters, a web-enabled mobile phone, a chair and a cash box, and to have the working capital float needed to serve customers.

loans.name: Dramane's Group

texts.fr: Dramane qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à droite, porte un boubou blanc , est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bagnakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Dramane, âgé de 63 ans, est le père de 12 enfants, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi le fait que l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Dramane à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Dramane cultive le mais, le mil sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Dramane entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Dramane effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Dramane cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Dramane planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Dramane espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en: Dramane can be seen in the photo on the right in the second row, wearing a white boubou. He is a member of a group of 11 farmers who are registered with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Bagnakoro in the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Dramane is 63 and has 12 children of whom six attend school at present. Farming is firmly entrenched in the family traditions, it is the principal source of income and enables the household to be self-sufficient for their food and also for their income. This is why Dramane has been in this profession for 40 years now. Dramane grows corn and millet on his plot of land, but as a farmer he must cope with difficulties such as the absence of farming materials and of good quality fertiliser. This is Dramane's second year with myAgro. He registered with them again because of the payment method and the quality of their fertiliser. This year Dramane will buy a packet of myAgro fertiliser to grow corn in order to improve the yield on his plot of 0.5 hectares. Dramane has been growing corn for 40 years, as the production is profitable and commercially viable. With the increase in his production and his income, Dramane plans to start livestock farming and to buy some farming materials. Finally, Dramane also hopes to be able to cover the school fees for his children, and to ensure that his family is self-sufficient for food.

loans.use: to buy a packet of fertiliser for growing corn to increase the agricultural yield from his plot of land.

loans.name: Rhodriques

texts.en:
Greetings from Blantyre, Malawi! Meet 27-year-old Rhodriques, who describes himself as friendly and hardworking. He has successfully completed training with Kiva's field partner Zoona to start running his own business as a mobile money transfer operator. His business will provide financial services to people in Blantyre where he will set up his trading kiosk.

Rhodriques has requested a 714,500 MWK loan to pay for his setup costs, which include buying a branded trading kiosk, a phone and a cashbox where he can keep his money safe. Part of it will also be used as a working capital float loan so that he can provide services to the community.

Rhodriques would like to thank Kiva lenders for his loan. It will help him to realize his dream of running his own business.

loans.use: to pay for his setup costs, which include buying a branded trading kiosk, a phone and a cashbox

loans.name: Davie

texts.en:
Davie is 34 years old. He works hard to support his wife and child. Davie has worked contract jobs on and off since finishing his Information Technology course. He has just completed training with Zoona, to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Davie’s business will allow families in Lilongwe to send and receive money. Davie is happy to work with Zoona because it will give him the opportunity to run his own business and earn some profits. 

He dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur and opening more Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. Davie is requesting a loan in order to get working capital to get his Zoona business off the ground and have the means to achieve his dreams. He will purchase a Zoona-brand kiosk, some brand fee posters, and a web-enabled mobile phone, a chair, and a cash box. 

With this loan, Davie will be able to serve customers who need to access financial services in Lilongwe. Zoona has done market research and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Davie will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in the capital city and a number of unbanked people will have access to his service. 

He is greatful to Kiva lenders and urges them to continue with their kindness of lending and believing in people like him.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona-brand kiosk, some brand fee posters, a web-enabled mobile phone, a chair, and a cash box

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for sale to her clients for more income gain.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Hawa. She is married and has three children aged 27, 24, 14. .  In 1997 Hawa established her provision business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of the family and to educate her children. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Hawa has already repayed her first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy drinks, milk and sugar for resale. In the future Hawa plans to develop her business by having a second shop which she cannot meet because of difficulties in sales due to the present crisis in the country.

 She is very grateful to Kiva lenders and appreciates them for their support given to her which has improved her livelihood. 
 High competition and low capital are still major challenges she is facing. She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business so that she will accomplish her dream by opening another outlet. Thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy drinks, milk and sugar for resale to continue her business.

loans.name: Kaimithi

texts.en:
Kaimithi is a married man. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a farm where he grows maize, beans, and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Chammy

texts.en:
Chammy is 26 years old. He is one of eight children in his family. He helps his father support their family financially. Chammy previously held a job with an electrical company in his hometown of Choma before deciding to open his own Zoona business in November 2014. Chammy is an aspiring entrepreneur and is very driven by the opportunities afforded to him through his Zoona business, he particularly enjoys servicing people in his community from a variety of backgrounds. 

Chammy’s Zoona business brings financial services to people in his community who previously had to travel longer distances in order to send or receive money. One of the challenges Chammy faces is that his cash flow does not meet the demand for his services. Chammy is requesting a loan in order increase his working capital and expand his business by opening a second outlet, which would mean he wouldn't have to turn away customers, as well as provide him with increased income to support himself and his family.

loans.use: To open a new outlet and provide him with the funds needed for him to serve his customers

loans.name: Hysen

texts.en:
Hysen is in his forties, married, and has a teenage son who goes to a rural local school.  He wants to add a cow with your financial help and his promise is that he will pay the loan back on time and in full. 

Hysen and his wife plant mostly potatoes and tomatoes in their agricultural land of 7,400 square meters and they also have 115 cherry orchards and 30 apple orchards. They then sell such products to wholesale buyers. In addition to all this, they have two cows, and 30 heads of livestock such as sheep and goats.  Rural activity is the only income for their family. “We work very hard and take pride in our work. It’s a 24/7 year around hard labour that exhausts whoever does it, but we’ve got no other choices. Our son is going to join us soon when he finishes his school, and then it would be a bit better, even though he helps now as well as much as he can, because he has to do the schooling too,” said Hysen doing his work around the plants.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 37 years old. She is a mother of four. She is hopeful that once she starts earning her own money as a Zoona Agent, she will earn respect from her husband and her community. As a Zoona agent, Deborah will earn profits from all the transactions that she makes. She would like to set up her business in her hometown of Lilongwe. Deborah needs a Kiva loan to make this happen.

Deborah describes herself as a hardworking woman. She is excited to start running her Zoona mobile money transfer business, as she will have an income instead of depending on her husband for her basic needs. 

Deborah is requesting a loan in order to get the working capital she needs to get her Zoona business off the ground and start serving her community. With this loan, Deborah will pay for her set up costs. This loan will be used to buy a brand trading kiosk, framed fee posters, and some uniforms. She will also buy an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cashbox, and chair. Half of the funds will be used to serve her customers. 

The profits from her business will help Deborah to provide for her four children and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a brand trading kiosk, framed fee posters, a cell phone, and to provide the funds needed to serve customers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old. She lives in Mangochi with her husband. Mangochi is a township located near the southern end of Lake Malawi. Gladys  would like to start running her own business providing financial services for people in her hometown of Mangochi.

Before Glady’s heard about Zoona, she worked as a secretary at a local company, the company was shut down, and Gladys faced challenges in finding employment. She then decided to start running her own business so that she can provide for her basic needs and help create employment for other people. 

Gladys has requested a Kiva loan so that she can start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Her business will allow people in her community to send and receive money. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a Zoona brand kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair, and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Gladys has the money needed to serve her customers. 

Gladys would like to take this opportunity to thank Kiva for helping her make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for her set up costs and providing funds needed to serve customers

loans.name: Azatuhi

texts.en:
Azatuhi is 45 years old and she lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She lives here with her husband, son and father-in-law. Azatuhi has vocational education and despite of having the very good profession as an accountant, she never managed to work, since farming always has been her main occupation. 

Her farm is a cute one but she cares of it very much. In her farm she has 2 cows, 2 calves and a heifer. So it is obvious that the assortment of her farm products for sale is not great milk, macun (national dairy-products), cheese and curd, which she sells to her regular customers from the city. In farming her son helps her very much, who also works as a baker. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Azatuhi asks for the purchase of fodder for her farm cattle, for which she is thankful beforehand.

loans.use: for the purchase of fodder for her farm cattle, for which she is thankful beforehand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, flour and sugar to use in his business and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers.

loans.name: Ronny

texts.en:
32-year-old Ronny has continued  to grow his business.  He is married and has three children. He runs a business of mobile money transfers. This means that Ronny provides financial services to people in Monze, Zambia.

Ronny is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support in lending him money to grow his business throughout the years. This is Ronny’s fourth loan with Kiva. He has fully repaid one and continues to do very well in his repayments.
Ronny used his last there loans to expand his business. He has managed to open four outlets in the southern province of Zambia. He has two outlets in Monze town, one in Pemba district and one in Chisekese. Having mobile money outlets in different parts of the province makes Ronny very happy as he is able to help people in rural areas to access financial services. 

He says his family has also benefited from his business because he is able to provide for their needs and provide employment to his extended family. Ronny who raised  his working capital through street vending  enjoys his mobile money business, He explained that it has changed his life and is happy that he provides a service to the community because being in the street was not an easy job for him.

He is requesting for a  Kiva loan to help him grow his mobile money transfer business to service more customers by providing a safe way to send, receive, and pay bills through his shops. and make sure he stays capable of providing for his family and not bounce customers.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business so that he can service more customers by providing a safe way to send, receive, and pay bills through his shops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cloth for sewing

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.
