She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and bags. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of shoes and bags. 

Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of shoes and bags

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem  is 57-year-old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 2 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales so as to earn a good income, to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Mamine's Group

texts.en:
Mamine is seated in the front row in the photo, second from the right. She is a member of a group of 18 farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Bekossokoro, located south-east of Bamako, Mali. Mamine is 43 years old and the mother of ten children, ages 1 to 15.  Seven of her children go to school. 

The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, which constitutes the main source of income and provides food self-sufficiency for the family.  For this reason, Mamine decided to become a farmer 15 years ago.  She now grows groundnut, rice and market vegetables on her plot of land but, like all farmers, she is faced with difficulties such as the lack of rain, the lack of agricultural supplies and of high-quality fertilizers.  Mamine is starting her first year with myAgro.  She decided to join because of the payment system, the high-quality seeds and high-quality fertilizers that she could purchase.  This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and some fertilizer to grow maize and groundnut in order to increase her yield on her 0.5 hectare plot of land.

Mamine has been growing groundnut for 15 years now for its food production qualities.  She explains that groundnut can be directly consumed by the family and is used as a staple sauce in many dishes.  With her increased yield and income, Mamine is planning to start raising livestock and to expand her activity into the retail business.  She also hopes to be able to cover her children's school fees and to ensure food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a package of seeds and fertilizers to grow maize and groundnut.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia 56 years old is married to Jacob and supports a family of 6 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 33 years earning an income of KES 15,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

Patricia plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming. 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: To improve her farming by applying modern farming technology for more income gain and raise family living standards.

loans.name: Laston

texts.en:
Laston is 46 years old. He is married and has four children. He is the primary supporter of his family, including his four siblings.

 Laston started his Zoona business in order provide financial support for his family as well as to bring accessible financial services to his community. Laston is requesting a loan in order to expand his business and meet the growing demand. He hopes to one day have as many as 15 outlets, and inspire others to become entrepreneurs through his example of success.

This loan would allow him to work towards that goal, give more communities access to Zoona services, and would allow him to further provide financial support for his family. This is Laston's third Kiva loan.  He has successfully repaid his first loan and continues to make good repayments on his second loan. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to expand his business and meet the growing demand by injecting more working capital float into the business

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre que carga una gran responsabilidad, es un hombre que trabaja en la calle arrastrando una carreta, responsable, algo loco, sonriente, eufórico ante todo muy respetuoso y servicial que es padre de 5 niños a los cuales mantiene y depende económicamente de él, si no fuera poco se separó de su esposa y aparte de que genera el capital para sus muchachos tiene que pagar el arriendo de su casa, su alimentación y transporte.
Eduardo solo tiene un sueño el cual es vivir bien y tranquilo, trabajar hasta que su salud se lo permita, en pocas palabras goza mucho de su trabajo en las calles.
Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de frutas como aguacates, bananos, manzanas, uvas, kywe, entre otros productos de legumbrera como yuca, papa, tomate.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a man who carries great responsibility.  He works in the street pulling a cart.  He is responsible, a little crazy, smiling, elated, and above all very respectful and attentive.  He is the father of five children, all of whom he cares for and depend financially on him.  If that was not enough, he is separated from his wife.  

Apart from generating the capital for his boys, he has to pay for the rent of his house, food, and transportation.  Eduardo has only one dream which is to live well and quietly, and to work for as long as his health allows.  In a nutshell, he really enjoys his work in the streets.

He asks for a loan in order to buy fruit such as avocados, bananas, apples, grapes, and kiwi among other vegetable products like yuca, potatoes, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as avocados, bananas, apples, grapes, and kiwi among other vegetable products like yuca, potato, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Bledian

texts.en:
Bledian, who is 32 years old, has been photographed in front of his house with his adorable two year old son. They live in very poor conditions, because the house’s roof is leaking and buzzes from the cold temperature from almost every corner. “My little one get sick all the time due to the living conditions and I must give him a better life from what he currently has,” said Bledian to the loan officer who visited him at home in the village.  

Despite the fact that they live in a village, they don’t do agriculture because they own no land. Their village is built in a mountain and as such has no lands where villagers could plant something. It is a man made village during the communist era, because there were coal mines that now are no functional.

However, Bledian works for a pay of $300/month for a private business and his wife is mostly unemployed.

loans.use: to improve the family's living conditions

loans.name: Naseeban

texts.en:
Naseeban has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva

She has attained good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem  is 45 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000  to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mausumi

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Mausumi lives in a remote rural village named Singijani in Falakata of West Bengal. She is a very active and hardworking, married woman. She lives with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters) in her own small house. All of her children are students and studying in different grades.

They have a vegetable cultivation farm. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like eggplants, cauliflowers, carrots, cabbages, chilies, cucumbers, papayas, lady fingers, onions, etc., on the farm. Her husband sells the products to the traders in the nearest town who come to take vegetables from their farm. But their income is hardly sufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of their family — educational expenses as well as the farm expenses. Mausumi wants to expand their farming by the cultivation of more green chilies, but due to a lack of funds they are not able to do that. 

Therefore, she wants to take a loan from Kiva through BJS. She has planned to use the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like chili seeds, manure and pesticides. She expects a good return from their business by expanding the cultivation. Mausumi dreams of starting a home-based store. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm supplies for green chilies cultivation.

loans.name: Aqeela

texts.en:
Aqeela, age 45, is a divorced woman. She is the mother of four children and lives with her parents. The man shown with her in the photo is her brother who runs a small butcher shop in their community. 

He buys animals like goats & calves etc. from the market and then sells their meat in his shop. He makes enough through his business to contribute to the family income. Now he needs to improve his business to bear his household's expenses. For this reason, Aqeela has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her brother to purchase more animals to increase his sales. With this loan, he will definitely be able to improve his business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for her brother's business.

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.en:
Zumrat is 43 years old.  She is from the wonderful district of A.Jomi, in Tajikistan.  She is a neat and responsible woman. She and her husband make a living from crop production and animal husbandry.  They have five children that help them on the farm. 

At the moment, Zumrat and her husband do not have enough money to buy a few heads of cattle, and have applied for a loan.  She relies on your generosity and hopes that this time her request will not be denied and she will be able to buy cattle and increase her business.  Thank you in advance!

loans.use: to buy a few heads of cattle to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 29 years old and supports a family of three members. He has been practicing farming for the last five years, earning an income of KES 13,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay his loan and improve his family's health care. 

His future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Thoma

texts.en:
Thoma is 53 years old, married and blessed with 6 children.  He is a farmer and has been in this business for 12 years now. 

He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm, and hopes this will enable him to grow more farm produce to sell. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children.  His future hopes are to improve his farming by growing more cash crops to support his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is 51 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Gurgen is married and he has a married daughter  and a son, who is unemployed and he is looking for work. 

Gurgen for many years worked as an ambulance driver at the central hospital of Kapan city.  Now on his own,  he uses his car as a taxi service around the whole region. He mentions that he has a lot of regular customer, who daily need his taxi services. 

Gurgen also has small plot of land and he is engaged in gardening.  He sells fruits and vegetables from his garden and some part of it he also uses for his family. This loan Gurgen now greatly needs as he must repair his car, since taxi driving brings the most part of income for his family.

loans.use: Gurgen to repair his car for the continued support of his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle tires and a windscreen for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as sardines, bags of sugar, etc for her store

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 36-yr-old Fatmata.  She is married and has 2 children, ages 13 & 6 yrs. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.  In 2011, Fatmata established her provisions (sugar, mayonnaise, sardines, powdered milk, etc.) business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in the home.   Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are general community people.   Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata requested a loan in order to buy 2 bags of sugar, 2 cartons of milk, sardines, etc. for resale.  Fatmata did not meet her plans to open a bigger shop, but she was able to expand the business with the little profit raised and her livelihood was improved.

In the future, she still plans to open a bigger shop, educate her children, and build a dwelling house. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, milk, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Hafizu

texts.en:
Hafizu s a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kankanki Village. Hafizu joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hafizu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize a hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.  This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hafizu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 34 years old and is married to Zipporah. He supports five members in the family. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 10 years, earning KES 8,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be focused. 

He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of tailoring materials. 

His business goal is to have more sewing machines within 5 years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Halisu

texts.en:
Halisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kankanki Village. Halisu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Halisu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Halisu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Halisu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Tone

texts.en: Tone has 52 goats, 30 of them that she bought through the integrated loan projects and 22 are their little babies who grew up to goats. Now she added 27 more goats, but hasn't paid for them yet, and this is why she is seeking your kindness. "My husband takes the goats at 4 am to graze and returns very late at night, seven days a week and so far, he has expressed that he's been enjoying it." Tone then has to milk them according to her.  Our tasks are such; my husband does the grazing and I do the milking and selling of dairy. One person cannot do it. We are planning to hire people to help us out once we reach a 100 goats. We also plan on building a little dairy farm, where we can produce goat cheese. Let's see," said Tone smiling and content with the progress and plans for activity expansion.

loans.use: to pay for 27 goats she bought recently but hasn't paid yet

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 50 años, es soltera y muy trabajadora, desde hace 1 año tiene una tienda de abarrotes y restaurante el cual atiende todos los días.
 
Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros; y por otro lado ofrece alimentos variados.

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Rosa, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de ella y el de su madre.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, is single and very hardworking.  For a year she has had a grocery store and a restaurant where she works every day.  Her dream is to expand her store, where she sells milk, grains, vegetables, dairy products, and other items, as well as a variety of food.

Currently she is low on stock, which is detrimental because she's unable to provide a lot of products her customers request.  Because of this Rosa decided to request a loan to get more organized and buy wholesale the stock she needs: grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products to increase her offerings and provide better customer service.

This will also mean an increase in income for her so she can cover her public services, taxes, and the basic needs of all businesses.  She will also improve her own and her mother's well-being.

loans.use: to make a wholesale purchase of the stock she needs, such as grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products, so she can increase her offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 66 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for close to 20 years now. 

She will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income, and be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old and supports a family of four members. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 20 years, earning an income of KES 15,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fortified fertilizers and certified seedlings for good produce when harvesting. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming activity. Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fortified fertilizers and certified seedlings for good produce when harvesting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bull for use on her farm

loans.name: Bude

texts.en:
Bude repaired her house with your previous loan and she paid it all. Here it is what she said to her loan officer: 

" I paid the loan in full and I hope I gained some trust from lenders, so that they can help me again. I thank them very much for helping me previously and I would very much appreciate their valuable help again."

Bude's dairy cow broke her leg and it was impossible to heal; thus, she sold it out. Now she wants to replace it because she needs dairy for her family and also some raw milk to sell to make some cash.

loans.use: to replace her cow.

loans.name: Putul

texts.en:
Putul is a 26-year-old lady. She lives in Harinathpur village in Falakata, West Bengal. She is married, and together with her husband, she is raising two small children: one attends school; the other is an infant. Though she has had a limited education, Putul is very ambitious and wants to give a good education to her children.

Putul and her husband are doing vegetable cultivation to generate income. They purchase vegetable seeds, vegetable plants and fertilizers from town for vegetable cultivation. Now they are very much confident in doing vegetable cultivation and have developed their business significantly. 

Now Putul plans to take out a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to invest in teasel gourd cultivation by buying necessary supplies like seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc. Enterprising and knowledgeable, Putul decided to plant teasel gourds because it is a summer crop and she wants to get good harvest and income through the cultivation of this crop this summer. She knows she can earn more profit through it. Her future plan is to improve her financial condition and to extend her business. Her dream is to purchase agricultural land in the future for more agricultural work.

Putul extends her gratitude to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase good quality seeds, manure and other necessary things for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to access modern technology such as a green house

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 48 years old, is married to Ciciliah, and supports 4 members in the family. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 20 years earning 14,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 24 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She has been a farmer and has been growing cash crops to sell for the last one year. 

She will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay the loan. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, and to make more income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Amara .g

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Amara G. He is married and has one child, aged 7 years. 

In 2009, Amara G established his pharmacy business. He began this business because he wanted to improve his standard of living. Working 6 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Amara G. would like to take a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to purchase more medicine. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by enhancing his earnings and profit margins.  

Amara’s business has improved because of the current crisis in the country so that people go in for drugs more than ever.   

In the future, Amara plans to continue to improve his business and his family's status. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en:
Manushaqe or "violet" in English is in the photograph with her husband, Dylber, in front of their family home.  They are vulnerable Egyptian Albanians. 

To make a living, they've been collecting and selling scrap such as plastic, glass, and metal for cash. They usually collect the plastic and glass scraps from the garbage, thus, they don't have to pay. But, to collect metal scrap they do have to buy it from households, and this is the reason why they need your financial help. 

Kindly note that they have proved through previous loans to be very appreciative and responsible borrowers.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 47 years old, married to Beatrice, and he supports 5 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 12 years and the business earns him an income of 11,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.  This will allow him to increase soil fertility for a better agricultural produce and to meet client and family needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children.

His hope is to have a financially stable life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is 49 years old from Badian, Cebu.  He is a widower with four dependents ages 3, 6, 10 and 12. Carlito works hard for his children's needs. For twelve years now, he has been into buying Ukay-ukay shoes. These are slightly used, designer shoes that have been sold at affordable prices from other countries. Some of these shoes he repaired, so he can resell them. 

Ukay-ukay products are so common in the Philippines. It usually covers items such as bags, shoes and clothes. Carlito is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy more shoes. He plans to expand his business, so he can continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm

loans.name: Dayat

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Dayat. He lives with his family in Cianjur, located about 3 hours drive from Jakarta. 

Dayat owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits to his community. He came to know Ruma from the sales executive who approached him at his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well contribute more to his community. His community sees Dayat as a trusted and informative mobile credit provider.

As his business grows, Dayat is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help him improve his business and help his community members who need access to such services. 

Dayat is very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid airtime credit which he will resell to community members who need to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Ardian

texts.en:
Usually at this time of the year, Ardian prepares the land to plant beans, onions, potatoes, and fodder for the animals. 

He needs your financial help to pay for such activities. 

Kindly note that through the Integrated Loans that he previously received, his family's well-being has been improved.

loans.use: to pay for seasonal agricultural work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another donkey to assist her in water distribution

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for a better harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for better agricultural produce

loans.name: Messie

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Messie. She is married, and has four children ages 26, 23, 16 and 11 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she can help take care of her welfare and educate her.  In 2009, Messie established her provision/grocery shop where she sells mainly soft drinks, peak milk, sardines, and sugar. She began her business to improve her living standard and take care of the family. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business.  

Messie would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase more stock of sardines, sugar and milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 600,000. Although she still plans to buy a piece of land and help her husband to educate their children, she also has improved on the living standards.  Messie is very hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sardines, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 29 years old, married to Naom, and supports a family of three members. He has been in a motorcycle transport service for the last two years and the business earns him an income of KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase tyres and a windscreen for his motorcycle, so as to enable him to offer better transport services to clients and meet their demands. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and purchase more motorcycles for transport services. His hope is to have a financially stable life.

loans.use: to purchase tyres and a windscreen for his motorcycle, to enable him to offer better transport services to clients and meet their demands.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inventory of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maximilla

texts.en:
Speaking with Maximilla, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. 

Maximilla lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their 5 angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. 

Maximilla has been practicing agriculture for 10 years now. She earns money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her as well as poor productivity. 

Maximilla is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With her loan, she plans to buy good quality seed and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and farm productivity. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and standard of living. 

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, Maximilla has learned about the culture of saving, and she plans to use her additional income to improve her farming. 

This loan will go a long way towards changing the life of Maximilla and her family. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as good quality seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mate

texts.en:
Mate is 27 years old. He lives with his mother and pensioner grandmother in Kharagauli district. The family is involved in husbandry business. They have four cows that Mate's mother milks every day and she produces cheese to sell locally. Mate rented a small space to open a shop. 

The StartUp program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase food products for everyday use for example: sugar, salt, bread and so on. He will work hard in his newly opened shop in order to generate his own income and help his family.

loans.use: to purchase food products and open a small shop.

loans.name: Ylber

texts.en: Seen in the background of the photograph is Shpresa, or 'hope' in English, who is his wife; she wanted to be in the picture, yet not to be very visible. This is why she stayed a bit far for the occasion. The loan that Ylber is requesting will be used for their daughter-in-law, who has been scheduled for a surgery.

loans.use: to pay for the scheduled surgery for his daughter-in-law.

loans.name: Yanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yanto. Yanto lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about a 5-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Yanto owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business in another sector, which is technology. His curiosity makes his one of the agents who always wants to learn more, and that is why he can attract many customers. It's because he is a person who never stops learning about everything. His community also sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Yanto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Yanto’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Yanto is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Gita is a rural housewife. She is from Kanthal Bari village in Falakata. She lives there with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).  Gita attended school up to 7th grade and her husband has a secondary education. One of her children is attending school and the other one is a toddler.

Gita's husband has been running a modest grocery shop at their home for the last few years. Gita helps her husband in running the shop successfully. Maintaining a good relationship with customers has helped Gita to build a strong customer base. They buy grocery items and sell them to the customers at a reasonable price. Quality household items are also sold in their shop. Her opinion is that, though their income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus totally invested in the business, she can realize her dreams. So to get more and more income by expansion of their business, they plan to improve their business over the course of the loan. 

So Gita has applied for a business loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner). With the loan, she plans to purchase rice, oil, sugar, salt, tea, washing powder, soap, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, and other items for the expansion of their business. She hopes the loan will help her to grow their business and secure her family's future. 

She and her husband are very much grateful to their lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is 21 years old and lives in a small village in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is married and has one son who is studying in grade one. Uma is a homemaker who looks after her son and manages her household jobs.  For the last few years, Uma's husband Abhijit has been running an auto rickshaw. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeler Auto rickshaw to meet the family’s expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For the past few months, his auto-rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has not been able to generate a proper income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the auto rickshaw. 

Therefore, as a responsible wife and a member of BJS, Uma decided to help her husband and requested a loan from Kiva to help to cover the cost of repairing his auto rickshaw. She also wants to use the loan to buy auto mechanic tools.  This loan will help her husband to continue his business smoothly. 

Uma and her husband are thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To pay for repairs and buy the necessary tools for her husband's auto rickshaw to continue his transportation service.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a 23-year-old married lady lives in Falakata. She has two children; one is studying in grade one and the other one is a preschooler.

Her husband has been engaged in poultry farming and earning money for the family. Hasina helps her husband in this business. They earn an average income from the business.

Hasina is a young, idealistic entrepreneur; she always looks for growth. She now wants to expand their poultry farm, for which she is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy more chicks for breeding, chicken feed, medicine and other things for the business.   

In this area, this business is in demand, as people there prefer chicken. She believes that the supply and demand chain will allow her to have more customers, if only she can procure more. She is confident that the expansion will surely give her enough income to maintain her family and help her save enough money for her children’s education. 

Hasina believes that the surging market will increase demand, and hopes to keep growing. She is thankful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu, forty, is married and has four children aged 22, ten, nine and four years. In 2008 she started selling fish to help support the family. She sells her fish on the outskirts of Freetown to people from the general community. Working six days a week, twelve hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month.

Kadiatu took and successfully repaid a previous loan with the hope of using her profits to build a house. While she wasn’t able to do so, she was able to develop her business based on the little profit she made.

Kadiatu is now applying for a 5,000,000 SLL loan through Kiva's field partner Association for Rural Development in order to buy more cartons of fish to sell. In addition to educating her children, she still hopes to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is 22 years old from Baniswef. She is a widow and financially responsible for two sons, one daughter, and her elderly mother–in-law. 

She has a small grocery business and is working really hard to cover the needs of her family, and to save for her daughter's wedding in 5 months.  

For this, she has requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, apples and bananas to increase her sales and income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
Pinki is a rural woman who lives in Rabindranagar village in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband, one son and one daughter. One of her children is a student, the other is a toddler. 

Pinki is a housewife and her husband runs a market-bag manufacturing business. They purchase materials and stitch market bags of different size. In her leisure time, Pinki also helps in stitching the bags. Her husband supplies his finished product in the local market.

In this process, Pinki has been able to become successful to provide financial sustenance to her family. Now to increase her savings for the future, Pinki wants to expand her business. So she seeks a business loan from Kiva via BJS.  She wants to invest this loan in buying materials for their business. She is very much grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make market bags

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is an example of widowed women who are intent on writing their own destiny. A resident of Falakata in the Alipurduar district in West Bengal, she helps her family run their household by selling garments in her community since her husband's death.  Parbati is a widow and mother of three children. Her only daughter is married and her two sons are engaged in some small businesses.

At the age of 52, Parbati needs to grow her savings rapidly to meet all the necessary expenses of the family. She wants to grow her business into a self-sustaining source of income that will help her to increase savings for their living and medical expenses. 

She plans to increase her stock of garments. Parbati's undying spirit has motivated her to approach Kiva for a loan from their field partner BJS, to grow her micro-enterprise. She hopes with the help of the loan, she can smoothly reach her goals. With this loan amount, she can buy a variety of garments and attract more customers. 

She is thankful to her lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: To buy a variety of garments in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Prosper Dev't Group Kawuku

texts.en:
Rose is a repeat client in Ugafode Microfinance Ltd, having taken previously a loan of 500,000 UGX.  She is a married woman, aged 40, and with children.
        
She is a business woman that owns a depot.  In a bid to increase her working capital and expand on the business, she has applied for a loan.  Her portion,1,000,000 UGX, will go towards buying more stock of soda and beer.  She is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her since as she is now able to fund her business. The group members are also very thankful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soda and beer to maximize profit.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 49 years old and lives in Singijani village in Falakata, West Bengal. She has three children (one son and two daughters). Her daughters are married and her son is engaged in a hand-loom factory. She now lives with her husband and son in their own mud house. 

Anita's husband has been running a 'Kulfi'-making and vending business for the last many years. Kulfi is a popular frozen dairy desert in India. Kulfi has similarities to ice cream but it is denser and creamier. The ingredients required are milk, sugar, cardamom, saffron etc.  The boiled and thickened milk is poured into small moulds after adding all the ingredients and is chilled in the refrigerator for hours to make Kulfi. She and her husband manage the business. Her husband goes to a wholesale market to bring the stock of ingredients for making Kulfi. 

There is a lot of demand for their product in their locality and in the summer season, the demand will grow higher, but due to a shortage of stock, they are not able to meet the demands. So, she has approached BJS (Kiva's partner) for a loan. She now wants to buy more stock of ingredients with the present loan to increase their production level to meet the demand and grab their customers. 

She hopes this will help them to increase their income and materialize her dream of constructing a house.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to enhance their 'KULFI' business.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Anjana hails from Falakata. She is a rural housewife and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). One of the children is studying in school and the other is a preschooler. They live in their own mud and bamboo-made hut at Chuakhola in Alipurduar district, West Bengal.

Anjana's husband runs a carpentry shop where he makes beautiful pieces of art, usually furniture, to sell in the market. He works 10-12 hours each day. Gradually he is getting recognized in the village for the quality of his work. The customers are impressed by the durability of his furniture and are recommending him to their friends in the area. Due to the high price of wood, he is unable to buy more wood in order to expand his business. 

So to help her husband, Anjana is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase raw materials that basically would be wood. With the loan, her husband will be able to have the necessary resources and materials to make pieces of furniture according to the orders he gets.

Anjana dreams of getting ahead and progressing with her family, improving their quality of life and for this, she will be grateful to her generous lenders for standing by her side.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to expand her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud is 35 years old from Baniswef. He is single and runs a grocery store business. 

Masoud is very ambitious, and wishes to add poultry to sell along with fruits and vegetables to attract more customers and increase his sales. 

He has requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more poultry. He believes that his business will succeed and he will be able to repay all the installments successfully and even save for his marriage.

loans.use: to buy poultry such as ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is 37 years old and lives in Baniswef, Egypt. She is married to a farmer and has two sons. She lives in her husband's family home since her husband has to take care of his elderly father and younger brother.

Because the family’s income from farming doesn’t cover their monthly expenses, Somaya raises sheep in a room next to her house and sells their milk and cheese. She has applied for a 5000 EGP loan through Kiva's field partner Together Association for Development and Environment to buy animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.use: To buy animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Rajkumari

texts.en:
Rajkumari lives in Harinathpur village in the Alipurduar district in West Bengal. She is 31 years old and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her husband is a farmer by profession. Neither of them had an opportunity to continue their education after primary level as their family could not afford their education expenses. Her children are in different grades in village secondary schools. 
 
Rajkumari's husband strives hard to make a living. All his life, he has worked in agricultural pursuits growing different crops. He has worked in unity with his wife. With the profits obtained from their farming, they have managed to build their little house. First, he wants to get a good harvest from the land and continue to save his other earnings little by little to cover household expenses. Right now, the need that has arisen is the cultivation of a profitable crop as his present income is insufficient to cover all the expenses of his family. He decided to cultivate teasel gourd, as it is a nutritious crop in great demand although the cultivation process is easy.  They have a lack of capital to invest in their business.

Rajkumari is requesting this loan from Kiva's partner, BJS, to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and necessary farm supplies. She wants to take advantage of the summer season to obtain a good harvest with all the care and management possible to achieve her intended future earnings, which will allow her to meet the needs of the family.

Rajkumari thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for cultivation of teasel gourd.

loans.name: Malina

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Malina is a rural homemaker and she also runs her own small-scale dairy business. She lives at Falakata in Alipurduar district. She rears a cow and sells its milk in her neighborhood. She has four children; all are grownups. Two of her daughters are married, one son works in a garage and the other son is engaged in a shuttering business. Her husband supplies raw materials for manufacturing plywood.  

In addition to running her small business, she is a diligent homemaker, exceptionally adept at balancing her family’s finances. The total income of the family is quite insufficient to meet all the daily necessities and so, she has to compromise on some basic needs of the family. She hopes to change this by achieving financial stability and improving their living conditions. To earn more and achieve her goals, she has decided to grow her milk-selling business into a full-fledged dairy micro-enterprise. To put her plan into action, she needs more milk, and the cheapest way to source this is to buy another cow. 

Malina seeks a loan from Kiva through BJS.  The loan will help Malina capitalize on the spike in demand for milk. She is grateful for this opportunity and her lenders' support to achieve her hopes and goals for her family. In the future, she wants to buy a car for them.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to increase her dairy business.

loans.name: Sugapa

texts.en:
Sugapa is a 41-year-old, married woman, and mother of two sons. She is from a rural village in Alipurduar. Both of her sons help her in running the clothing business. 

Sugapa's husband is engaged in a small business of paper selling. To help her family financially, she started her business selling saris. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India. For additional income, she sells many kinds of ready-made garments also, according to the customers' demands. Sugapa started her business from her house with the help of her sons. She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris and other clothing from the wholesale market to increase her collection. Her goal is the fulfillment of the demands of her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. 

Now she is playing an important role by giving financial support to her family. With the growing needs of her family, she wants to expand the business.  She expects a large profit from this business and a boost in her earnings. 

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of saris to expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Amara.  He is married, and has one child aged nine. In 2011, Amara established his DVD cassette, downloading, ipod, phones and empty CD business. He began his business because he wants to improve on his livelihood, and take good care of his family. Working six days a week, and nine hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Amara now requires a new loan in order to purchase more stock for resale. 
His living standard has improved a bit with the help of the last loan, out of the profit he raised.  In the future, Amara still plans to educate his child and increase his profit earnings. Competition and low capital are his challenges. He is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of CD's, DVD's  etc for resale.

loans.name: Motazaa

texts.en:
Motazaa is 40 years old from Baniswef. She is married and has 3 sons. She takes care of her aged mother and has a grocery stall. Her husband works as a farmer in one of the nearby fields. 

Motazaa and her husband are working hard to give their sons a better life. So she requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy more fruits and vegetables such as zucchini, cucumbers, apples and mangoes.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables such as zucchini, cucumbers, apples and mangoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans and gari for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new battery so his actual solar system works correctly to light the house, and with this improve life conditions of  his family and him.

loans.name: Lima-Malma Abdu

texts.en:
Lima-Malma Abdu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kankanki Village. Lima-Malma Abdu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Lima-Malma Abdu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Lima-Malma Abdu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Lima-Malma Abdu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Nady

texts.en: Nady is 41 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has four sons. Nady has a fruit sales project and his wife sells vegetables in the market to help him with the family income. Nady requested a 4000 EGP to buy more fruits such as apples, bananas and water melons to increase his sales and income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more fruits such as apples, bananas and water melons.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Sia. She is married, and has three children ages 24, 18 and 9. She has two additional dependents that live with her for assistance. In 2003, Sia established her local food stuff ( palm oil and charcoal) business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband with some family responsibilities. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Sia requires a loan in order to buy more containers of palm oil, and 200 bags of charcoal for resale. In the future, Sia still plans to build a house and to educate her children.  She is very much grateful to Kiva lenders and appreciates them for their support given to her which has improved her livelihood.  She is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more containers of palm oil, and bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crates of drinks for her business

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Mariatu.  She is married and has three children aged 17, 15, and 10yrs. In 2013, Mariatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she has no formal education, so she decided to engage in business. Her business is located at city center and her main customers are both men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5000000. Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy more containers of palm oil for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase the level of her additional income. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more containers of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Thandiwe

texts.en:
Thandiwe is excited to be getting her second Kiva loan. She is making good repayments and her business continues to grow.She is taking out a subsequent loan to enable her open a new outlet so that she can expand her business and provide for her son. She is a single mother aged 44.

Thandiwe describes her business as the quickest way for people in Zambia to send and receive money. She has been running her business since 2013. With her first loan, Thandiwe was able to increase the working capital at her shop, this helped her to serve more customers and she is now ready to open another Zoona mobile money transfer outlet in Kanyama compound. 

By opening this new outlet, Thandiwe will give make it much easier for people in Kanyama township to transfer their monies without having to go to the central business district. Thandiwe thanks the Kiva lenders for lending her money to improve on her business and her life.

loans.use: To have working capital for her financial services business

loans.name: Alima's Group

texts.fr: Alima qui se trouve sur la photo assis devant et tenant la pochette dans sa main et le drapeau sur sa poitrine, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Demeni au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Alima, âgée de 43 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu, mais aussi le fait que l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer une autosufficance alimentaire pour sa famille, ont incité Alima à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Alima cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'herbicides. Alima entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité. Cette année Alima effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 18 ans qu’Alima cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Alima planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Alima espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Alima, who is sitting in the front of the photo, holding the pouch in her hand and wearing the flag around her neck, is a member of a group of eight crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Demeni, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

43-year-old Alima is the mother of four children, one of whom currently attends school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home, which prompted Adama to practice this activity for over 20 years.

Alima cultivates groundnuts and rice on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment, and herbicides. Alima is entering her second year with myAgro and renewed her affiliation because of the payment system and the high quality of seeds.

This year Alima is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, so she can increase crop yield on her 0.25 hectare parcel (0.62 acres).

For the past 18 years Alima has been cultivating groundnuts for its nutritional value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a basic sauce in food preparations, but also for its commercial value, since groundnuts are a food product she sells at the market.

With increased yields and income Alima plans to become a merchant. Finally Alima also hopes to build a home and ensure the family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Sokoura's Group

texts.fr: Sokoura qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, portant une voile noire, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Gouanan au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Sokoura, âgée de 51 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 10 à 30 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Sokoura à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 12 ans. Sokoura cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Sokoura entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Sokoura effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 12 ans que Sokoura cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Sokoura planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Sokoura espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Sokoura, who is sitting in the center of the photo wearing a black headscarf, is a member of a group of 18 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Gouanan, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

51-year-old Sokoura is the mother of five children from 10 to 30 years of age, one of whom currently attends school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home, which prompted Sokoura to practice this activity for over 12 years.

Sokoura cultivates groundnuts, rice, and market produce on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment, and quality fertilizer. Sokoura is entering her first year with myAgro and became affiliated because of the payment system and the high quality of seeds and fertilizer.

This year Sokoura is making payments to buy a package of OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, so she can increase crop yields on her 0.0625 hectare parcel (0.15 acres).

For the past 12 years Sokoura has been cultivating groundnuts for its nutritional value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a basic sauce in food preparations, but also for its commercial value, since groundnuts are a food product she sells at the market.

With increased yields and income Sokoura plans to raise livestock and become a merchant. Finally Sokoura also hopes to cover the children's tuition fees and ensure the family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and benefit from training in agricultural techniques offered by myAgro

loans.name: Sali's Group

texts.fr: Sali qui se trouve sur la photo avec le drapeau de myAgro autour du cou à gauche, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mountougoula au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Sali, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 9 enfants âgés de 8 à 28 ans, dont 9 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Sali à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Sali cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de semences de qualité. Sali entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Sali effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Sali cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Sali planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Sali espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Sali, who is sitting on the left of the photo wearing a myAgro flag around her neck, is a member of a group of 8 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Mountougoula, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

40-year-old Sali is the mother of nine children from eight to 28 years of age, all of whom currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home, which prompted Sali to practice this activity for over 30 years.

Sali cultivates groundnuts on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of high-quality fertilizer and seedlings. Sali is entering her first year with myAgro and became affiliated because of the payment system and the myAgro agents' belief in the advantages of the myAgro system..

This year Sali is making payments to buy a package of OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, so she can increase crop yields on her 0.0625 hectare parcel (0.15 acres).

For the past 30 years Sali has been cultivating groundnuts for its nutritional value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a basic sauce in food preparations, but also for its commercial value, since groundnuts are a food product she sells at the market.

With increased yields and income Sali plans to become a merchant. Finally Sali also hopes to build a home and ensure the family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Oen Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: H. L. Marie Angeline

texts.fr:
Marie Angeline a 44 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari travail en tant que commercial et il ne perçoit que des commissions, ce qui veut dire que son revenu est instable.
Marie Angeline dirige un commerce de boucher depuis 2008. Au début, avant d'acquérir le petit pavillon, elle effectuait des livraisons seulement. C'est une femme débrouillarde et très active, elle voudrait développer et étendre son commerce. 
Son objectif est de pouvoir ouvrir un autre point de vente, acquérir un autre pavillon que son mari pourra gérer et diriger. 
Marie Angeline a trois enfants mais seul le dernier est actuellement à sa charge.
texts.en:
Marie Angeline is 44 years old. She is married and her husband works as a salesman. He only receives  commissions which means that his income is not stable. 

Marie Angeline has been managing a butcher shop since 2008. In the beginning, before acquiring the little stall, she only made deliveries. She is a resourceful woman, very active, and she would like to develop and expand her business. 

Her goal is to be able to open another sales point and acquire another stall that her husband could manage. 

Marie Angeline has three children but only the youngest is presently under her care.

loans.use: to buy more meat for resale

loans.name: Olga Luceidy

texts.es:
Olga Lucely es una joven de 24 años de edad, toda una emprendedora un ejemplo de vida del campo, ella sola inicio con su negocio de venta de cerdos y cría de aves pero con la gran y puntual diferencia que no espero a que los clientes llegaran a ellas, todos los fines de semana sale en busca de clientes y preguntar que paso con los clientes antiguos es muy atenta y preocupada por su profesión ya que d esta depende no solo ella, sino también sus dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, una madre muy responsable que tiene un gran futuro en el negocio agrícola.
El principal objetivo de Olga es mantener su negocio primeramente, luego pensar en expandirse y ser una productora de mayoreo de huevos y venta de animales.
Olga quiere solicitar una considerable suma de dinero para implementar  varios cambios en su negocio, en un primer lugar quiere reparar los galpones de pollos y construir otros dos, comprar cerdos, pollos y gallinas ponedoras para duplicar su producción de huevo, todos estos esfuerzos harán que el negocio de Olga se vaya pareciendo a una finca y ser considerada una de las principales proveedoras en su vereda.
texts.en:
Olga Lucely is 24 years old. She is quite the entrepreneur and the perfect example of a countryperson. Olga started her own business selling pigs and raising birds. She expected customers would come to her but, as they do not, she heads out every weekend in search of customers and to find out where previous customers are. Olga is very attentive and concerned for her work as not only does she depend on it but so do her two children, ages five and three years old. Olga is a very responsible mother who has a big future in farming.
	
Olga’s main objective is to keep her business going. She also wants to expand the business and produce eggs in bulk and sell more animals. 

Olga is applying for a considerable loan in order to implement various changes at her business. First she wants to repair her chicken coops before building another two coops; she will then buy pigs, chickens and laying hens in order to double egg production. All of this work will make Olga’s business seem like a big farm and it will become one of the main suppliers in the local area.

loans.use: to repair chicken coops and build two more, and to buy pigs, chickens, and laying hens in order to double egg production.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer casado, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 20 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora 8 horas al día.
  
Luz sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco e intentara mejorar su vida y la de su familia al lado de la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Luz is married. She is very hard-working and responsible. She has worked in different businesses with her family and gained experience in sales.

Twenty years ago Luz opened a grocery shop to run herself. She works there eight hours per day.

Luz dreams of own a supermarket in the future. She is currently applying for a loan in order to buy a variety of products such as vegetables, fruits, grains and more in bulk, and to provide her customers with quality products.

This business has allowed Luz to get ahead gradually. She wants to improve her and her family’s life alongside Interactuar and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as vegetables, fruits, grains and more in bulk.

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr: Bintou qui se trouve sur la photo sur une chaise avec le drapeau sur la poitrine, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de M'Piela au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Bintou, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Bintou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 2 ans. Bintou cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, d'engrais de qualité et d'herbicides. Bintou entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison des semences de qualité et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Bintou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 2 ans que Bintou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Bintou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Bintou espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Bintou is the woman seated in the front row in the photo, wearing a banner on her chest. She is a member of a group of 7 farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of M'Piela, located south-east of Bamako, Mali. Bintou is 50 years old and the mother of seven children, three of whom currently attend school.

The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, which constitutes the main source of income and provides food self-sufficiency for the family. For this reason, Bintou decided to become a farmer two years ago and she now grows groundnut on her plot of land. Like all farmers, however, she is faced with difficulties such as the lack of rain, the lack of high-quality fertilizers and herbicides. Bintou is starting her second year with myAgro. She decided to join again this year because of the high-quality seeds and high-quality fertilizers that she can purchase. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and some fertilizer to grow groundnut in order to increase her yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot of land.

Bintou has been growing groundnut for two years now for its nutritional value, since groundnut can be directly consumed by the family and is used as a staple sauce in many dishes. She also chose groundnut for its commercial value, since she sells groundnut at the market. With her increased yield and income, Bintou is planning to start raising livestock and to expand her activity into the retail business. She also hopes to build a house one day and to ensure food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a package of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnut.

loans.name: Ludys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ludys, de 43 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras, útiles escolares y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.
Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes y mejorar su capital.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Ludys, 43 years old, knows exactly what she wants in her life and is determined to move forward and have a good life.

She sells various goods for a living, such as clothing, wallets, schools supplies, and cosmetics, among other things. She began doing this in an effort to obtain the resources necessary to sustain herself.

She is a very enterprising and disciplined woman. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a wide range of merchandise and to have inventory available to sell to her customers and improve her capital. 

She hopes to be able to improve as a business owner and have a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of merchandise and have inventory available to sell to her customers and improve her capital.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene es una veterana de 52 años de edad, ella trabaja vendiendo ropa para hombre y mujer, no tiene hijos vela por su cuidado y el de su empleada, en estos últimos tiempos ha visto que la ropa de mujer ha estado dejando de venderse, quizás por la falta de actualización de surtido y es un mercado que está perdiendo, sabiendo que es muy potencial puesto que las mujeres son las que más compran, como Martha no cuenta en el momento con capital quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de ropa para mujer buscando captar nuevamente ese público que le puede generar unos buenos ingresos importantes en el desarrollo y consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha Irene, 52, is a veteran merchant who sells men's and women's clothing.  She has no children, so only takes care of herself and an employee.  Lately she has noticed a downturn in women's clothing sales, perhaps due to a lack of current styles, so she is losing market share.

Since Martha knows women are the ones who do most of the shopping, she wants to buy a variety of clothing to attract more customers.  She does not have the capital herself and is requesting a loan for the purchase in an aim to generate a good income to develop and consolidate her business.
