loans.use: To buy women's clothing to attract more customers.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su moto a través de las veredas del municipio de Santa Barbara posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su hijo de 8 años al cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su moto ya que es su único medio de trabajo y con el vela por el bienestar de su progenitor.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a Marco con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Marco is a very hard worker and organized.  He earns a living offering transportation services to people in the streets of the town of Santa Barbara who wish to travel to different areas of the city.

He is a kind, service oriented entrepreneur who is single and supports an eight-year-old son who he tries to provide for as best he can.

Marco is requesting a loan to repair and maintain his motorcycle since it his only means of work to care for his family.

With this loan he will be able to keep his vehicle in better condition to provide a totally safe service and not put the lives of his customers at risk.

Please support Marco with your loan!

loans.use: To repair and maintain the motorcycle he uses for work.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús es un persona muy reconocido de Itagüí, el vende frutas y verduras en su carro que lo ha acompañado tantos años, deambula por la ciudad, de un punto a otro vendiendo sus productos, lo hace con el propósito de comprar una vivienda propia, inicio con unas canastas de madera peor ha tenido un inconveniente y es que este material ha estado deteriorando la pintura del carro, por ello quiere cambiar a canastas plásticas aparte de que son más grandes puede tener un mayor número de productos, para realizar un plan de inversión que quiere ejecutar necesita capital, pero si consigue el dinero podrá duplicar sus ventas pues optimizara el espacio de su vehículo un 100% para diversificar y aumentar la cantidad a vender diaria.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de canastas plásticas, mayor surtido en frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Jesus is very well-known in Itagüi where he sells fruit and vegetables from the car he has had for many years.  He travels throughout the city from one point to another selling his products, in an aim to buy his own house one day.  He started his business with wood crates but has run into an inconvenience with them because the wood deteriorates the paint of his car.  So he wants to change to plastic crates which are larger and can carry more products.

He needs capital to carry out the investment and if he is able to double his sales he can optimize the space in his vehicle 100% and diversify and increase daily sales.

He is requesting a loan to buy plastic crates and a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy plastic crates and a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Ella es Martha, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.

Ella decidió por iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de comidas como tamales, almuerzos y desayunos desde su hogar desde hace aproximadamente 5 años al con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por la cocina, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como carne, arroz, verduras y utensilios de cocina.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.
Es una mujer que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Martha, a woman with a strong character and good will, who wants to prosper and get ahead with her family.  Approximately five years ago she decided to set up a food business to sell tamales, lunches and breakfasts out of her home, with much determination and drive.

She learned the trade on her own out of necessity and because she enjoys cooking.  This has allowed her to gain vast experience.

Now she would like to give her business a small boost with the help of Kiva lenders and Corporacion Interactuar.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as meat, rice, vegetables and cooking utensils.  The loan will allow her to maintain her business and make it grow on a daily basis.

She is a woman who takes on challenges and face them with a lot of courage.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food business, such as meat, rice, vegetables and cooking utensils.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William es un vendedor de mercancía independiente que encontró en esta profesión una buena salida al momento crítico financiero que atravesaba en el año 2011, con la ayuda de los ingresos que está generando puede generar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia que la conforma su pareja y sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, a pesar de la competencia en el sector, de los altos costos de los productos, de la difícil situación de orden público por la que atraviesa su barrio sigue trabajando por su familia y su cumplimiento de sueños que son pagar la educación de sus hijos y comprar vivienda. 
William solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de uso domésticos Amway, que son más saludables y también desea cambiar los hábitos alimenticios de sus clientes a través de sus productos.
texts.en:
William is an independent merchant who found in his profession a good way to climb out of the critical financial moment experienced in 2011.  With the income he is earning he is able to provide his family with a better quality of life.  He has a partner and two children, ages eight and three.  Despite the competition in the sector, the high cost of the products and the difficult situation in the neighborhood he lives in, he continues to work for his family and to meet his goals of paying for his children's education and buying a house.

William is requesting a loan to buy Amway home products which are healthier.  He also wants to change his customers' eating habits through these products.

loans.use: To buy products to promote healthy eating habits.

loans.name: Magaia

texts.pt: Casado maritalmente, pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 são do sexo masculino e um do sexo feminino. É cliente da instituição á 5 anos e todos os créditos que levantou foram pra habitação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção para finalizar sua obra, nomeadamente: 30 sacos de cimento, 20 ferros varrão 8mm , 12 chapas de zinco. Do momento seu maior desafio é concluir sua obra porque a casa onde esta a viver actualmente é pequena e não cabe para toda família. Em termos de sonhos e esperanças a nível profissional sente se satisfeito e a nível pessoal o cliente sonha em montar uma pequena banca pra comercializar produtos de primeira necessidade.
texts.en:
Magaia is married with four children, 3 boys and 1 girl.  He has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and all of the loans he has requested were for housing.  With the current loan he intends to buy construction materials to complete his building project, namely:  30 sacks of cement, 20 8mm bars, and 12 zinc panels.  At the moment his greatest challenge is finishing this construction project because the house where he currently lives is small and his entire family does not fit.  In terms of his professional dreams and aspirations he is satisfied and on a personal level he hopes to set up a small stand where he can sell staple goods. 

.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of cement, 20 8mm bars and 12 zinc panels.

loans.name: Noemia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Noémia é solteira, mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 1 a 15 anos, cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema a bastante tempo tendo conhecido a mesma a partir da sua mãe que é cliente e membro da organização. Com os anteriores financiamentos construi sua casa e abriu uma barraca que esta a desenvolver um pequeno negócio, com o presente financiamento pretende comprar 20 sacos de cimento, 40 ferros de 8mm, uma carrada de pedra, 50 estribos e pagar o mestre.
Seu maior sonho é ter um negocio fora da localidade da Ponta de Ouro para aumentar o seu rendimento e a nível profissional sente se satisfeita trabalhando como recepcionista. Tem como seu maior desafio concluir as obras na sua casa e posterior construir um estabelecimento comercial noutro local.
texts.en: Noémia is single.  She has 3 children ages 1 to 15.  She has been a client of Hluvuku-Adesma for a long time, having learned about it from her mother who is also a client.  With her prior loans she built her home and opened a stand where she is starting a small business.  With the current loan she plans to purchase 20 sacks of cement, 50 8mm bars, a load of stones, 50 braces, and to pay her contractor.  Her greatest dream is to have a business outside of Ponta de Ouro to increase her earnings.  On a professional level, she is happy with her work as a receptionist.  Her greatest challenge is to complete construction on her house and later build a commercial establishment in another location.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of cement, 40 8mm bars, a cart of stones, 50 braces, and pay the contractor.

loans.name: Najiyu

texts.en: Najiyu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kankanki Village. Najiyu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Najiyu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Najiyu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Najiyu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase crop yields.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Aminata. She is married and has three children aged 19, 23, and 25 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her; she assists them in their education and takes care of their well-being. In 2012, Aminata established her grocery store, selling items such as sugar, milk, mayonnaise, etc. She began her business because she wanted to take care of her family and improve their living standard. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are both men and women. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 2,100,000 SLL every month from this business.

Aminata would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase items such as 5cts sardines, 3bags sugar, 5 cartons milk, 6 cartons mayonnaise and 10cts luncheon meat for resale. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase the level of her additional income. In the future, Aminata plans to buy a plot of land to build a rental house. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as sardines, sugar, and milk for her store.

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en: Cassien is 37 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 6 years. One of them goes to school. He sells spare parts and he has been in business for the past 10 years. His wife is also a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In the future, he aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maidawa Village. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isiyaku will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 110 bags of maize this season, Isiyaku now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase crop yields.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maidawa Village. Samaila joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Samaila suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Samaila has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Samaila can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase crop yields.

loans.name: Bature

texts.en: Bature is a Babban Gona farmer from Maidawa Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Bature no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bature now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maidawa Village. Yusuf joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusuf will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. With the ambitious goal of harvesting 100 bags of maize this season, Yusuf now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a sink to collect water to use in her home.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, almuerzos, arepas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Martha y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Martha desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la adecuación de un galpón de pollos, los cuales son uno de los ingredientes principales en sus comidas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Martha is a humble, hardworking woman who has dedicated most of her life to the care of her children. 

She lives in the municipality of La Dorada, where she successfully works in her own kitchen. Her business is preparing and selling meals on a pre-order basis.

She cooks tamales, chorizos, empanadas, lunches, arepas, and more. She sells mainly to the neighbors in the area, who are familiar with her cooking and count on  always getting meals that taste great and are very well prepared.

Martha is looking to increase her sales as well as to work more comfortably. She is applying for a loan to set up a shed to keep chickens,  one of the main ingredients in her cooking.

This loan provided through Interactuar will give her the opportunity to get ahead with the business and obtain the income she needs to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to set up a shed to keep chickens, which are a main ingredient of the meals she prepares.

loans.name: Pachojila Group

texts.en:
San Lucas Toliman is a town on the southeastern shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlan in Guatemala.  The Maya there speak Kaqchikel and sometimes Spanish as a second language. Pachojila is a neighborhood of San Lucas Toliman. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Pachojila”, with its nine members, is located here. The hardworking ladies of “Pachojila” have determined their goals and objectives and are now ready to receive their first microcredit loans from Kiva investors.  

A very spirited Gilda is a member of “Pacholjila”.  She has had only three years of formal education but has worked hard to generate income for her family.  Besides having a snack shop where she sells typical Guatemalan dishes, she also sells typical Guatemalan skirts (cortes) with her partner father.  Gilda is asking for a loan to buy accessories in a variety of colors and patterns to enhance the skirts.  She feels that the enhanced skirts will please her customers and attract new ones which then will earn extra income for her family.  

The nine ladies of the Trust Bank “Pachojila” are very grateful to the Kiva lenderrs for supporting their financial needs through the microloans that improve their businesses.  They appreciate being able to reinvest in their small business and see them grow.  Thank you Kiva !!!

loans.use: to buy accessories to enhance the traditional skirts she makes, in a variety of colors and patterns

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 65 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a general store business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 19500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft-drinks, coffee, milk, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft-drinks, coffee, milk, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena owns a few cows and lives for selling their milk. She decided to invest in a biodigester in order to take advantage of her cow's manure to produce her own renewable energy and organic fertilizer, which will allow her to significantly reduce her operating costs. She used to spend a large portion of her income on expensive LP gas, while she was piling up her cows' manure outside the farm, letting it emit greenhouse gases and contaminate underground water sources. By transforming waste into a resource, she will displace fossil fuels from her farm, save money and protect the environment. 

Lorena will cook and heat water with biogas, and fertilize her crops with the natural, nutrient-rich organic fertilizer, the other product of her biodigester. As she treats her cows' waste, Lorena's living environment will improve, as bad smells and flies will progressively disappear. She is looking forward to saving money and already thinks about buying additional cows to expand her milk production capacity.
This loan represents 41% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 14m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Luz De Vida Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Luz de Vida” is ready to begin its second loan cycle through Kiva.  The Trust Bank has eight members - one member is brand new.  The other seven members have worked hard in the previous loan cycle.  The primary goal of the members of “Luz de Vida” is to increase the inventories of their different small businesses.  Along with increasing their inventories, they have also benefited from the “Microcredit Plus” non-formal education program of Friendship Bridge.

Rosa is one of the eight grateful members of the group who has seen extra income generated from her business.  Rosa is married with all five of her children attending school.  Her business is selling traditional Maya clothing - huipiles (blouses) as well as mats to cover appliances and tablecloths.  With her loan, Rosa plans to buy a variety of additional traditional clothing besides the huipiles.  She will buy chalinas (shawls), fajas (belts) and cortes (skirts).  She feels that with the additional clothing, she will attract more customers.  Rosa is a good entrepreneurial business woman who sees the need to improve her income.  Therefore, she has sought out other markets where she can sell larger quantities of her clothing and now is selling in three different places. 

The members of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Luz de Vida” thank the Kiva lenders for the opportunity to grow as entrepreneurs.  They are also very grateful for the investors’ support of the Guatemalan women who are working to improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy a variety of additional traditional clothing, shawls,belts, skirts, as well as huipiles (blouses), for resale

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
PISEY, 21, lives in a small community of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she works in a souvenir shop and earns, on average, an earning of USD 3.00 a day. So far, she has been in this type of business for three years. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the well being and health of her family

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng,41, lives in a community in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has one child. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm that is located near her house. So far, she has been in his type of business for 14 years. On average, she is able to make an income of 4 USD a day. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Kuan, 30, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is a farther of three children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he is has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from HKL to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the health and welfare of his family

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support two children. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Jenelyn requested a 5,850 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Jenelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 47 years old and has seven children, three of whom are still in school. She is widowed.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rosita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 41 years old, married with three children.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Flora has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Flora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Noema

texts.en:
Noema is 36 years old and single with one child. Noema works very hard to provide for them.

Noema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, canned goods, spices, drinks, bread etc.

Noema has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, canned goods, spices, drinks, bread etc

loans.name: Maria Isolina

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer trabajadora, organizada y perseverante, dedicada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. 

Desde hace 3 años es comerciante independiente, tiene una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas cuenta con la ventaja de no tener mucha competencia, por lo que ya es reconocido por los diferentes ciudadanos que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando surtido en granos como frijol, lentejas, garbanzos, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. 

Maria manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para realizar mejoras a su vivienda en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who is organized, persevering, dedicated to her family, and passionate about her work. 

For the last three years, Maria has worked as an independent entrepreneur. She has a store located in the center of the city. She works 10-hour days there every day. She has the advantage of not having much competition because she is already known among the locals and has regular customers. 

With the support of this loan, Maria will build up her inventory by buying merchandise such as beans, lentils, garbanzo beans, and other items. This will allow her to have a bigger variety available to offer to her clients and increase sales.

Maria's biggest desire is to keep building up and accrediting her business because that will increase its profitability and give her the economic capacity to make some improvements to her home. This will let her enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store such as beans, lentils, garbanzo beans, and other items.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.en:
A $1000 is offered to Agueda to improve her business.She is married and  she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.She will buy some additional supplies such as  noodles,sugar, salt, milk, rice, biscuits and fish.She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Agueda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy noodles,sugar, salt, milk, rice, biscuits and fish

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer de 29 años de edad, soltera y con 3 hijos. 
Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por como útiles escolares, ropa, calzado y accesorios; esta actividad la inició con la motivación y el gusto por las ventas, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el su sustento. 

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de ropa para mujer para su almacén  con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes.

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 29-year-old woman who is single and has three children. She earns a living by selling school supplies such as clothing, shoes, and accessories. She began this business motivated by her love of sales and her business has allowed her to earn money to support her family.  

Liliana is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who desires to succeed and move forward with her business. 

She is requesting this loan with Corporación Interactuar because she wants to invest it to buy merchandise such as women's clothing for her store. She hopes to take this opportunity to increase her sales by offering more of a variety of products that will satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of her customers. 

Liliana's biggest dream is to have a large stock of merchandise and to expand her customer base and increase her sales. This will improve her well-being.

loans.use: to buy a supply of women's clothing for her store in order to be able to increase sales.

loans.name: Jenmalyn

texts.en:
Jenmalyn is 27 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jenmalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Jenmalyn has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Jo-Ann

texts.en:
Jo-ann is 28 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Jo-ann is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jo-ann has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Luzlyn

texts.en:
Luzlyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Luzlyn is 59 years old and has one child still in school.

Luzlyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Luzlyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Flores

texts.en:
Ma. Flores is 59 years old, married with four children.

Ma. Flores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Ma. Flores has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Flores aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lolita is 50 years old and has one child currently in school.

Lolita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business like cloth, zippers, thread, yarn, and needles and to do maintenance for her tailoring machine.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business like cloth, zippers, thread, yarn, and needles and do maintenance for her tailoring machine

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es:
Luis, de 69 años, inicio con un negocio de fotografía hace aproximadamente unos meses con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus convicciones.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cámara fotográfica profesional pues solo de este modo podrá atender eventos como matrimonios, bautizos, primeras comuniones, fiestas de quinceañeras, entre otros.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio.

Apoya a Luis para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Luis, 69 years old, opened a photography business a few months ago with the desire to find an activity that will generate income for him to be able to survive. 

At the moment, Luis is motivated to work tirelessly. He is requesting a loan in order to buy a professional camera that will allow him to photograph events such as wedding, baptisms, first communions, quinceañeras, and others. With this loan, he will be able to sustain his business. 

Support Luis so that he can continue working!

loans.use: to buy a professional camera for work.

loans.name: Tzancoton Group

texts.en:
Nahualá is in the Department (State) of Sololá in the Western Highlands of Guatemala.  The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tzancoton” is located here.   The seven members of the group (seen in the photo) proudly wear their traditional clothing.  They all have small businesses, such as animal husbandry and the production of fajas (belts), huipiles (blouses), cortes (skirts), and dress making. 

Manuela is the President of “Tzancoton”.  She is 59 years old, married and has three children.  Seeing the need to support her husband with additional income, Manuela decided to create her own business weaving huipiles and embroidering them.  She has created her own designs which appeal to her clients and have been profitable. 

Like so many Maya women in Guatemala, Manuela did not have access to an education.  Each day she has had to struggle to improve her small business.  With the new loan, she plans to buy raw material (yarns in many different colors and quality).  These yarns will help her business grow and earn extra profits.  The additional income will support her children’s education which she believes is the basis for their sound development. 

Thank you Kiva lenders for your generous support and helping those who are needy but have a desire to excel !!!

loans.use: To buy raw material (yarns in many different colors and quality) for her weaving and embroidery business.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es:
Magnolia, una mujer de 38 años de edad llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Victoria y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  

Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposo y 3 hijos.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 2 años con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Magnolia!
texts.en:
Magnolia is 38 years old and filled with dreams and aspirations in life. She lives on a farm in the municipality of Victoria and earns a living producing and selling chickens and eggs. With this work she supports her family, which includes her husband and three children. She has been working in this business for approximately two years in order to get ahead. 

Magnolia is requesting this financial support in order to buy chickens, laying hens, feed and materials for her barn. With this loan she will be able to have a more sustainable and consolidated business. 

With this loan that you make today you will improve Magnolia's business and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for her barn.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is 25 years old, with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maryjane runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Maryjane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use:
to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care
products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 49 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mabel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like drinks, coffee, milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, breads and other personal care products.

Mabel has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like drinks, coffee, milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, breads and other personal care products

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong, born in 1990, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of three members, including her husband, her son and her. They are now living in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and animal breeding, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and save a small amount. However, the saved amount is not enough for her to buy fertilizer for the coming crops of coffee and rice. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and is hoping that the loan amount will help her family have money to invest effectively in the coffee field for high productivity. Then the coffee field will bring her family an abundant crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Munkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtuya, 34 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband has been making and selling furniture for more than ten years. Due to success of her business, her family stopped living in a traditional Mongolian ger and moved into house. The house is old one and it needs some renovation. 

So she is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and planks. After renovation, her family will live in comfortable and warm place, meaning less coal burning for heating and less pollutants released into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house so as to burn less coal and cut down on pollution

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 35 years old and has three children. Guillerma is married and has three children who are in school.

Guillerma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Guillerma has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodogester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an 8 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Nhan, 24 years old, is a Thai-ethnic man. He currently lives with his wife and his lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

His family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding. The couple has moved to live separately with his parents after they got married and his parents gave them 1.3 hectare of cultivated land for coffee. The income from harvesting coffee after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. They have saved a small amount, but not enough to buy fertilizer for the coffee. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

He will work hard to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time and is hoping that the loan amount will help his family invest effectively in his coffee field, and then the coffee field will bring his family a yield as much as double last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anapaula

texts.en:
A $800 loan is offered to Anapaula to improve her business. Anapaula opened her second hand store in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, short sleeves and children's clothes. She is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, short sleeves and children's clothes

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.en:
Santa Lucia la Reforma is a community in the Department of Totonicapán in the highlands of Guatemala. Eight determined and hard-working women in the community have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Golondrinas” or “The Swallows”. The ladies began their Trust Bank two years ago and have invested their loans into various commercial endeavors including the sale of candles, beans, corn and vegetables. They are on their third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and Kiva.

The Treasurer of the Trust Bank is 30 year old Ana who is married with two children. Ana began to work making candles when she was only 14 years old and now that she has more responsibilities, she has taken the business to a higher level. With her income, she is able to help her husband to keep the household afloat. With her new loan, she plans to purchase wax, wick material and other supplies. Her candles are in demand in the community and she wants to have plenty of inventory on hand.

Ana and her friends in the Trust Bank learn to value and empower themselves in the monthly educational trainings at their meetings. Through role playing, pictures and games, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares useful information with the women about effective business practices, health, hygiene and self-esteem, as well as women’s rights, goals and dreams. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus”. Quite simply, it is very effective.

Kiva lenders play an important role for these women in providing capital for the loans. The ladies are most appreciative. Thank you, Kiva lenders for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase wax, wick material and other supplies to make candles

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
For more than 10 years now, Edna operates a sari-sari(variety) store, selling various commodities ranging from noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, soap and beverages. She is 52 year old married woman with four dependents ages 14-27 year old respectively.

She  is asking for a loan to buy  supplies like rice, feeds and gasoline.  These  will be keep her store full of stocks and could attract more buyers to come. Thus, her earnings will start to improve and enable her to provide her family with nutritious diets and continue send them to school. With these, she could start to save and able to do some expansion.

Edna is hoping that someday, she will become a successful entrepreneur and able to support the needs of her children as well.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, feeds and gasoline

loans.name: Elba

texts.en:
Elba is 38 years old and married with three children. With three children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Elba runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, etc.

Elba has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Ruby Lyn

texts.en:
Ruby Lyn is 30 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby Lyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, liquor, personal care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Ruby Lyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, liquor, personal care product and other groceries

loans.name: Carmen Emilia

texts.es:
Con su gran manera de trabajar, su amor por sus hijos, su convicción de salir adelante y la fe que tiene en sus sueños, Carmen ha tenido la fortaleza para trabajar en su finca con la cría de cerdos y pollos.

Esta es una actividad que le ha dado muchas oportunidades y que le ha permitido darle un sustento digno a su familia.

Hoy en día su actividad necesita un impulso considerable y que le servirá para mejorar su negocio, pues de este negocio puede tener el pan diario.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar cerdos para la cría y levante por eso que busca ayuda en los prestadores de kiva y en el apoyo de Interactuar.
texts.en:
With her great work ethic, her love for her children, her conviction to succeed and her faith in her dreams, Carmen has had the strength to work on her farm raising pigs and chickens. This activity has provided her many opportunities and has allowed her to provide a decent livelihood for her family.

Today this activity requires considerable momentum to move the business ahead, so that the business can provide the daily bread. With loan support, Carmen can buy pigs for breeding and raising. For this reason, she is requesting the help of Kiva lenders by way of Kiva partner Interactuar (Interact).

loans.use: buy pigs to breed and raise.
